title: Construction Accounting
description:
We’re hiring a Project Accountant to support construction, loan, and compliance operations across multiple affordable housing developments. If you’re detail-driven, good with documentation, and like work that has real impact, this is a strong long-term fit.



Why You’ll Love This Role



You will work directly with decision-makers — your work will be visible and valued.

You will help keep projects compliant, funded, and on schedule.

No bureaucracy, no busywork — your work directly moves projects forward.

Real room to grow into senior financial coordination or project support.



Your Typical Day

Organize and maintain project financial and compliance documentation.

Support the preparation of monthly construction draw requests.

Communicate with contractors to collect invoices, lien waivers, and documents.

Update budgets, change order logs, and payment tracking sheets.

Coordinate with lenders, accounting, and project managers as needed.



What You’ll Be Doing



1) Loan & Draw Support

Compile lien waivers, invoices, schedules, and supporting docs for draw packages.

Compare cost reports to contracts, change orders, and lender requirements.

Track soft costs (architect, engineering, inspections, interest, title, etc.).

Prepare clear, organized submission files for lenders.



2) Construction Financial Administration

Maintain digital project files (contracts, pay apps, insurance, permits, payrolls).

Track executed change orders against pay apps and budgets.

Monitor buyout logs, completion schedules, and compliance documents.

Follow up with contractors until documentation is accurate and complete.



3) General Coordination & Reporting

Maintain trackers, logs, and internal reports.

Prepare agendas, notes, and status reports for project meetings.

Communicate professionally with internal and external stakeholders.

Handle confidential financial data with discretion.



What We’re Looking For

2–4+ years in project accounting, construction admin, or loan/draw processing.

Familiarity with construction draws, budgets, or lender compliance preferred.

Proficiency in Excel and document management tools (Procore/Built/Buildertrend a bonus).

Extremely organized, detail-accurate, and accountable to deadlines.

Strong written and verbal communication skills.

Experience working for a US construction company or real-estate developer



Nice to Have

Experience in real estate development or affordable housing.

Knowledge of construction accounting.

Experience with billing using AIA G702/G703 forms.

Degree in Accounting, Construction Mgmt, Business, or related field.



TO APPLY: send a recording via 
 and answer these questions:

1.) What struck your interest about the role?

2.) Tell me about your experience in construction accounting?



SUBJECT: Construction Accounting - YOUR NAME



About Us



Atrium Housing is a mission-driven affordable housing developer with an affiliated construction company with offices in Louisiana, Florida and Texas. We don’t just build buildings — we create opportunities for families and communities. Our finance and construction teams work with lenders, contractors, and public partners to move projects from concept to completion.

title: Motion Designer (Dan Koe / Minimalist Animation Style)
description:
We are looking for a creative and disciplined Motion Designer to transform complex ideas into visually stunning, minimalist animated reels. The goal is to produce content that mirrors the "Dan Koe" aesthetic: clean lines, purposeful movement, grit/grain textures, and a focus on high-level concepts (business, mindset, and productivity).



This is a long-term project. We are looking for a partner who can grow with the brand, not just a one-off freelancer.



What You’ll Be Creating



Animated Reels videos from provided scripts and voiceovers.



Minimalist Assets: Designing vector shapes and typography that align with a "dark mode" or high-contrast aesthetic.



Snappy Motion: Implementing smooth transitions and micro-movements (using tools like Motion 4 or expressions) to keep retention high.



Sound Design: Adding subtle SFX (whooshes, paper crinkles, deep thuds) and grain textures to give the animation a premium, organic feel.



Required Skills & Qualifications



Expertise in Adobe After Effects: This is non-negotiable. You must understand how to animate shapes, paths, and typography.



Minimalist Eye: You understand the power of negative space. You don't over-complicate; you simplify.



Storytelling: Ability to take a script and "storyboard" the visual metaphors that best explain the concept.



Technical Setup: You own a machine capable of smooth After Effects rendering and have a reliable internet connection.



English Proficiency: High level of written English to ensure zero typos in animated text.



Bonus Points If You:



Use plugins like Motion 4, Overlord, or Flow.



Have experience with "Hand-drawn" or "Grit" texture overlays.



Are a fan of Dan Koe’s work or the "Creator Economy" niche.



How To Apply



To ensure you’ve read this and have the specific eye we need, please:



Portfolio Link: Specifically highlight any minimalist or vector-based motion design. If you have Dan Koe-style samples, put them at the top.



Software: Confirm you are proficient in After Effects and Illustrator.



The "Secret" Word: Start your application with the word "MINIMAL" so I know you read the full description.

title: AI Operations Specialist & E-commerce Consultant (CS Automation)
description:
We are a growing e-commerce drop shipping brand looking to automate our customer service operations using AI. Currently, we utilize Re:amaze (unintegrated), but we are at a crossroads. We need a specialist who can audit our current setup and provide a high-level recommendation: Do we optimize and integrate our current tool, or migrate to a more robust AI-native platform like Gorgias or Intercom?



Once the tech stack is finalized, you will be responsible for the full technical implementation, ensuring our support system can resolve 60%+ of tickets autonomously.







PHASE 1: Audit & Strategy (Immediate Priority)

Tech Stack Audit: Evaluate our Shopify backend and current Re:amaze setup.

Recommendation Report: Present the most cost-effective and scalable path (Fix Re:amaze vs. Migrate to a new CRM).

Workflow Mapping: Identify the top 5 high-volume manual tasks (WISMO, returns, cancellations) and map out how AI will handle them.







PHASE 2: Implementation & Training

Deep Integration: Connect Shopify, shipping trackers (e.g., 17Track), and the chosen CRM to ensure the AI has real-time data access.

AI Training: Work with our Back-End Manager to feed our FAQs, SOPs, and brand voice into the AI Knowledge Base.

Action-Based Automation: Build logic-based flows that allow the AI to do work (e.g., process a refund if conditions are met), not just suggest text.

Quality Assurance: Set up a "Human-in-the-loop" testing phase to ensure 90%+ accuracy before going fully live.







REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

E-commerce AI Expertise: Proven track record of setting up AI automation for Shopify stores (ideally drop shipping).

Tool Agnostic: Expertise in multiple platforms (Gorgias, Zendesk, Intercom, or Re:amaze) to provide an unbiased recommendation.

Technical Logic: Experience with API integrations, Liquid variables, and automation tools like 
 or Zapier.

Language & Tone: Ability to prompt-engineer the AI to sound empathetic, professional, and human.

Results-Driven: Must be able to demonstrate how your previous builds reduced "First Response Time" and "Resolution Time."







HOW TO APPLY

To ensure your application is reviewed, please answer the following:



1. We are currently using Re:amaze without Shopify integration. In your experience, what are the top 3 technical limitations of Re:amaze compared to Gorgias or Zendesk when it comes to automated refund processing?

2. Can you share a specific example of an e-commerce automation you built that reduced human ticket volume by at least 30%? What tools did you use?

3. How would you set up a workflow to handle a 'Where is my order?' request where the tracking hasn't moved for 7 days? Walk us through the 'If/Then' logic you would use.

4. On a scale of 1-10, how comfortable are you with using 
, Zapier, or APIs to connect Shopify data to a CRM? (Provide one example of a custom connection you've made).

5. Based on our goal of migrating/optimizing and automating 50% of tickets, how many weeks do you typically need from 'Audit' to 'Live Launch'?

title: Senior Shopify Landing Page Developer
description:
We are looking for a senior-level Shopify Landing Page Developer who specializes in building high-converting, performance-driven landing pages within the Shopify ecosystem. This role is ideal for someone who combines strong front-end execution with a marketer’s mindset and can move fast without sacrificing quality.



You will work closely with the Marketing Director, Creative Team, and E-Commerce Manager to build landing pages for campaigns, funnels, and product launches using Shopify best practices.



Key Responsibilities



1 - Own the full build process for Shopify landing pages from wireframes to final publish

2 - Build fast, mobile-first pages using Shopify themes, Liquid, custom sections, and app integrations

3 - Collaborate with the Marketing Director on funnels, CRO strategies, and campaign landing pages

4 - Translate Figma or Canva designs into pixel-accurate Shopify pages

5 - Optimize pages for speed, SEO fundamentals, and user experience

6 - Maintain, update, and improve existing landing pages across multiple Shopify stores

7 - Troubleshoot layout issues, theme conflicts, and app compatibility problems

8 - Create reusable components, templates, and documentation to streamline future builds

9 - Implement tracking scripts, pixels, UTMs, and custom events when required

10 - Proactively recommend improvements to increase conversion rates and performance



Requirements



1 - 3+ years of hands-on experience building Shopify stores, landing pages, or custom themes

2 - Strong proficiency in Shopify Liquid, custom sections, CSS, and responsive design

3 - Experience working with marketing teams on direct-response pages, funnels, and CRO initiatives

4 - Solid understanding of Shopify apps, metafields, variants, and theme architecture

5 - High attention to detail across layouts, spacing, and design consistency

6 - Ability to manage multiple page builds and deadlines in a fast-moving environment

7 - Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate closely with designers and marketers

8 - Experience optimizing page speed, image compression, and clean front-end code



Preferred but Not Required



1 - Experience working from Figma files and structured design handoffs

2 - Experience with advanced Liquid logic or custom Shopify functionality

3 - Familiarity with tools such as Shogun, PageFly, Replo, or GemPages

title: Operations Manager for Lead Generation Agency (Growth Track to Director)
description:
Overview:



We are a fast-growing lead generation agency specialising in off-market outreach for business buyers.



The founder currently runs operations, delivery, reporting, and client communication. We are hiring an Operations Manager to take ownership of systems, team accountability, and client delivery.



This is not an admin role.

This is a leadership role with growth into Director level.



Your Core Mission:

Turn a founder-led operation into a structured, scalable system.



You Will Own:

- Documenting all processes and building SOPs

- Ensuring client chats are answered quickly

- Making sure orders are fulfilled on time

- Creating weekly KPI dashboards

- Managing the fulfilment team

- Identifying underperformers

- Improving systems using automation & AI

- Reducing founder dependency



Required Experience:

- 3+ years in agency operations

- Experience working in
 outreach / lead generation agencies

- Experience managing remote teams

- Building SOPs and systems

- KPI reporting and performance tracking

- Strong written and spoken English



Personality Fit:

- Direct communicator

- Comfortable confronting underperformance

- Strong decision maker

- High standards

- Not conflict avoidant

- Process obsessed



Salary

$1,000 – $2,000/month depending on experience

performance bonuses tied to retention and delivery metrics.



To apply, send:

1. A 2-minute Loom explaining how you would fix a messy agency operation

2. Your resume

3. Example dashboards or systems you’ve built

4. Your expected salary



Applications without Loom will not be reviewed. Please include the word SCALE in the first line of your application so we know you read this. Working hours will be 8am-6pm UK time.

title: Financial & Business Operations Associate (Part-Time | Surigao-Based | Growth Role)
description:
8–10 hours per week initially

Hybrid (On-site visits in Surigao required)

International-facing projects



About the Role



I am building and testing several early-stage business initiatives in the Philippines and am looking for a capable, analytical business professional to help evaluate and structure them.



The first project is a very small pig-breeding venture in Surigao City (currently three breeding sows). There is minimal formal financial tracking in place. Your first responsibility will be to determine:



Is this venture economically viable?



What are the true cost drivers?



Where are the inefficiencies?



Should this be scaled, improved, or discontinued?



This is not bookkeeping. This is business evaluation.



Additional Projects (Growth Opportunity)



Beyond the farm, I am exploring:



Creating structured focus group research systems for U.S. companies seeking insight into the emerging middle class in Southeast Asia (especially the Philippines)



Hiring and coordinating with an AI software developer for future initiatives



Building repeatable systems for evaluating small-scale ventures



Over time, this role may expand into light operations coordination, project structuring, and cross-border collaboration.



What You’ll Do



Visit the Surigao farm (likely weekly at first) to observe operations



Build simple but accurate financial tracking systems



Conduct cost and margin analysis



Provide honest assessments (even if the answer is “stop this project”)



Help structure new business experiments



Assist in organizing project workflows (experience with ClickUp or similar tools is a plus)



Work independently and report findings clearly



Who This Is Ideal For



This role is ideal for someone who:



Has a degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or Business



Has strong analytical thinking skills



Is comfortable making recommendations — not just reporting numbers



Has strong communication and people skills



Wants exposure to international and technology-related projects



Is interested in growing into a broader business operations role



CPA license is welcome but not required.



Location



Surigao City preferred.

Nearby applicants who can travel for regular site visits may apply.



On-site presence is important — this cannot be fully remote.



Compensation



This is a part-time role (8–10 hours per week to start).



Compensation will be based on experience and capability. As these are early-stage ventures, the budget reflects a growing operation rather than a large corporation.



Please include your expected hourly rate in your application.



Candidates who are primarily seeking high corporate compensation may not find this role suitable. Candidates who are interested in responsibility, autonomy, and long-term growth will be strongly considered.



How to Apply



Please send:



Your resume



Your location



Your expected hourly rate



A short paragraph explaining why this type of early-stage role interests you



: 



If you are analytical, practical, and interested in helping build real ventures from the ground up, I would be glad to speak with you.

title: Social Media Specialist
description:

Work From Anywhere | Join a Fast-Growing Real Estate Company



We’re looking for a creative and strategic Social Media Specialist to build and execute a company-wide social media strategy, create engaging content, and turn online engagement into real leads for our sales team. Real estate experience is a plus, but not required.



*About the Role

In this role, you will lead the development and execution of our company-wide social media strategy, create and schedule intentional content, actively manage engagement across all platforms, and generate qualified leads for the sales team. You will play a key role in strengthening brand presence, growing audiences, and driving inbound opportunities through social media.

, Instagram, TikTok, and LinkedIn

*Compensation

*Benefits Package  (Applicable once the employee is regularized after the probationary period)

* How to Apply Please submit:

Ready to grow with us?

Apply now and join SV Ventures — where data-driven insights power smart decisions.

title: Remote Inside Sales Agent (Full-Time, PST Hours)
description:
**Work From Anywhere | Join a Fast-Growing Real Estate Investment Firm**



Are you a persuasive communicator who thrives in inside sales? Do you enjoy qualifying leads, setting high-quality appointments, and driving deals forward through consistent follow-up?



If you’re looking for a long-term remote career with a company that values growth, accountability, and integrity — this opportunity is for you.



About the Role

Position: Inside Sales Agent (ISA)

Location: Anywhere – 100% Remote

Schedule: Monday–Friday, 8:00 AM–5:00 PM Pacific Time

(Occasional weekend work up to 4 hours)

Work Hours: 40 hours/week



As an Inside Sales Agent, you’ll be the frontline sales professional responsible for handling inbound and outbound leads, qualifying motivated sellers, and setting appointments for our acquisitions team. You’ll play a critical role in driving revenue by ensuring only high-quality opportunities move forward.



You’ll work closely with a supportive, performance-driven team that values consistency, ownership, and continuous improvement.



Qualifications & Requirements 

* Minimum 6 months of experience as an Inside Sales Agent (REQUIRED)

* Experience handling high-volume inbound and outbound calls

* Background in real estate, wholesaling, acquisitions, or property sales is a strong plus

* Proven ability to qualify leads, uncover motivation, and handle objections

* Confident, professional, and persuasive phone presence

* Excellent English communication skills (clear, neutral accent preferred)

* Strong follow-up skills and ability to nurture leads over time

* Comfortable working with CRM systems, dialers, and lead management tools

* Highly organized, detail-oriented, and consistent with data entry and notes

* Self-motivated, reliable, and able to hit daily/weekly call and appointment targets

* Team-oriented mindset with a strong sense of accountability

* Positive attitude and genuine interest in building rapport and long-term relationships





Technical Requirements

* Reliable high-speed internet (minimum 50 Mbps) with backup connection

* Reliable laptop/desktop and smartphone

* Quiet, distraction-free workspace suitable for sales calls





About SV Ventures

SV Ventures is a California-based real estate investment firm specializing in residential fix-and-flip projects and new construction throughout the Bay Area. We manage the full lifecycle — acquisitions, design, renovations, and financing — and we’re growing rapidly.



Our culture is built on strong core values:

-Growth Mindset – We learn, adapt, and improve continuously

-Accountability – We take ownership and deliver results

-Relationships – We build trust through every interaction

-Transparency – We value honesty, integrity, and clear communication



If these values resonate with you, you’ll feel right at home here.



Compensation & Benefits

-Hourly Rate: $6–8/hour (based on experience)

-3th Month Pay Bonus (with the opportunity to earn beyond for exceptional performance)

-Property Sale Bonus: $50 per property sold (Average: 12–20 properties per year)

-Bi-weekly Pay

-Long-term, stable remote position with growth opportunities





How to Apply

Please submit the following:



1. Resume (PDF or Word format)

2. Screenshot of Internet Speed Test

3. Computer Specs (make, model, RAM, storage, year of manufacture)

4. 3-minute video (Loom or YouTube only) answering:

      -Tell us about yourself — your experience, education, and why you’re a strong fit for an Inside Sales Agent role

      -What do you believe are the most important qualities of a successful Inside Sales Agent?





Ready to grow with us?

Apply now and become part of a team that values your success as much as its own.



Join SV Ventures — where growth, accountability, and opportunity meet.

title: Senior .NET Developer – OpenClaw / Claude Code Agentic Systems (Remote - Fulltime)
description:
Developer – OpenClaw / Claude Code Agentic Systems (Remote - Fulltime)





Company: 



Who We Are

At GMU.online, we don't just build software; we engineer autonomous systems. We are a technology company that builds scalable, managed SaaS solutions for e-commerce, driven by proprietary AI and automation. Our mission is to replace manual workflows with intelligent, self-executing agentic processes. We are running our business with a long-term, elite Agentic Dev Team to push the boundaries of what's possible with AI-driven development and operations.



 The Role: Architect of Autonomous Agents

We are looking for a 
 Developer with a rare and proven specialization: building and deploying production-level OpenClaw agents. This is not a traditional development role. You will not be writing routine CRUD applications. Instead, you will design, train, and deploy autonomous agentic workflows that handle complex, multi-step processes—from data analysis and code generation to fully automated outreach and system optimization—without human intervention.



You will work at the frontier of software development, 
 backends with the decision-making power of large language models (LLMs) to create software that actively works for us.



 Your Core Mission: Agentic Process Automation (APA)

You have deep experience with the OpenClaw & Claude Code ecosystem. You understand that an agent is more than a script; it is a goal-oriented, self-correcting system. You will be responsible for:



Architecting and deploying autonomous agents that execute complex, multi-day workflows (similar to complex cold outreach sequences, data enrichment pipelines, or automated code refactoring tasks).



Designing the Orgestrator "agent brain", the prompts, decision trees, and tool definitions that allow Claude Code to interact with 
 backend, APIs, and external services.



Building the feedback loops and memory systems that enable agents to learn from successes and failures, improving over time.



 Technical Requirements: Non-Negotiable Expertise

This role requires a specific and rare combination of deep traditional development skills and bleeding-edge AI agent experience.



1. 
 Engineering (8+ Years)




 (8+ years): Expert-level proficiency in C#, .NET 6/8+, ASP.NET Core, and Entity Framework Core. You understand the runtime, memory management, and asynchronous programming patterns intimately.



System Architecture: Proven ability to design scalable, resilient, and maintainable backend systems, often involving complex integrations with databases (SQL Server, PostgreSQL), message queues, and RESTful APIs.



2. OpenClaw / Claude Code Agentic Development (1+ Years)



Mandatory Proven Experience: This is the core of the role. You must have a minimum of 1.5 years of hands-on experience building and deploying production-level agents using the OpenClaw & Claude Code.



Agentic Workflow Design: You can demonstrate experience designing fully automated, agentic processes that run for extended periods (hours or days) and involve multiple steps, conditional logic, and external tool use. This includes managing the agent's context window, state, and error handling.



LLM Integration: Deep understanding of how to effectively prompt and constrain Claude (or similar LLMs) to reliably execute tasks, call functions (tool use), and parse structured output for integration 
 systems.



 What You Must Demonstrate

We will select candidates based on demonstrable, verifiable experience. In your video interview, you must be prepared to show, not just tell.



Live Project Walkthrough: You will be asked to share your screen and walk us through multiple complex, autonomous OpenClaw agent projects you have built and deployed independently.



Code & Architecture Review: We will want to see the architecture of your agents—how you structured the prompts, the tools you gave them, and how they interact with backend services.



Results & Outcomes: Show us the output. What did your agents achieve? Was it automated code generation, a full-scale outreach campaign, data processing, or system maintenance? What were the success metrics?



Your Technical Toolkit

Languages & Frameworks: C#, .NET (6/8+), ASP.NET Core.



Agentic AI: OpenClaw, Claude Code (Anthropic API) , prompt engineering, tool use/function calling, context window management.



Databases & Messaging: SQL Server, PostgreSQL, Entity Framework Core, RabbitMQ/Kafka (or similar).



DevOps & Infrastructure: Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD (GitHub Actions/Azure DevOps), cloud platforms (Azure/AWS).



APIs & Integrations: RESTful design, experience integrating with various third-party APIs (e.g.,
, CRM, data enrichment services) to give your agents tools.



What Sets You Apart (The Elite Factor)

Published Work: You have live & running Openclaw agentic systems that you can show.



Advanced Agent Patterns: Experience with multi-agent systems (where agents collaborate), or agents with long-ter
mory/vector database integration.



Performance Optimization: You understand the cost/performance trade-offs of LLM calls and optimize agent workflows for both speed and token efficiency.



 Why Join GMU.online?

Build the Future, Not Legacy Code: Work on the absolute cutting edge of software development—autonomous AI agents.



Elite Team: You will be surrounded by and collaborate with other top-tier developers who are also pushing the boundaries of AI and automation.



Long-Term Vision: This is a long-term role in a dedicated Agentic Dev Team, not a short-term project. You will have the stability and support to build ambitious, complex systems over time.



Full Ownership & Autonomy: High trust and high freedom. You own your agents from conception to deployment and monitoring.



Global Collaboration: Work remotely with a team of international experts who value async communication, clear ownership, and groundbreaking results over micromanagement.



Ready to build the software that builds itself? If you have the proven track record, apply now and be prepared to show us your agents in action.

title: Virtual Assistant – Recruitment & Hiring Support for Sporticulture
description:
Sporticulture is a licensed NFL and professional sports product company selling on Amazon, Fanatics, and through wholesale channels. 



We are currently hiring multiple tea
mbers and need a part-time Virtual Assistant to help assist with our recruitment process.



This role is focused on screening, organizing, ranking applicants and possibly doing pre-liminary interviews.

Screen resumes and portfolios



Access video interviews and evaluate spoken English and communication ability



Summarize candidates using AI tools



Rank applicants using a structured scoring system



Organize hiring pipeline



Coordinate test projects



Help improve and document our hiring process

Strong spoken and written English



Confident speaking on Zoom



Highly organized



Detail-oriented



Comfortable using AI tools



Able to work independently



Reliable internet connection



Schedule:



Part-time flexible (10–20+ hours per week during active hiring periods) There will be many weeks we are not hiring and their won't be any hours unless you fit into another role outside of hiring. Up front we will be making quite a few hires so could be 20-40 hours for the first couple months.



Compensation:



Competitive pay based on experience

(Typically range: $4–$6/hour starting)

title: ? WALLBUDDY — AMAZON PPC SPECIALIST (Senior Role)
description:
? WALLBUDDY — AMAZON PPC SPECIALIST (Senior Role)



$200–$230 USD per week · Full-Time · Long-Term · VIDEO APPLICATION REQUIRED



Wallbuddy is a fast-growing global wall art brand selling thousands of premium posters and framed prints across Amazon US, Canada, UK, Germany, France, and Italy. We are expanding rapidly, and we are now hiring a high-level Amazon PPC Specialist to own and scale our advertising operations.



This is NOT an entry-level role.

This is NOT a VA position.

This is for someone who lives and breathes Amazon PPC and can deliver measurable results from week one.



If you have deep experience managing PPC with real budgets, improving TACOS, scaling revenue, and running complex campaign structures — this is the best opportunity you will find on OnlineJobs.ph.



???? Your Mission



You will take full ownership of Wallbuddy’s Amazon PPC system across all marketplaces.



First 60–90 Days



Fix inefficient campaigns



Reduce wasted spend



Rebuild correct campaign structures



Improve TACOS and stabilize profitability



Improve ranking for priority SKUs



Establish weekly reporting and workflow



Ongoing



Scale profitable campaigns



Harvest and expand winning keywords



Plan and execute ranking campaigns



Optimize placements, bids, dayparting



Support new product launches weekly



Work directly with the CEO to hit growth targets



Train one junior VA to assist with bulk work



???? Core Responsibilities

1. Full PPC Management



You will personally handle:



Sponsored Products



Sponsored Brands



Sponsored Display



Keyword research + keyword harvesting



Bid management & placement optimisation



Budget allocation



Ranking campaigns



Negative keywords



Weekly PPC KPI reporting



2. Amazon Growth Execution



You will collaborate on:



New product launches (FBA + FBM)



Organic ranking improvements



Listing/testing ideas (images, titles, A+)



Competitor research



Sales growth strategy



3. AI-Enhanced Advertising



We expect you to use:



Bulk file optimization



Automation scripts (optional)



AI tools for keyword expansion and data analysis



? Requirements (Non-Negotiable)

? Minimum 2–3 years Amazon PPC experience (not VA experience)

? You know how to build SP, SB, SD campaigns properly

? You can show real data/screenshots of results you achieved

? Strong analytical and Excel/bulk file skills

? Excellent English communication

? You can work full-time and independently

? You can record a 2–3 minute video answering the mandatory questions



? Do NOT Apply If…



You are only a VA with minor PPC exposure



You have never personally managed PPC budgets



You cannot show proof of results



You cannot record a video



You will rely on ChatGPT to answer questions



You are not confident optimizing daily PPC spend



This role is for a true PPC operator.



???? MANDATORY VIDEO APPLICATION (2–3 minutes)

*Applications without a video will be rejected automatically.

Please record a video answering (verbally, unscripted):



1?? What was the biggest TACOS reduction you achieved? Give real numbers.

2?? Explain your PPC campaign structure philosophy for medium/large catalogs.

3?? Show an example of when you scaled revenue successfully through PPC.

4?? Find the Wallbuddy brand on 
 and make 1 PPC strategy that you would implement straight away to this brand? Mention 1 or 2 of our products in your answer.



Upload via YouTube (unlisted), Loom, or Google Drive.



???? Required Proof of Experience



Attach:

Screenshots of PPC campaigns you managed

Before/after improvements you achieved

A short explanation of what YOU did to make those improvements



Your resume



???? Salary & Benefits



$200–$250 per week (based on experience)

Paid weekly.



Additional:



Paid Philippine holidays

Vacation + sick leave after probation

Long-term, stable position

Work directly with CEO

Opportunity for future bonuses based on performance (13th Month in December)



???? How to Apply

 or submit via OnlineJobs.ph with the subject line:

WALLBUDDY PPC SPECIALIST — Your Name — VIDEO SUBMITTED



Your application must include:

Video link (mandatory)

Screenshots proving PPC results

Short summary of Amazon PPC experience



Resume

Applications missing ANY required element will be ignored.



???? Why This Role Is Special

You have full ownership, not micro-management

title: Junior Digital Marketing Strategist
description:
Job Title: Junior Digital Marketing Strategist

Location: Remote

Employment Type: Full-Time



About the Role

We are looking for a proactive and versatile Junior Digital Marketing Strategist to support multiple client accounts across various industries.

This is a cross-channel role suited to someone who understands how different areas of digital marketing connect. You do not need to be a senior specialist in every platform — but you must have strong foundational knowledge across digital marketing and be able to:



Understand how campaigns work across platforms

Identify performance issues

Research and recommend solutions

Execute tasks with guidance

Think beyond execution and contribute strategically



Key Responsibilities

1. Paid Media & Performance Marketing

Assist with Google Ads setup and optimization (Search, Display, Performance Max)

Support Meta Ads campaign builds and monitoring

Conduct keyword research and competitor research

Monitor campaign KPIs and suggest optimization improvements

Ensure conversion tracking is properly implemented

2.
 Marketing & Automation

Build and schedule campaigns (Mailchimp, Klaviyo, HubSpot or similar)

Set up and manage automation flows (welcome, nurture, abandoned cart)

Segment lists and monitor performance metrics

Identify ways to improve open rates, CTR, and conversions

3. Social Media & Content Support

Assist with content planning and scheduling

Support short-form video editing (basic level)

Monitor engagement metrics

Identify growth and optimization opportunitis

Align content with broader campaign strategy

4. Website & eCommerce Support

Manage and update websites on:

Shopify

WooCommerce

WordPress

Webflow (advantageous)

Support product uploads, collections, and merchandising

Assist with landing page builds

Identify UX and conversion rate optimization opportunities

Implement and check tracking (GA4, Meta Pixel, Google Ads conversion tracking)

Support Google Merchant Center where applicable

5. Analytics & Reporting

Pull performance data from GA4, Google Ads, and Meta

Assist in preparing performance reports

Identify trends and improvement opportunities

Flag technical or tracking issues



6. Design & Creative Support

Create basic assets using Canva or Adobe tools

Ensure brand consistency across channels

Brief designers when advanced creative is required

Support creative testing initiatives

7. Research & Problem Solving

Stay updated on platform changes and digital trends

Research solutions to campaign or website performance issues

Proactively suggest improvements

Contribute to strategy discussions



Required Experience & Skills

Experience

1–3 years experience in digital marketing

Exposure to multiple digital channels

Experience working on more than one account or brand preferred

Technical Knowledge (Foundational Level Required)

Google Ads (basic setup and optimization)

Meta Ads

 marketing platforms

Shopify and/or WooCommerce

WordPress CMS

GA4 basics

Basic SEO understanding

Understanding of digital funnels and conversion principles



Soft Skills

High initiative and ownership mindset

Strong problem-solving ability

Analytical thinker

Organized and detail-oriented

Able to manage multiple projects and deadlines

Strong communication skills

Comfortable in a fast-paced environment

Eager to learn and grow



How to apply: Send us your CV, Intro Video & Whatsapp number please keep your lines open

title: Remote Call Centre Manager
description:
Please apply via this link: 



Remote Call Centre Manager



Sales & Marketing



About Us:

Aesthetic Acquisition helps med spas grow by handling the entire patient acquisition process — from ads and lead qualification to appointment setting. Our call centre is the engine that converts leads into **pre-deposited, paying patients**, not just enquiries.



Role Overview

We are looking for a Call Centre Manager to own and scale our appointment-setting department. This is a senior leadership role focused on performance, accountability, and execution.



You will be fully accountable for:



* Hiring & training high-performing Tele-Closers

* Execution of daily operations

* KPI tracking and performance improvement

* Quality control & script adherence

* Coaching and team development





Call Centre Operations



* Enforce speed-to-lead (within 5 minutes)

* Ensure follow-up sequences (Day 1–7)

* Accurate deposit taking & calendar booking

* Maintain clean pipelines & CRM hygiene

* Monitor shift coverage, punctuality & attendance

* Ensure strict script adherence, tone & brand standards



Team Performance & Management



* Track KPIs for each Tele-Closer

* Daily coaching & feedback

* Weekly performance reviews

* Roleplays & objection-handling drills

* Enforce non-negotiables

* Develop low performers & elevate top performers



Hiring & Training:



* Source, screen & interview candidates

* Onboard & certify CSRs on scripts, processes, tone & objections

* Ensure independent execution before going live



Quality Control



* Enforce professional standards on every call

* Scripts followed word-for-word

* Correct deposit handling

* Professional client communication



Internal Communication



* Act as liaison between Tele-Closers, Marketing, and Client Success

* Escalate lead quality, volume issues & clinic-side concerns

* Share insights for performance reviews





Who We’re Looking For:



* Proven experience managing a call centre, appointment-setting team, or sales floor

* Strong leadership, accountability & operational discipline

* KPI-focused with attention to detail

* Confident enforcing standards & coaching teams

* Comfortable with difficult conversations

* Experience in high-volume lead environments (preferred)



Why Join Aesthetic Acquisition



* Senior leadership role with full ownership

* Clear systems & expectations

* Direct impact on client results & company growth

* Performance-driven, growth-focused culture



How to Apply:

Please submit:



1. A detailed game plan for hiring, training, managing, and improving a call centre team

2. Your implementation plan — what you would physically do Day 1, Week 1, and Month 1

3. Your sales script training process — mock calls, line-by-line feedback, roleplays, and coaching methodology



We’re looking for someone who can build, scale, and run a high-performing appointment-setting team. Average applicants need not apply.



Please apply via this link:

title: Apex Futures Mentor (Payout Proven) – Manage & Train 2 Scholars | Makati Hybrid
description:
Company: Nonprofit NGO Trading Group

Location: Philippines Only (Makati/Manila preferred)

Work Style: Hybrid (In-person + Virtual)

• Makati in-person: 3x/week, 4–5 hours/day

• Other days: virtual monitoring/coaching

• Mostly evenings (PH time) | Mon–Fri

Salary: PHP 6,500/month (can go up if traders progress and produce payouts in coming months)





Mission



We’re a nonprofit NGO using disciplined FUTURES trading to help fund charitable programs. This role is for someone who wants to mentor with purpose, structure, accountability, and real trader development.







Who We Need



We’re hiring a FUTURES Mentor + Manager to oversee two scholar traders, primarily trading NASDAQ futures (NQ).



There are many traders who “know how to trade.” What we need is someone who knows how to get to payout under prop firm rules, especially Apex trailing drawdown, and can teach that process step-by-step.



If you only know Forex, do not apply.





What You’ll Be Responsible For



You will be accountable for the growth and progress of two traders:

• Monitor trades daily (execution, entries/exits, discipline)

• Track and review P&L and account progression

• Ensure strict rule compliance (no gambling, no over-risking)

• Teach and enforce futures prop rules, especially:

• Apex Trader Funding (Top Priority – Futures Only)

• Trailing drawdown management

• Daily loss limits / risk limits

• Consistency rules and payout readiness

• Deliver structured feedback and improvement plans

• Keep both traders accountable

• Send daily progress updates to the nonprofit team





Minimum Qualifications (Strict)



Apply only if you meet ALL of the following:

• 2+ years professional FUTURES trading experience

• Real experience with Apex funded accounts

• At least one verified payout from Apex (or similar futures prop firm)

• Proof required (screenshot OK)

• Can clearly teach:

• Trailing drawdown

• Risk management & consistency rules

• Compliance + payout preparation

• Can commit to in-person Makati mentoring 3x/week (4–5 hours/day)





Disqualifiers



Do not apply if:

• You only trade Forex

• You cannot show proof of payout/funded results

• You use martingale, revenge trading, or other high-risk methods



 FUTURES ONLY. NOT Forex.



Apply via WhatsApp Only



Message Michelle on WhatsApp:


Send:

1. Short resume / background

2. Proof of futures trading experience

3. Proof of at least one payout (screenshot OK)

4. Apex + other prop firm experience

5. Availability confirmation (Makati 3x/week + evenings)

title: DESIGNER / WEB DESIGNER
description:
Are you the talented and motivated Web Designer we’re looking for?



Are you a highly creative designer with a strong understanding of modern web design best practices, Figma, and WordPress? Do you love transforming ideas into polished, high-performing digital experiences?

If you’re someone who brings fresh ideas, executes quickly, and has a passion for beautiful, functional design, this could be your next dream role.



Milkyway is a digital agency dedicated to helping businesses grow through powerful branding, strategic design, and smart digital solutions. We partner with founders, small business owners, and established brands to elevate the way they show up online.

We’re growing quickly, and we’re looking for a Web Designer who can help us deliver exceptional creative work for our clients.



ABOUT YOU

The ideal person wants to grow with us and contribute to a high-performing, creative team.

You are:



• Highly creative with a strong eye for design.

• Confident using Figma for web layouts, wireframing, and UI concepts.

• Experienced with WordPress and Elementor, capable of handling updates and building beautiful layouts.

• Strong in Adobe Photoshop (and ideally Illustrator) and comfortable using Canva for fast-turnaround production.

• Proactive, always bringing ideas and suggestions to the table.

• Able to take a brief and run with it, delivering high-quality designs quickly.

• Organised, reliable, and committed to accuracy and detail.

• A natural problem solver who stays calm under pressure.

• Able to communicate clearly and work collaboratively with a team.

• Someone who cares deeply about producing great work and continuously improving.



If you thrive in a creative, fast-paced environment and want to be part of a growing agency, you’ll fit right in.



ABOUT THE ROLE

This role reports directly to the founder and works closely with our delivery and operations team.

Your key responsibilities include:

• Designing website layouts, UI elements, and digital assets using Figma.

• Executing high-quality web design builds and updates in WordPress (Elementor expertise essential).

• Creating design assets, including
 creatives, banners, social media graphics, and image-based web content.

• Supporting and creating branding design, assisting in the development of brand identity for new and refreshed business brands.

• Handling basic WordPress maintenance, content updates, and visual improvements.

• Managing design files and maintaining organised systems across Figma, Adobe and Canva.

• Bringing creative ideas to every tea
eting, review, and client project.

• Ensuring all design-related output is delivered accurately, on time, and aligned with client briefs.





This is a remote position, ideally suited to someone who can work Australian Brisbane business hours or close to this timezone.

We want someone who is excited to grow with us and become an integral part of our creative team. It needs to be a genuine yes from both sides.



WHAT YOU’LL GET WHEN YOU JOIN MILKYWAY

A company culture that values integrity, creativity, continuous improvement, and doing great work. We love working with talented people who care about what they do and want to build something meaningful.



You’ll enjoy:

• A collaborative, supportive team environment.

• Clear systems, structure, and expectations to help you succeed.

• Opportunities to grow your design, UX/UI, and digital knowledge.

• The chance to work on a range of creative projects across different industries.

• Training and support when onboarding to ensure you’re confident in your role.

• Flexibility and trust in how you manage your work.



We believe in building long-term relationships with both clients and tea
mbers. When you grow, we grow.



HOW TO APPLY

If you think this role was made for you, we’d love to hear from you.

Apply the phrase “Stardust” creatively in the final section of the application so we know you read this ad in full.

Add your portfolio and resume on your application



If you know someone who would be a great fit, please pass this opportunity on.

We look forward to meeting the next creative who will help us take our clients’ brands and websites to the next level.

title: CONTENT SPECIALIST
description:
Are you the creative and strategic Content Specialist we’re looking for?



Are you a strong writer who loves turning ideas into clear, compelling content that actually performs? Do you enjoy planning content, refining brand voice, and using data to improve results?



If you’re passionate about content that drives growth, confident working across multiple channels, and always looking for ways to improve your craft, this could be the role for you.



Milkyway is a digital agency helping businesses grow through strategy, branding, websites, content, and digital marketing. We work closely with our clients to bring clarity to their messaging and consistency to how they show up online.

We’re growing quickly and are now looking for a Content Specialist to join our team.



ABOUT YOU

The ideal person wants to grow with us, take ownership of content quality, and help elevate how our clients communicate.

You are:

• A confident writer with strong attention to detail.

• Comfortable creating content across websites, social media,
 marketing, SEO, and ads.

 marketing content aligned to brand voice.

WHAT YOU’LL GET WHEN YOU JOIN MILKYWAY

A supportive, growth-focused environment where your writing and ideas genuinely matter.

You’ll enjoy:

• A collaborative and professional team culture.

• Clear systems and processes to support high-quality work.

• Training and onboarding to help you succeed in the role.

• Opportunities to develop your skills across content, SEO, and strategy.

• Exposure to a wide range of industries and content types.

• Flexibility and trust in how you manage your work.

• We believe great content drives great outcomes — for our clients and our team.



HOW TO APPLY

If this role sounds like a strong fit, we’d love to hear from you.

Add a link for your portfolio and Resume.



If you know someone who would be a great fit, please pass this opportunity on.

We look forward to meeting the Content Specialist who will help take our clients’ messaging and performance to the next level.

title: VIRTUAL ASSISTANT /  CLIENT SUCCESS & OPERATIONS COORDINATOR
description:
Are you the motivated and resourceful Virtual Assistant / Client Success & Operations Coordinator we are looking for?

Do you love organising, supporting clients, and keeping operations running smoothly? Are you confident with digital tools, proactive with communication, and quick to learn new systems?



If you’re someone who thrives on structure, loves helping others succeed, and enjoys being the organised backbone of a growing digital agency, then this might be the perfect role for you.



Milkyway is a digital agency helping businesses grow through strategy, branding, websites, content, and digital marketing. We partner closely with our clients, and exceptional communication and organisation are at the heart of how we deliver our services.



We’re expanding, and we’re looking for a Virtual Assistant / Client Success & Operations Coordinator to join our team.



ABOUT YOU

The ideal person wants to grow with us, bring structure to our operations, and help create a world-class client experience.

You are:

• Smart, fast, confident, and exceptionally organised.

• Able to manage calendars, appointments, and workflows with precision.

• A strong communicator who writes clearly and professionally.

• Comfortable supporting clients and answering their questions with care.

• Accountable, reliable, and always on top of follow-through.

• Proactive and resourceful, able to anticipate needs and solve problems early.

• A lightning-fast learner who enjoys mastering new systems.

• Experienced in handling online communication and digital admin tasks.

• If you are highly organised, love supporting others, and want to work in a digital-first environment, you’ll excel in this role.



ABOUT THE ROLE

The Virtual Assistant / Client Success & Operations Coordinator reports directly to the agency owner and works closely with the delivery team.



You will:

• Create simple Canva assets when needed for client updates or internal use.

• Keep internal processes organised and up to date to support smooth operations.

• Ensure clients feel supported, informed, and taken care of at all times.



This is a remote position, ideally operating within or close to Australian (Brisbane) business hours.

We are looking for someone who wants to be part of a growing team and contribute meaningfully to the success of our clients and operations. It must be a definite yes from both sides.



WHAT YOU’LL GET WHEN YOU JOIN MILKYWAY

A supportive, growth-focused environment where your ideas and organisational strengths make a real difference.

You’ll enjoy:



• A positive and collaborative team culture.

• Clear processes and expectations designed to set you up for success.

• Training and onboarding to help you confidently step into the role.

• Opportunities to grow professionally in client success, operations, and digital systems.

• Flexibility and autonomy in your work, with trust from day one.

• Exposure to a wide range of digital tools and modern agency systems.

• We believe in empowering both our clients and our team. When you thrive, so do we.



HOW TO APPLY

Click the link to apply and include a phrase containing “Stardust” in the final section 

of the application form so we know you read this ad in full.




kywaydigital.agency/ops-va



If you know someone who would be a great fit, please share this opportunity with them.

	•	You use martingale, revenge trading, or other high-risk methods



 FUTURES ONLY. NOT Forex.







Apply via WhatsApp Only



Message Michelle on WhatsApp:


Send:

	1.	Short resume / background

	2.	Proof of futures trading experience

	3.	Proof of at least one payout (screenshot OK)

	4.	Apex + other prop firm experience

	5.	Availability confirmation (Makati 3x/week + evenings)

title: Finance & Accounting Setup Specialist (Project-Based, Remote)
description:
I am the Founder & Lightkeeper of Go Travel Community, a purpose-driven travel startup preparing for launch.



We are building a structured, scalable accounting foundation before growth accelerates. This is a short-term project role for a finance and accounting professional who can help design and implement our accounting infrastructure correctly from the beginning.



The goal is to set up QuickBooks properly, organize financial workflows, and create clean systems that my Executive Assistant will maintain after the project is completed.



This is not a bookkeeping maintenance role.

This is a build-the-foundation role.



I am looking to hire immediately.



Project Scope & Responsibilities:



QuickBooks Infrastructure Setup



• Configure QuickBooks Online for a travel startup

• Build a clean chart of accounts tailored to travel services, memberships, commissions, and contractor payouts

• Properly categorize revenue streams (memberships, booking fees, Airbnb management, advisor splits)

• Configure expense tracking structure

• Set up recurring invoices and payment tracking (Stripe integration awareness helpful)



Systems & Financial Workflow Design



• Create clear documentation for monthly bookkeeping processes

• Build workflows for tracking travel advisor commissions

• Establish reconciliation procedures

• Create simple reporting dashboards for:

 • Revenue by category

 • Contractor payouts

 • Profit tracking

 • Donation allocation (10% giveback model)



Documentation & Handoff



• Provide step-by-step documentation

• Record Loom videos explaining processes

• Train Executive Assistant on ongoing maintenance

• Ensure systems are clean, scalable, and easy to maintain



Required Skills:



• QuickBooks Online setup & configuration

• Accounting systems implementation

• Chart of accounts design

• Reconciliation procedures

• Strong Excel or Google Sheets skills

• Clear documentation and process building



Ideal Experience:



• Experience working with startups

• Familiarity with service-based businesses

• Experience working with commission-based models

• Understanding of contractor payouts

• Stripe or payment processor integration awareness



Required Traits:



• Highly structured and systems-minded

• Detail-oriented and organized

• Strong English communication

• Able to explain financial systems clearly

• Independent and solution-driven

• Available to begin immediately



Compensation:



• $4–$7 USD per hour based on experience

• Estimated 4–8 week project

• Flexible hours

• Potential for future project-based work



How to Apply (Important)



Please include:

 1. Your resume

 2. A short summary of your QuickBooks setup experience

 3. Example of a system you built for a business

 4. Your availability to begin

 5. Your internet speed

 6. One sentence: Why are you a good fit for building accounting systems from scratch?



Applications that do not follow instructions may not be reviewed.



About Go Travel Community:



Go Travel Community is a purpose-driven travel company built on one belief:



“We are not in business to make money. We are in business to make a difference. And when you focus on making a difference, the money will follow.”



We offer memberships, travel planning, and a Luminary Travel Advisor program where independent advisors earn commissions while giving back 10% of profits to nonprofits.



This role is about building the financial foundation that allows impact and growth to scale responsibly.



If you are detail-driven and enjoy building clean financial systems from the ground up, I would love to connect.

title: Ads Creative Director - Working for Agency / Paid Media
description:
SALLY SKOUFIS™ Jewelry



Location: Local hours required (aligned with our core team time zone)

Engagement Type: Project-Based / Workload Based on Availability

Department: Marketing & Creative



About Us



SALLY SKOUFIS™ Jewelry is a fast-growing global fashion brand known for bold design, elevated craftsmanship, and statement-making pieces worn worldwide. Our brand is scaling rapidly across digital platforms, and we are building a high-performance creative engine to support aggressive growth.



We have an exceptional in-house marketing team that moves fast, tests constantly, and executes at a global level. Now we’re looking for a Creative Director who can match that energy.



The Role



We are seeking a strategic and hands-on Creative Director with proven experience developing cutting-edge, compelling, and high-converting advertising campaigns for fast-growing fashion or lifestyle brands.



This is a project-based role, with workload determined by campaign cycles and brand initiatives. You must be available during local working hours for collaboration with our marketing and leadership teams.



Key Responsibilities



Lead the creative vision across paid media, digital campaigns, launches, and brand storytelling

Conceptualize and oversee high-performing ads (Meta, TikTok, YouTube, display, landing pages, etc.)

Translate performance data into creative direction that drives measurable conversion growth

Collaborate closely with performance marketing, content, and production teams

Direct photoshoots, video shoots, and campaign rollouts when required

Ensure brand consistency while pushing innovative and disruptive creative boundaries

Manage multiple projects simultaneously with tight deadlines

Oversee creative testing frameworks and iterate rapidly based on results



Required Experience



Must come from an agency background (performance marketing, digital creative, or fashion-focused agency preferred)

Proven track record of producing ads that convert at scale

Experience managing multiple clients or large volumes of projects simultaneously

Strong understanding of performance-driven creative strategy

Deep knowledge of paid social best practices and platform-native storytelling

Experience working with global brands or scaling e-commerce companies

Strong leadership and communication skills



Ideal Candidate



Data-informed but creatively bold - must have high proficiency and experience with industry Ai

Comfortable operating in a fast-paced, high-growth environment

Used to juggling competing priorities without sacrificing quality

Strategic thinker who can see the big picture and execute details

Passionate about fashion, branding, and cultural relevance

High proficiency and experience with industry Ai



What We Offer



Flexible project-based structure

Competitive compensation aligned with experience

Opportunity to shape creative direction for a rapidly expanding global brand

Access to an exceptional marketing team that executes at a high level

Fast decision-making and strong leadership support



To Apply



Please submit:

Portfolio showcasing high-performing paid ad campaigns

Case studies with measurable performance results

Brief overview of your agency experience

Availability and preferred workload capacity



If you thrive on building bold, converting creative for fast-growing fashion brands — we want to hear from you.

title: Video Editor – E-Commerce Ads
description:
VIDEO EDITOR – E-COMMERCE ADS (META/FACEBOOK) | AI EXPERIENCE A PLUS

---

We are a fast-growing US-based D2C e-commerce brand selling pet products. We need a video editor who can produce direct response ads for
 and Instagram.



This is NOT a corporate video editing job. You will be editing short-form (30–90 second) ads designed to sell products. If you have experience editing e-commerce ads, product demo videos, or direct response marketing content, you are exactly who we are looking for.



? READ THIS BEFORE YOU APPLY:

We have extremely high expectations. This job is not for everyone. You will carry heavy responsibility – the ads you produce directly determine how fast this brand grows. You will be judged on output and results, not hours logged. You must think independently, solve problems without hand-holding, and take full ownership of your work. If you need micromanagement, do not apply.

That said – if you are a high performer, you will be rewarded like one. We operate a generous performance bonus system where your pay increases based on how well your ads perform. Top editors on this team will earn significantly more than the base rate. We want people who are hungry, take pride in their craft, and want to grow with a brand that is scaling fast.



WHAT YOU WILL DO:

• Edit 30–90 second direct response video ads for Meta 
/Instagram)

• Work from creative briefs provided by the founder – you will always know exactly what to produce

• Match visuals to voiceover audio precisely – what the viewer sees must match what they hear

• Use AI video/image generation tools (Sora, VEO, Higgs Field, etc.) to create B-roll footage when needed

• Deliver polished, scroll-stopping ads with clean pacing, text overlays, and transitions

• Hit deadlines – we move fast and need consistent output



REQUIREMENTS:

• Previous experience editing e-commerce or direct response ads (send portfolio/examples)

• Strong understanding of pacing, hooks, and what makes someone stop scrolling

• Good English communication – you need to understand briefs and ask questions when unclear

• Reliable internet and your own editing setup (Premiere Pro, After Effects, CapCut, DaVinci – any professional tool)

• Willingness to learn and take feedback – we will train you on our specific style

• Available minimum 4–6 hours per day



NICE TO HAVE (NOT REQUIRED):

• Experience with AI video generation tools (Sora, VEO 3, Higgs Field, Kling, etc.)

• Experience in the pet niche or health/wellness D2C brands

• Understanding of
 ad creative strategy (hooks, CTAs, UGC-style editing)



COMPENSATION:

Base pay: $800–$1,200/month USD depending on experience. We run a performance bonus system tied directly to ad results. When your ads generate strong ROAS and scale, you earn bonuses on top of your base. This is not a token gesture. Editors who consistently produce winning ads will earn significantly above the base rate. We want people who are motivated by results and want their income to grow as the brand grows.



PREFERRED WORKING HOURS:

12:00 PM – 12:00 AM Manila time (PHT). You do not need to work this entire block, but your active hours should fall within this range for communication overlap.



HOW TO APPLY:

Do NOT just send your resume. To be considered, you MUST submit a short Loom video (2–4 minutes) covering the following:

1. Your name and a brief introduction

2. Your previous editing experience – specifically any e-commerce or ad work

3. What editing tools you use

4. Your experience with AI tools (if any)

5. Your strengths and weaknesses as an editor

6. How many hours per day and per week you are available

7. Your expected monthly pay in USD

Also include a link to your portfolio or 2–3 examples of ads you have edited.

Include your WhatsApp number in your application. If selected, we will contact you directly via WhatsApp.



Applications without a Loom video will NOT be reviewed.

description:

You will repurpose viral content and turn it into original videos.



Daily tasks:

• Download the videos

• Edit them into new original videos using CapCut

• Add hook text in the first second

• Add subtitles/captions

• Add zooms, cuts, and pacing edits (every 1–2 seconds)

• Add our watermark/logo

• Write captions + hashtags

• Post to TikTok daily (we provide login)

• Track views in Google Sheet



?



VERY IMPORTANT



This is not reposting.



Each video must feel NEW and original:

 • New hook

 • Different pacing

 • New captions

 • Cropping/zoom

 • Edited structure



If videos look copied, you will not be hired.



?



Requirements



• Must know TikTok well

• Must understand viral hooks

• Must use CapCut (required)

• Must have stable internet

• Must be reliable and consistent

• Must be comfortable posting daily

title: Title: Junior Creative Strategist for Fast-Growing DTC E-commerce Brand - A-Players Only
description:
About Us:

We're a youth sports recovery brand doing $100k/month and scaling aggressively. We're entering our peak season (spring youth sports) and need someone to help us scale our creative testing from 5 concepts/week to 20+ concepts/week.



IMPORTANT - Read This First:

This is NOT a typical VA job. We're looking for someone OBSESSED with growth - both ours and yours. If you're looking for a comfortable, low-effort gig where you clock in and clock out, this isn't it. But if you're hungry, ambitious, and want to build a real career in e-commerce and marketing, keep reading.



What You'll Do:

Month 1-2 (Execution Phase):

-Create 15-20 AI-generated static ads per week using tools like Higgsfield

-Follow creative briefs I provide (concept, messaging, avatar, format)

-Execute prompts and deliver 3-5 variations per concept

-Organize files in Google Drive following our naming system

-Fast turnaround: 24-48 hours per batch



Month 3+ (Growth Into Strategy):

-Start suggesting your own concept variations based on what's working

-Analyze ad performance and recommend iterations

-Eventually write your own creative briefs

-Become our go-to creative strategist as we scale to $300k+/month



You're Perfect For This If You:

-OBSESSED with self-improvement and skill development

-Hungry to learn direct response marketing, copywriting, and consumer psychology

-Understand (or desperately want to learn) what makes people click and buy

-Have experience with DTC e-commerce or
/Meta ads (or studying it obsessively on your own time)

-Know (or can quickly learn) AI image generation tools

-Think like a marketer and entrepreneur, not just an employee

-Can write persuasive copy that sounds natural, not salesy

-Want to build a REAL skill set that makes you irreplaceable

-See this as a career opportunity, not just a paycheck



Requirements:



-Strong English writing skills (you'll be crafting ad copy)

-Experience with AI tools (Midjourney/Ideogram/Canva AI/etc.) OR fast learner who figures things out

-Organized and detail-oriented with file management

-Available 15-20 hours/week, flexible schedule

-Reliable internet and can join occasional Zoom calls (PST timezone)

-Most important: A-player mentality - you take initiative, solve problems, and don't need hand-holding



Compensation & Growth:

-Starting: $
/month (Month 1-2) - Learning phase

-After proven: $
/month (Month 3-4) - Contributing phase

-Long-term: $
/month (Month 5+) - Strategy phase

-Bonuses: Performance bonuses for winning ads that scale

-Sky's the limit: As we grow to $300k-500k/month, the right person could earn $2500/month+ as our lead creative strategist



This Is Your Opportunity To:



-Learn high-income skills (direct response, copywriting, media buying strategy)

-Work directly with the founder (me) and learn how a real DTC brand scales

-Build a portfolio of winning ads you can leverage for future opportunities

-Potentially earn 2-3x what typical VAs make if you're exceptional

-Become a true marketing professional, not just a task executor



What We DON'T Want:

-Clock-watchers who do the minimum

-People who need constant direction and can't think for themselves

-"Just tell me what to do" mentality

-People looking for easy, low-effort work



What We DO Want:

-Self-starters who take ownership

-People who study marketing in their free time because they LOVE it

-Someone who sees problems and fixes them without being asked

-A future business partner mentality (even if you're starting in execution)



To Apply:

Subject line: "A-Player Creative Strategist - [Your First Name]"



Include:

-Why you're OBSESSED with marketing/e-commerce (not just "I need a job")

-What you're currently learning or studying to improve yourself

-One example of an ad you've seen recently that was effective and explain WHY it worked

-Your long-term career goal (where do you see yourself in 2-3 years?)





Bottom Line:

If you're average, don't apply. If you're exceptional and hungry to prove it, this is your shot. We're building something real here, and the right person will grow with us.

title: Static Ad Designer for DTC Brand (Facebook Ads Only – Direct Response Focus)
description:
READ THIS BEFORE YOU APPLY — MOST PEOPLE WILL NOT QUALIFY



This role is NOT for brand designers, logo designers, Canva editors, or anyone who has never created ads that had to profitably convert cold traffic.



If you’ve never worked on direct response
 ads for 
, please don’t apply.

If your portfolio doesn’t show actual ads, you will be ignored.

If you take 2–3 days to turn around a single batch, this isn’t for you.



We’re only looking for designers who understand performance, not “pretty.”



WHAT WE NEED



A performance-driven creative who knows how to design ads that stop scrolls and drive purchases.

This role is for a fast-growing DTC brand running high-volume cold traffic campaigns.



You MUST have:



? Experience designing
 static ads for 
/eCom brands

? Understanding of hooks, hierarchy, conversion principles

? Ability to turn around batches within 24–48 hours

? Strong creative judgment — you know when a brief is weak and can suggest better angles

? A mindset focused on results, not ornamental design



If you’ve never worked inside a direct response funnel, you will not survive here.



WHAT YOU’LL DO



• Design high-converting static ads, carousels, and simple GIFs

• Create occasional website graphics (landing page headers, offer cards, etc.)

• Take feedback fast — no ego, no delays

• Follow briefs but speak up when something can be improved

• Learn our creative frameworks and eventually help ideate new concepts



GROWTH PATH



If you’re good, you’ll move into a Creative Strategist role — leading ideation and managing more designers.



TO APPLY (read carefully or you’ll be ignored):



Submit ALL of the following in ONE message:



A short intro explaining your experience with performance ads



Your portfolio with
 ads ONLY (don’t include logos, websites, or brand kits)



Your single best DTC ad + why it performed



Your turnaround time for 3–5 ads



Your expected hourly rate



If anything is missing, your application will be deleted.

About Us

title: Virtual Assistant/Executive Assistant
description:
Virtual Assistant/Executive Assistant/Social Media Manager - Application Form 

Remote, European Time Zone



?? IMPORTANT Please read below before submitting your application.

In the application form, you'll be required to submit a 2-minute video introduction answering: Who are you, and why do you think you're the best fit for this role?

You'll also be asked a few short written questions. If your video checks out, we'll invite you to interview.



This role exists because the CEO is doing too many things that aren't CEO-level work. Inbox management, recruitment coordination, content scheduling, lead magnet setup — it's all getting done, but it's eating into time that should be spent on strategy and growth.



We need someone sharp, process-driven, and reliable to take ownership of the operational and marketing coordination tasks that keep the agency running smoothly behind the scenes.

This isn't a passive "wait for instructions" role. You'll follow clear systems and SOPs, but we need someone who can take a process, run with it, and flag when something's off — not someone who needs to be chased.

— Andy Gray, Founder & CEO



Who We Are

The Graygency is a performance marketing agency working with 7–8 figure DTC e-commerce brands across the UK, US, and UAE. We call ourselves Performance Scientists — we're in the P&L, not just the ad account. We're building an agency powered by systems, AI, and commercial thinking, not headcount.

What You'll Actually Do



Recruitment Coordination

Run LinkedIn headhunting campaigns following our recruiting playbook, sourcing, messaging, and screening candidates

Send 60–80 outreach messages per day during active hiring periods

Screen video applications and flag strong candidates for interview

Manage the recruitment pipeline end to end, from first message to interview scheduling

Post and manage job listings on platforms like OnlineJobs.ph and LinkedIn



???? In your application, use the Code: 8000 applications without this subject line will not be reviewed.



Marketing Coordination

Schedule and publish content across LinkedIn, YouTube, Instagram, and TikTok

Set up YouTube videos - titles, descriptions, shorts, and reels from existing long-form content

Coordinate between the content creator, designers, and copywriters to keep the content engine moving

Set up and send newsletters

Build and distribute lead magnets (taking existing content and packaging it)

Set up automations for content distribution (e.g. ManyChat comment-to-DM flows)



Executive Support

Manage the CEO's diary and inbox - prioritise, flag, and respond where appropriate

Schedule calls, meetings, and podcast guest appearances

Reconcile Accounts

Keep task lists and follow-ups organised in ClickUp

Handle ad hoc operational tasks that free up leadership time



What Success Looks Like

The CEO spends two hours a week or less on marketing coordination and admin. Recruitment pipelines are full without the CEO lifting a finger. Content goes out consistently. 



Nothing falls through the cracks.



The Skills We Need You To Bring

2+ years experience as a VA, executive assistant, or marketing coordinator (agency experience a plus)

Proven experience with LinkedIn outreach or recruitment coordination

Comfortable scheduling and posting across social platforms (LinkedIn, YouTube, Instagram, TikTok)

Strong written English — you'll be sending messages on behalf of the CEO

Highly organised and process-driven you follow SOPs precisely and flag issues early

Experience with tools like ClickUp, Slack, Google Workspace, and Canva

Ability to work UK/European time zone hours (non-negotiable)

Excellent attention to detail — if instructions say do X, you do X



Nice-to-Haves

Experience with ManyChat or similar automation tools

Familiarity with newsletter platforms (Beehiiv, Mailchimp, etc.)

Experience working with DTC e-commerce brands or performance marketing agencies

Basic understanding of content repurposing workflows

Experience with AI tools (ChatGPT, Claude, etc.) for drafting and coordination



What We Offer

Competitive monthly salary (based on experience)

Paid public holidays and leave entitlements

Direct access to the CEO — you're not buried in a team, you're at the centre of operations

Clear growth pathway — this role can evolve into a full marketing coordinator position as the agency scales

A fast-moving, innovative team that's building something different



Red Flags (Don't Apply If…)

You need to be told what to do every step of the way

You can't follow written instructions precisely

You disappear when things get busy

Your English isn't strong enough to send professional outreach on behalf of a CEO

You're applying to 50 jobs at once and hoping one sticks



Our Culture

We believe in doing things well at The Graygency — we are constantly looking for ways to innovate and improve the delivery of our product. Every day we turn up and deliver our best work as a team in order to deliver the best results for the brands that trust us with their marketing budgets.



To apply please click the link:

title: Part-time Capcut / TikTok Editor
description:
Hiring for part-time work for a Capcut / TikTok editor with potential for more



You will be making TikTok videos using Capcut or the video editing software of your choice.  The editing process is fairly simple and straightforward.  Anyone who is proficient in video editing should have no problem with the basic tasks such as:

- Cutting dead space in talking head videos

- Adding overlay images on screen in the videos

- Minor effects such as dynamic zoom, cropping, etc.

- Producing b-roll content from voiceover and footage provided, having the ability to digest what is being said and pair up the     audio with corresponding footage



Please review a few examples of my content to ensure you are familiar and comfortable with the editing style:

1. Basic talking head - here you are mostly editing dead space and piecing clips together.


 



2. Talking head with overlays - same as before, but adding images and stickers provided to you on the screen to support what is being said in the video.





3. Faceless Content – similar to the previous examples, but focused on creating faceless clips of the product itself.





4. B-roll - you will be provided a voice over and need to work through the footage to find fitting visuals. A strong understanding of English and social media content is crucial here.


 



You will be working hand in hand with me on an extremely viral social media page and there is room for bonuses if deadlines are met and the content performs well!



Requirements:

- Attention to detail

- STRONG English

- Strong internet connection

- Previous experience with Capcut / TikTok / Instagram

- Good working with a team

- Ability to learn and take constructive feedback

- Availability to work 3-4hrs a day (with potential for more and increased salary)

- Able to work 6 days per week (can take days off whenever as long as mostly consistent)

- Can take payments through Wise

- PH or similar time zone



$350/month + bonuses for 3-4hrs a day MAX and potential full time work in the future with a salary increase.
