title: Sales Person
description:
I am looking to hire a sales person to help grow my bookkeeping business. I am looking for somebody part time to help cold call, send

title: Part-time Capcut / TikTok Editor
description:
Hiring for part-time work for a Capcut / TikTok editor with potential for more



You will be making TikTok videos using Capcut or the video editing software of your choice.  The editing process is fairly simple and straightforward.  Anyone who is proficient in video editing should have no problem with the basic tasks such as:

- Cutting dead space in talking head videos

- Adding overlay images on screen in the videos

- Minor effects such as dynamic zoom, cropping, etc.

- Producing b-roll content from voiceover and footage provided, having the ability to digest what is being said and pair up the     audio with corresponding footage



Please review a few examples of my content to ensure you are familiar and comfortable with the editing style:

1. Basic talking head - here you are mostly editing dead space and piecing clips together.


 



2. Talking head with overlays - same as before, but adding images and stickers provided to you on the screen to support what is being said in the video.





3. Faceless Content – similar to the previous examples, but focused on creating faceless clips of the product itself.





4. B-roll - you will be provided a voice over and need to work through the footage to find fitting visuals. A strong understanding of English and social media content is crucial here.


 



You will be working hand in hand with me on an extremely viral social media page and there is room for bonuses if deadlines are met and the content performs well!



Requirements:

- Attention to detail

- STRONG English

- Strong internet connection

- Previous experience with Capcut / TikTok / Instagram

- Good working with a team

- Ability to learn and take constructive feedback

- Availability to work 3-4hrs a day (with potential for more and increased salary)

- Able to work 6 days per week (can take days off whenever as long as mostly consistent)

- Can take payments through Wise

- PH or similar time zone



$350/month + bonuses for 3-4hrs a day MAX and potential full time work in the future with a salary increase.



To apply, please complete the recreate assignment below so I can see your skills (30min - 1hr max)



Below is a Google Drive with the original files you will need to re-create this reference video:



Reference video:  
 

Google drive: 
 



Please complete the following steps:

1. Download the files and import into your video editing software

2. Find the “good” takes of the video sections, put together to complete the video, and add overlays where it's necessary.

3. Pay close attention to detail in the selection of the clips, the pacing, cropping, overlays, etc.

4. Message me with a link to the re-created video

title: Creative Video Editor (UGC & AI Ads)
description:
Sereni is currently looking for a freelance, per-project Video Editor to join our growing creative team. This role is focused on editing high-converting social media ads for platforms such as
 and Instagram, primarily in the 1–3 minute range, using AI voiceovers, UGC footage, b-roll, AI video generation, captions, and performance-driven pacing. The ideal candidate understands direct response advertising, knows how to hook viewers fast, and can edit with conversion and retention in mind — not just aesthetics.



This is a remote, project-based role with new projects assigned daily. Compensation is per project, with typical earnings ranging between $1,000 – $2,000+ per month, depending on workload and performance.



Who is Sereni?

Sereni is a fast-growing parenting brand focused on delivering innovative, at-home calming solutions that help children feel regulated and confident in themselves.



We are marketers at heart — obsessed with creative testing, performance, and storytelling — and we work closely with editors who understand that great ads are built, tested, and optimized, not just edited once.



If you want to work in an environment where your edits directly impact ad performance, scaling decisions, and revenue, you’ll fit right in.



Key Requirements:



- Has experience with UGC content.

- Has experience using AI tools to create videos (Elevenlabs, Kling, Gemini).

- Ability to find engaging b-roll + stock videos online to source and add to videos.

- Add sound effects, music, and engaging transitions.

- Work with CapCut, Adobe Premiere Pro, or similar software.

- Has knowledge on how to create very engaging hooks, especially with AI (Kling, etc.) – VERY IMPORTANT

- Collaborate and communicate clearly to meet deadlines.



Bonus:



- Experience with motion graphics/animation.

- Understanding of performance-driven ad content.



Here is our website for your reference: 
/



Add this phrase "DIRECT RESPONSE" in the title of your job application to be considered.

title: E-Commerce Operations Manager (Shopify Dropshipping)
description:
We are hiring a full-time Dropshipping Manager to handle the daily operations of multiple Shopify dropshipping stores. This is a fully remote role requiring 7 hours of work per day, with a monthly salary of $1,000.



The ideal candidate will be responsible for building and managing Shopify stores from start to finish. This includes overseeing multiple live stores, launching and testing new products and offers, handling daily order processing and fulfillment, coordinating with suppliers, and managing all Shopify apps, automations, and workflows. The role also requires tracking daily profit and loss for each store and ensuring overall store profitability.



In addition to store operations, the Dropshipping Manager will lead and coordinate the operations team to ensure smooth execution of daily tasks and ongoing optimization across all stores.



Candidates must have proven, hands-on experience in dropshipping or e-commerce operations, strong Shopify and store-building skills, and experience managing multiple stores at the same time. The ability to monitor profitability, understand margins, and manage P&L is required, as well as prior experience leading a team. Applicants must be able to provide verifiable proof of daily operational work for the past 30 days and the past 6 months. Only candidates with real, documented experience will be considered.



This role offers a long-term opportunity for consistent, high-performing candidates.

Interested and qualified applicants should message my assistant directly on WhatsApp at 
.

title: Senior Media Buyer
description:
Role Overview – Media Buyer (Google Ads & Meta Ads)



We are looking to hire a high-performing Media Buyer with strong, hands-on experience managing Google Ads and Meta Ads accounts.



This is a part-time role (4 hours per day) with fixed working hours, ideally 10:00–14:00 GMT.



You will be responsible for managing 4–5 active client accounts and will work closely with me, with clear strategic direction, expectations, and guidance provided.



Responsibilities

Paid Media Execution (Google Ads & Meta Ads)



End-to-end setup, management, and optimization of Google Ads, including:

Search, Shopping, Performance Max, YouTube, Demand Gen, and Display (where relevant)



End-to-end setup, management, and optimization of Meta Ads, including:

Prospecting, retargeting, scaling, and Advantage+ (where appropriate)



Manage budget pacing, performance monitoring, and proactive optimizations



Own keyword research, audience strategy, bidding strategy, and account structure



Continuously test and iterate across creatives, audiences, formats, and funnels



Reporting & Performance

Proactively identify and communicate insights, risks, and growth opportunities

3–5+ years of hands-on experience managing Google Ads



3–5+ years of hands-on experience managing Meta Ads



Proven experience managing multiple accounts simultaneously



Strong understanding of Meta creative testing and iteration



Analytical mindset with high attention to detail



Ability to execute independently within a defined strategy



Fluent in written and spoken English



Tools & Platforms (Required)



Google Ads



Meta Ads Manager



Google Analytics 4 (GA4)



Google Tag Manager



Google Merchant Center (for eCommerce accounts)



Looker Studio (nice to have)



Excel / Google Sheets



Work Style & Expectations

Comfortable managing 6-10 client accounts at the same time



Proactive and ownership-driven mindset



Data-informed decision-making



Reliable, clear, and professional communicator



Comfortable executing under senior-level strategic guidance



How to Apply



Please submit the following:



Updated CV / Resume



Self Intro Vid - 2 minute max related to this role



Portfolio or case studies demonstrating your paid media work and results



Only applicants with relevant hands-on experience and supporting materials will be considered.

title: HR Virtual Staff and Admin Assistant for NDIS Business In Australia
description:

Location: Remote (Philippines)

Work Schedule: [Monday- Wednesday, e.g., 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM AWST

Salary Range: []



Job Overview

We are an expanding NDIS provider based in Perth, Australia. We are seeking a versatile HR, Admin & IT Virtual Assistant to serve as the backbone of our operations. You will manage our workforce compliance, general administration, and serve as our internal "Tech Lead"—ensuring our digital tools, security, and online presence are running smoothly.



Key Responsibilities

 accounts, and ensure data backups are functional.

3. General Administration (30%)

Technical Skills & Requirements

HR Experience: 2+ years in HR/Recruitment (Australian/Healthcare sector highly preferred).



IT Proficiency: * Advanced knowledge of microsoft word



Experience with CMS platforms (WordPress/Wix) for basic site updates.



Familiarity with Automation tools (Zapier or Make) is a huge plus.



Communication: Exceptional written and verbal English.



Reliability: High-speed internet (20+ Mbps), a high-spec laptop, and a reliable power backup/UPS.



Why Join Us?

Growth: Work directly with the business owners of an expanding NDIS agency.



Stability: Long-term role with consistent hours and competitive pay.



Impact: Your work directly supports the disability community in Australia.

title: AI Lifestyle Content Creator & Brand Asset Builder for E-commerce Brands
description:
AI Lifestyle Content Creator & Brand Asset Builder for E-commerce Brands



The Mission

We are building a scalable, premium lifestyle content engine for our fast-growing e-commerce brands — primarily 
 (travel & remote work gear) and secondarily 
  (wellness tools).



Your core mission:

Build a premium brand-aligned lifestyle content system that allows us to redesign our webshops, marketplace listings, and social channels with 10/10 quality assets.



This is not about creating “AI art.”



This is about building a structured, reusable lifestyle asset library that strengthens brand identity and drives commercial impact.





3-Month Outcome

Within the first 3 months, you will help us build:



- 100+ reusable, high-end lifestyle assets

- A consistent, premium visual identity for Remodius

- Base visuals designed intentionally for product integration

- A scalable AI workflow we can build on long-term





Success = volume + realism + brand consistency.



Brand Focus



- 
 (80%)

Adventurous remote professionals and digital nomads. Explorer / Creator energy.

Bold, modern, freedom-driven visuals. Travel + productivity blended.



- 
 (20%)

Wellness-focused home professionals.

Calm, minimal, reassuring, recovery-driven scenes.





What You’ll Do

- Generate ultra-realistic AI lifestyle scenes (indistinguishable from real photography)

- Create complete environments: models, lighting, styling, composition

- Design scenes intentionally for product insertion (shadow logic, perspective, spacing)

- Build structured, reusable asset batches — not random one-offs

- Document prompts & workflow in an organized way

- Collaborate closely with the founder and our core team (strategy, advertising & design partners)

- Deliver consistent output (?8 high-end assets per week)





Must-Haves

- Proven experience generating photorealistic human AI lifestyle scenes

- Strong control over lighting, anatomy, materials, perspective & realism

- Experience with modern AI image workflows (Midjourney, SDXL, ComfyUI, Runway, etc.)

- Ability to eliminate AI artifacts (hands, faces, skin texture, posture)

- Structured, repeatable workflow

- Fluent English

- Strong communication: clearly explains decisions (text + Loom)

- Output-driven mindset



Strong Plus

- Experience building visual assets for e-commerce brands

- Understanding of conversion-driven visual principles

- AI video generation experience

- Proactively proposing new visual concepts based on competitor research and emerging AI creative trends

- Brand-thinking mindset: confidently challenges and improves the brand story (the “why”)



Long-Term Opportunity



We are not looking for a short-term freelancer.



We are looking for someone to grow with us over the coming years.



This is a long-term collaboration with the opportunity to evolve into a deeper creative role — and potentially a full-time position (creative director) within our team.



If you want to build something long-term instead of jumping between projects, this is for you.





How To Apply (Hard Filter)



Send a 5–10 minute Loom video to 
 (camera on) answering:



1. Give a short introduction about yourself.

2. Show 3 examples of photorealistic human lifestyle scenes you created.

3. What AI tools do you use daily?

4. What makes AI images look fake — and how do you prevent that?

5. How would you design a scene meant for product insertion later?

6. How do you keep yourself up-to-date with design and AI trends?

7. What do you know about our company?

8. How do you approach competitor research and apply it in your work?

9. What are your core strengths?

10. What is your ideal work environment?



Send your loom video, resume and portfolio to 
 Applications without a Loom video will not be reviewed.



--------------



Location: Remote



Collaboration: Part-time (project-based) with long-term partnership intent. Potential to grow into a full-time role.



Salary: Monthly agreement based on experience, quality, and consistent delivery (~8 premium assets per week). Performance-based growth.



Start: ASAP



Looking forward to your application!

title: Eccommerce Manager
description:
We are seeking a true business owner in a management role, not an executor waiting for direction.



About Us

We are a Canadian manufacturer established in 1990. Our brands, Plastair, DeeVa, and PlastairFyre, are built on differentiated products, strong margins, and when appropriate, utility patents or design patents. We manufacture in Canada, or source electronics overseas, then protect and position them properly.



We have a strong presence in brick and mortar retail in North America for decades. Now we are building a serious digital revenue engine. Our online presence is underdeveloped relative to our product strength, and we want fast, measurable improvement without the owner being the day to day operator.



The Role



 - This is a full time leadership role for a true owner operator. You will own digital revenue results across Amazon Seller, Shopify DTC, and additional marketplaces including Walmart, Wayfair, and digital B2B platforms such as Faire and Grainger.



- This is not a VA role, not a coordinator role, not a task manager role. Your job is to build the machine, lead people, make decisions, and remove work from ownership’s plate.



- You will manage and leverage our existing Amazon operations resource, you will rebuild our creative production function to improve speed, accuracy, and quality.



What Success Looks Like:



Within 60 to 90 days, ownership should experience a real reduction in day to day decisions, fewer errors, faster execution, clearer reporting, and visible 
ntum across listings, creative, ads, and channel expansion.



If you do not remove work from the owner’s plate, you are not a fit.



Core Responsibilities:

-Digital revenue ownership and execution cadence



-Own the digital revenue plan, priorities, and weekly execution cadence across all digital channels



-Make decisions, do not push decisions upward unless budget risk or strategy change is required



-Implement a simple weekly reporting system showing revenue, margin, conversion, TACOS, ACOS, ROAS, inventory health, and next actions



-Marketplaces and Shopify DTC



-Own Amazon Seller growth, SKU focus, pricing strategy, merchandising, promotions, and catalog health



-Own Shopify DTC fundamentals, conversion rate improvement, product page quality, offers, and traffic plans



-Launch and scale Walmart and Wayfair with correct catalog setup, content requirements, compliance, and fulfillment workflows



-Plan and execute international Amazon expansion when unit economics and operational readiness support it



-Digital B2B marketplaces



-Own digital B2B marketplace performance including platforms such as Faire and Grainger



-Ensure pricing, content, and inventory strategy align with brand positioning and avoid channel conflict



-Coordinate onboarding, catalog setup, and ongoing optimization for digital wholesale platforms



-Paid media strategy and performance



-Own paid media strategy and budget allocation across Amazon ads and Meta, plus other channels as appropriate



-You may execute ads yourself or manage a specialist, but you are accountable for outcomes



-Build repeatable testing systems for keywords, creative, offers, and landing pages, not random changes



-Creative, content, and influencer systems



-Rebuild our creative production to improve speed, accuracy, and taste



-Create a repeatable workflow for product images, video, A plus content, storefronts, and ad creative



-Build an influencer and UGC pipeline that produces usable assets and measurable performance, not vanity metrics



Team leadership and accountability



-Manage Amazon Operations Lead, inventory, listings execution, and operational hygiene



-Hire and manage the minimum team needed to win, typically 2 to 4 people across ads execution and creative production



B-uild SOPs so performance does not depend on any one person



What We Already Have:



S-trong product differentiation, IP strategy, and manufacturing capability



-Existing Amazon operations support, currently part time



-Clear need to rebuild creative production due to speed and error issues



Required Experience and Traits:



-Proven ownership of ecommerce growth and results, not just tasks



-Experience managing Amazon Seller Central and at least two of the following, Shopify DTC, Walmart, Wayfair, Faire, Grainger



-Demonstrated leadership, hiring, training, accountability, and building repeatable systems



-Strong analytical thinking, comfortable with margin math and channel tradeoffs



-High urgency, fast execution, high quality, low error tolerance



-Fluent English, able to overlap 2 to 3 hours daily with Eastern Time



-Full time commitment to one company and long term mindset



Performance Targets:



-Targets will be confirmed after your initial audit, but you should expect accountability for:



-Meaningful growth from the current Amazon baseline while protecting contribution margin



-Clean scalable paid media performance with controlled ACOS and improving TACOS over time



-Walmart and Wayfair live with correct catalog, operational workflows, and launch plan



-Clear improvement in listing quality, creative quality, and production speed



-Digital B2B marketplace launches and optimization without channel conflict



-International expansion roadmap for at least one additional Amazon region when economics support it



How to Apply:



Submit all items to be prioritized.



-Your resume



A 200 word plan for your first 90 days, specific to Plastair, DeeVa, and PlastairFyre, generic plans will be rejected



-Links to brands, stores, or campaigns you directly managed, include specific results such as revenue impact, ACOS, TACOS, ROAS, conversion, growth rate



Optional, a 2 to 3 minute Loom video introducing yourself and explaining one case study win



Screening Note



We prioritize candidates who demonstrate ownership, decision making, and evidence of removing work from founders, not candidates who list tools and tasks.

We are a Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu (BJJ) school looking for a reliable Outbound Caller to contact leads who have shown interest in training. Your main goal is simple: call leads and book them into a free trial Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu class.

This is a phone-focused role. You will be making outbound calls consistently throughout your shift using a provided script.

title: Remote Executive Assistant
description:
We are seeking a highly qualified Candidate to join our team as "Executive Virtual Assistant". The ideal candidate will be female, 27 years or older, fluent in English, and equipped with excellent communication and critical thinking skills. This role requires someone dependable, resourceful, and committed to delivering efficient, high-quality results even under pressure.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Apply critical thinking to evaluate and analyze to resolve job assignment challenges

Manage inbound and outbound calls, providing excellent customer interaction and support.



We want someone who doesn’t just complete assignments but takes ownership of their work. A candidate who can adapt to new challenges, remain calm under pressure, and is dedicated to ensuring tasks are done correctly, efficiently, and with quality results.



QUALIFICATIONS INCLUDE:

Female, 27 years or older (required).

Proficient in English with strong verbal and written communication skills.

Exceptional critical thinking and problem-solving ability.

Highly resourceful, detail-oriented, and efficient with high productivity

Comfortable with multitasking across different projects.

Very responsible to complete all Tasks with quality results

3)Any experience in
 marketing OR Ads OR Content Creation is a PLUS and recommended to apply

4)Any experience as a Team OR Operations Management in BPO industry is a MAJOR PLUS and recommended to apply

5)Must have high-speed internet connection and a reliable computer or laptop capable of handling multiple tasks efficiently.





WORK SCHEDULE:

Work schedule is a part-time schedule, working 4 hours per day for 5 days a week.

Days and Hours to work are Monday to Friday sometime between 10am to 4pm MST Arizona time.

Periodically extra hours will be available





HOW TO APPLY:

2. Download FREE "Whatsapp" app to cell

2. MUST
 resume to 
 and include your "Whatsapp Cell #" AND if you qualify for an interview EXPECT a message thru Whatsapp WITHIN 12hrs of
ing your resume.





ADDITIONAL INFO

1. This position is a permanent part time job, and a full-time shift could be available after 1 year of being hired

2. Hourly pay rate will be increased after working 100 days

3. Annual evaluations will be conducted to review Employee's performance which will determine new pay rate

4. 13th Month Bonus is available AND HMO Health Plan AND Vacation Paid Time off are some of the many Employee Benefits

5. Periodically varies Bonuses will be available to be earned

title: Remote Wix Website Builder & SEO/SEM Specialist (Part-Time Contractor)
description:
Job Title: Remote Wix Website Builder & SEO/SEM Specialist (Part-Time Contractor)

Location: 100% Remote (Philippines-based applicants preferred)

Company: California-based FMS (Focused on becoming #1 globally in attracting product inquiries through optimized digital presence)

Job Type: Independent Contractor (Hourly billing via PayPal, Wise, or similar)

Schedule: 5 hours per day, Monday through Friday (approximately 25 hours per week)



Must overlap with US Pacific Standard Time (PST) business hours (e.g., 8 AM – 5 PM PST for collaboration; night shift in PH time ideal, as 10 AM PH = 6 PM previous day PST).



Compensation: $6–$10 USD per hour (based on experience and certifications; typical for experienced PH-based talent in this role). Paid weekly or bi-weekly. Negotiable for top candidates with proven results in driving global inquiries.

About the Role

FMS is a dynamic California company dedicated to leading the market in global product inquiries. We're seeking a skilled, certified Wix specialist with expertise in SEO and search engine marketing (SEM) to build, optimize, and maintain our websites remotely on a part-time basis. Your work will directly contribute to enhancing our online visibility, attracting international traffic, and positioning FMS as the top choice for product inquiries worldwide. This role may expand if performance excels.

Key Responsibilities



Design, build, and customize responsive websites using Wix platform, ensuring user-friendly navigation, mobile optimization, and integration of e-commerce or inquiry forms.

Implement on-page and off-page SEO strategies to improve search rankings, including keyword research, content optimization, meta tags, alt text, and site speed enhancements.

Manage SEM campaigns (e.g., Google Ads, paid search) to drive targeted global traffic and product inquiries, including ad creation, bidding, A/B testing, and performance tracking.

Analyze website performance using tools like Google Analytics and Search Console to identify opportunities for increasing inquiries from diverse global markets.

Perform regular site audits, updates, and maintenance to ensure SEO/SEM best practices are applied for maximum visibility and conversion.

Collaborate remotely with the team (via Slack, Zoom,
) to align on goals, report on metrics (e.g., traffic growth, inquiry rates), and suggest improvements for global reach.

Focus on strategies that attract international audiences, such as multilingual SEO elements or region-specific targeting to make FMS #1 in product inquiries.



Requirements



3+ years of experience building and managing websites on Wix, with a portfolio of live sites demonstrating SEO/SEM integration.

Proven track record in driving traffic and inquiries through SEO and paid search for global audiences.

Strong understanding of search engine algorithms, digital marketing trends, and tools like Google Analytics, Google Search Console, SEMrush, Ahrefs, or similar.

Excellent English communication skills (written and verbal) for professional reports and team interactions.

Reliable high-speed internet, quiet workspace, and flexibility for PST hours.

Ability to work independently as a remote contractor.



Required Certifications/Training

To ensure high-quality, professional work aligned with industry standards:



Wix-Specific: Wix Certified (e.g., Wix Partner Certification, Wix Web Designer Certification, or completion of Wix's official training courses on website building and SEO via Wix Learn).

SEO: Google Analytics Certification (Google Skillshop), SEMrush SEO Fundamentals Certification, HubSpot SEO Certification, or Ahrefs SEO Training Course.

SEM (Search Engine Marketing): Google Ads Certification (Search, Display, or Performance Max tracks via Google Skillshop), Microsoft Advertising Certified Professional, or equivalent paid search training from platforms like Udemy or Coursera.

These certifications demonstrate expertise and are essential for optimizing FMS's global inquiry strategy.



Preferred (Big Plus)



Experience with additional tools (e.g., Google Tag Manager, Hotjar for user behavior, Canva for visuals, or
 marketing platforms like Mailchimp).

Background in e-commerce or lead generation sites, with examples of increasing global inquiries.

Familiarity with international SEO (e.g., hreflang tags, geo-targeting).



How to Apply

Submit:



Resume/CV with Wix/SEO/SEM experience and certifications listed.

Portfolio links to Wix sites you've built/optimized, including before-after metrics on traffic/inquiries if available.

Expected hourly rate in USD.

Brief note on your PST availability and how you've driven global product inquiries in past roles.



We'll review quickly and may include a short Wix/SEO skills test. Join us in making FMS the global leader in product inquiries!

title: Revenue Operations Manager (Business Development)
description:
Summary

Revenue Operations Manager (Real Estate Coaching & Deals)



Budget: $1,500–$3,000/month + performance bonuses

Hours: 30–40 hrs/week

Location: Remote

Start: Immediate (paid trial)



Who This Role Is For



I run a real estate investing & coaching business that generates leads daily, runs live trainings, closes consulting/coaching clients, and works active real estate deals.



I am looking for a Revenue Operations Manager — not a VA.



This person’s job is simple:



Make sure revenue-producing activity happens every single day and nothing that can produce money gets dropped.



If you are comfortable pushing people for decisions, tracking pipelines, and holding sales activity accountable — this role is for you.



If you only like “tasks” and not ownership, this is not for you.



What You Will Own



You will own all revenue-related pipelines, including:



Coaching & consulting leads



Follow-up on sales calls



Deal pipelines (wholesale / flips)



Invoicing, deposits, and collections



Scheduling & confirming sales calls



Ensuring prospects move to a YES or NO



Your success is measured by:



Follow-ups completed



Calls booked & confirmed



Deals moved forward



Money collected



Daily Responsibilities



Review all active leads & opportunities daily



Ensure every lead is contacted & followed up



Push prospects to make decisions



Track deal progress & next actions



Coordinate contracts, invoices, and deposits



Update CRM & pipeline dashboards



Provide daily revenue updates (EOD summary)



Required Experience



2+ years in operations, sales support, or transaction coordination



Experience working with:



CRMs (GoHighLevel preferred)



Sales pipelines



Real estate or high-ticket services (strong plus)



Comfortable:



Following up persistently



Asking for money



Enforcing timelines



Holding others accountable



Personality Fit (Non-Negotiable)



You must:



Be proactive (not reactive)



Be direct and confident



Like closing open loops



Be calm under pressure



Care about results, not excuses



Compensation



Monthly base pay



Performance bonuses tied to:



Deals closed



Clients onboarded



Revenue collected



Top performers will earn more and grow into a long-term leadership role.



Trial Period



This role starts with a paid trial where you will work on:



Live leads



Real follow-ups



Real revenue movement



Only candidates who perform in real conditions will be offered a long-term role.



How to Apply



In your application, include:



Your relevant experience (brief)



A short example of how you’ve pushed a stalled deal forward



The word “REVENUE” at the top of your application



Applications without this will be ignored.

title: YouTube Video Editor (Long-form)
description:
[Work Type]

Remote | Flexible Hours | Long-term Contract

You may choose either Part-time(+3hrs/day) or Full-time



[Caution]

You’ll be using plugins in After Effects for motion and transitions, so please continue only if you’re already comfortable and experienced working in After Effects.



[Salary]

-$100 per project

-$300 USD commitment bonus after completing 10 projects (you will be paid $100+$300 for every 10th project you complete)

-You don't have to search for the visual elements such as video clips, images, talking-heads since all the elements will be provided.

-I can provide 1~2 projects each week as long as you can manage (our current editor says he can consistently handle around 1.5–2 projects per week after being fully aligned with the workflow and preferred style).

-Expect the first project will take longer as we need to adjust to the desired working style. But as we get on to the 2nd, 3rd, ... it will take less time as there will be less corrections to make.



[What You’ll Do]

IMPORTANT-> Here's a sample video(you must watch it before applying): 

-All the ingredients(images, video clips, voice-over, talking-head, BGM and script) for the video will be provided.

-You will select images that best match the context from the provided asset folder, place them at the appropriate timestamps, and add motion, transitions, sound effects, and background music.

-Use After Effect plugins such as Mister Horse and Flow to add dynamic motions.

-The images or video clips must match with what's being spoken by the voice-over.

-Collaborate with me or our team to ensure the visuals meet aesthetic and desired output.



*In the beginning, your edits will get a few rounds of feedback for refinement while adjusting to the preferred video style. But as you're aligned and become familiar, you won't need my feedback and refinement as much.



[What We’re Looking For]

The ideal candidate:

-Communicates effectively and values mutual respect.

-Has a creative editing skill for visually appealing videos; to avoid viewer's boredom.

-Has strong time management skills to meet deadlines.

-Is accountable and committed to the role.



*Important Note:

We value respectful communication. What does it mean?

Most importantly, if you need to step away, just let me or your manager know why and when. We understand it, even if you need to leave tomorrow, BUT ghosting is the last thing you'd like to do, since it causes confusion and delays. 

In everyday conversations, our team thrives on mutual respect, no matter your role.



[Why Work With Us?]

-Flexible hours to suit your schedule. (You’re welcome to work at night and submit your draft. While you’re asleep, it will be reviewed and feedback will be ready within 12 hours.)

-Long-term growth opportunities as the channel expands.

-A supportive environment that values creativity and contributions.



[About Us]

We help YouTube creators master storytelling techniques to captivate audiences and achieve viral success. Your role will play a key part in bringing our vision to life and empowering creators worldwide.



[How to Apply]

Subject Line: Start your title with “VIDEO EDIT”, or your application can't be considered.



In your application, include:

1. Portfolio: Share 2-3 of your best projects involving video editing with motion graphic.

2. Work History: Explain any experience or projects involving motion graphics or After Effects.

3. After Effects Skill: Please rate your After Effects skill level on a 5-star scale.

4. Available Hours: Let us know when you are available for our work each day of the week(For example:Monday: 11:00AM - 2:00PM, Tuesday: 3:30PM - 8:00PM, Wednesday: ..., etc)

5. Available Period of Work: Let us know for how long you expect to work with this job. We'd prefer at least 3 months with additional projects forward.

6. Whether or not you're willing to be on a Zoo
eting: We prefer Zoo
eting because this shows your accountability as well as it drives our team to the same goal together.



I will respond to your application in 7 days all at once.

title: Community Moderator
description:
[Caution]

If you are a naturally empathetic and observant person who thrives on fostering positive online spaces, this role is a perfect fit.

This position requires high emotional intelligence, excellent communication skills, a genuine desire to help others, and the ability to be the eyes, ears, and heart of our online community. You will be a guardian of our culture, nurturing a safe and welcoming environment for all members.

If you view moderation as simply deleting posts and banning users without understanding the context or human element, this role may be a challenge for you.

So only read further if you’re passionate about building vibrant online communities, resolving conflicts with tact, and making every user feel heard and valued (ideally with a self-assessed ability level of 4.5 out of 5 stars or higher).



[Job Title]

Community Moderator VA (Community Health & Engagement)



[Work Type]

Remote | Flexible Hours | Long-term Contract



[Base Payment]

We offer a project-based compensation structure for those who apply as part-time. That said, the expected monthly range is USD $500–$800(for full-time workers), depending on factors such as proficiency, workload, task complexity, performance (including bonuses), experience, skill set, and the final scope of responsibilities.



[Bonus]

There's potential for a performance-based bonus tied to community health and engagement. Metrics could include positive sentiment scores, user engagement rates, and response time targets. We'll go over those details once you've demonstrated your skills, but you should be comfortable working with just the base pay initially.



[What You’ll Be Doing]



Your role is to be the supportive and vigilant heart of our online community and social media channels (YouTube, Instagram,
,
, etc.). You will be responsible for creating a thriving environment where our members feel safe, supported, and engaged. Your main tasks will include:



a) Proactive Community Monitoring: Actively scan our community platforms and social media for all posts and comments to ensure they adhere to our guidelines. You'll be responsible for identifying and encouraging positive contributions to nurture a healthy culture.



b) Reactive Moderation & Conflict Resolution: Promptly and fairly deal with flagged content, user reports, and disputes according to our rule-book. You will step in with diplomacy to de-escalate tensions and guide conversations toward a constructive resolution.



c) Managing User Messaging & Chat Support: Handle direct inquiries, concerns, and support requests that come through private messages and chat, maintaining a prompt, helpful, and on-brand tone.



d) Handling
 Support Inquiries: Manage our support inbox by categorizing, prioritizing, and responding to user questions. You will be responsible for escalating technical issues to the appropriate tea
mber when necessary.



e) Developing and Maintaining a Knowledge Base: Based on recurring questions from the community, you will create, update, and maintain a clear and simple FAQ/Knowledge Base section to help users find answers quickly.



f) Gathering and Reporting Community Feedback: Identify trends, common feature requests, and the overall sentiment of the community. You will provide concise, actionable reports that distinguish constructive feedback from general noise.



[Goal]

The ultimate goal is to build a vibrant, safe, and supportive online community. By championing our guidelines, fostering positive engagement, and providing outstanding support, you will ensure our members feel valued, respected, and eager to participate. You will be the engine of our positive and welcoming community culture.



[What We’re Looking For]

The ideal candidate:



a) Has Proven Community Moderation Experience: You have a strong track record of managing or moderating online communities (e.g., on 
,
 Groups, forums, or social media), with examples or references that speak to your skills.



b) Possesses High Emotional Intelligence: You are empathetic, patient, and skilled at navigating social dynamics online. You can de-escalate conflict, communicate with tact, and understand different user perspectives.



c) Is an Organized and Proactive Communicator: You are meticulous in tracking user inquiries and clear in your written communication. You don't just wait for problems; you actively monitor for potential issues.



d) Has a "Guardian of the Community" Mentality: You see your role as a protector of the community culture and a champion for its members, not just an enforcer of rules.



e) Is Proficient with Social Media & Community Platforms: You are skilled in using platforms such as 
,
, Instagram,
, etc., and are comfortable with helpdesk or ticketing software.



f) Communicates with Clarity and Values Respect: You are reliable, accountable, and can articulate your thoughts in a clear, logical manner.



Important Note:

We value respectful communication. What does it mean?

Most importantly, if you need to step away, just let me or your manager know why and when. We understand it, even if you need to leave tomorrow, BUT ghosting is the last thing you'd like to do, since it causes confusion and delays.

In everyday conversations, our team thrives on mutual respect, no matter your role.



[Why Work With Us?]



Flexible hours to suit your lifestyle.



The opportunity to be the voice and heart of a growing, people-first online community.



Long-term growth opportunities as our company scales.



A supportive environment where your communication skills and emotional intelligence are highly valued.



[About Us]

We are a growing team that believes our community is the cornerstone of our success. We are dedicated to creating an online space that is not only informative and engaging but also genuinely supportive and welcoming. Your role is absolutely critical to making that belief a reality.



[How to Apply]

Subject Line: Start your title with "Community Guardian", or your application can't be considered.



In your application, include:



1) Work History: Share your resume, focusing on your experience in community moderation, customer support, or social media management.



2) Moderation Challenge: What were the 3 most common or serious issues your previous community held, and how did you or your team resolve it. What was the lesson you learned? I'd like to hear the back-end story.



3) All moderation work has its emotional toll. Describe the specific type of user behavior or community conflict that you personally find the most emotionally draining to handle, and be honest about why it gets to you. More importantly, what specific, practical strategies have you developed to protect your own mental well-being and maintain objectivity when you have to deal with that exact situation?



4) Handling a Delicate Situation: You notice a long-time, valuable community member has started making passive-aggressive comments that are discouraging new members but don't explicitly break any major rules. How would you handle this situation privately and publicly to protect the community's welcoming atmosphere without alienating the long-time member?



5) Preferred Tool Stack: What are your go-to tools for social media management, community monitoring, or customer support? Please mention why you prefer them.



6) AI in Your Workflow: Explain where and how you might use AI to improve your productivity, and where you believe a human touch is required while using AI tools in community management.



7) Available Hours: Let us know your general availability (e.g., "Approximately 20 hours per week, mostly flexible between 1PM - 8PM on Monday, 3 PM - 10PM on Tuesday, 12PM - 8PM on Wednesday, ...,  in Philippines time").



8) Available Period of Work: Let us know for how long you expect to work with this job. We'd prefer at least 6 months with opportunities for extension.



9) Willingness for Zoo
etings: Confirm that you're willing to participate in occasional Zoo
etings for team alignment and check-ins.



I will respond to your application in 7-15 days all at once.

We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Android or iOS App Developer
description:
[Caution]

If you are a meticulous developer who is passionate about creating smooth, high-performance mobile experiences and takes pride in writing clean, scalable code, this role will be a great fit.

This position requires a deep understanding of both front-end and back-end mobile development, a keen eye for UI/UX implementation, and the ability to think strategically about the product's architecture and future growth.

If you view app development as simply translating designs into code mostly relying on AI without considering response to errors or bugs, security, and the end-user experience, this role may be a challenge for you.

So, only read further if you’re passionate about building a robust, engaging, and seamless mobile extension for a thriving online community (ideally with a self-assessed ability level of 4.5 out of 5 stars or higher).



[Job Title]

Android/iOS App Developer (synced with our Community Website)



[Work Type]

Remote | Flexible Hours | Long-term Project



[Base Payment]

We offer a project-based compensation structure for those who apply as part-time. That said, the expected monthly range is USD $700–$1,400(for full-time workers), depending on factors such as proficiency, workload, task complexity, performance (including bonuses), experience, skill set, and the final scope of responsibilities.



[Bonus]

There's potential for a performance-based bonus tied to key project milestones, such as a successful app launch and achieving performance metrics. We'll go over those details once you've demonstrated your skills.



[What You’ll Be Doing]

Your role is to be the technical architect and builder of our community website. You will be responsible for creating a high-quality, full-featured platform that provides a seamless and engaging experience for our users. 

Your main tasks will include ONE or MULTIPLE of:



a) API Integration & Data Synchronization: You will be responsible for integrating with our website's backend via APIs to ensure all data (user profiles, content, messages) is perfectly synchronized in real-time between the app and the website, providing a single, unified experience for our users.



b) Native Community Feature Development: You will build the core interactive features of our community—such as content feeds, user profiles, and forums—within the app. This involves creating an intuitive, mobile-first interface for user-generated content submission and ensuring all features have a native look and feel on both iOS and Android.



c) In-App Messaging & Support Systems: You will develop a secure and reliable private messaging system for our users. This includes implementing push notifications to ensure timely communication and integrating a streamlined way for users to access our support channels directly from the app.



d) UI/UX Implementation & Performance Optimization: You will translate UI/UX designs into a pixel-perfect, functional application. Your focus will be on creating a fast, fluid, and responsive user experience, optimizing code and interactions to eliminate lag and ensure consistency across all devices and screen sizes.



e) Comprehensive Testing & Quality Assurance: You will be responsible for rigorously testing the app to identify and fix bugs before launch. This includes creating detailed test cases for all features, covering edge cases, and testing for compatibility across multiple physical devices and OS versions.



f) App Store Deployment & Management: You will manage the entire process of submitting and launching the application on the Google Play Store and Apple App Store. This requires a deep understanding of each store's guidelines to ensure a smooth approval process and optimizing the listings for discoverability.



g) Long-Term Maintenance & Scalability: After launch, you will provide ongoing maintenance, fix bugs, and release updates to ensure compatibility with new iOS and Android versions. You will build the app on a scalable architecture to make it easy to add new features and handle a growing user base in the future





[A Typical Week May Look Like This]



During Development: Writing clean, scalable code for new features. Collaborating with the team on API specifications. Implementing UI designs and animations. Debugging and testing builds on various devices. Committing code to our Git repository.



Post-Launch: Monitoring app performance and crash reports. Planning and developing new features based on community feedback. Releasing updates to ensure compatibility with new iOS and Android versions.



[Goal]

The ultimate goal is to create a fast, reliable, and intuitive mobile app that serves as a seamless extension of our online community. By building a high-quality application, you will empower our members to connect and share on the go, significantly boosting user engagement and making our community an essential part of their daily lives.



[What We’re Looking For]

The ideal candidate:



a) Has a Strong Portfolio: You have verifiable experience building and launching native mobile applications. Not necessary, but it's best if you have live examples in the Apple App Store and/or Google Play Store. Experience with community or social media apps is a huge plus.



b) Is Technically Proficient: You are an expert in your chosen mobile development stack (e.g., Swift/Kotlin, React Native, Flutter) and have deep experience working with REST APIs. You follow best practices and write clean, maintainable code.



c) Is a Natural Problem-Solver: When faced with a technical challenge like a performance bottleneck, you have a logical process for diagnosing the root cause and implementing an effective solution.



d) Is a Clear & Proactive Communicator: You can explain complex technical concepts simply.



e) Is Product-Minded: You care about the end-user experience. You think critically about features and can offer valuable insights to help make the product better.



f) Communicates Effectively and Values Respect: You are reliable, accountable, and understand the importance of clear communication within a remote team.



*Important Note:

We value respectful communication. What does it mean? Most importantly, if you need to step away, just let me or your manager know when. We understand it, even if you need to leave tomorrow, BUT ghosting is the last thing you'd like to do, since it causes confusion and delays. In everyday conversations, our team thrives on mutual respect, no matter your role.



[Why Work With Us?]



-Flexible hours to suit your lifestyle.

-The opportunity to own a project and build an exciting product from the ground up.

-Long-term growth opportunities as our community and app scale.

-A supportive environment where your technical expertise is valued and your impact is visible.



[About Us]

We are building a vibrant online community for content creators. Our mission is to provide a space where members can connect, learn, and grow. Your role in building our mobile app is essential in taking that mission to the next level.



[How to Apply]

Subject Line: Start your title with “iOS App Developer” or "Android App Developer" whichever best identifies you, or your application can't be considered.



In your application, include:



1) Please indicate which items (a–f) from the [What You’ll Be Doing] section above you can handle professionally and confidently.



2) Work History: Based on your response to Question 1, please describe your experience for each item (a–f).



3) Portfolio: Include direct links to your two best live web applications you’ve built. Do not include all your projects. Time is very limited. Briefly describe your specific role and the tech stack used in those two projects.



4) Technical Challenge: Imagine our users are reporting that the app feels slow and "janky" when they scroll through the main content feed. What are the first five steps you would take to diagnose and fix this performance issue?



5) Architectural Scenario: You are tasked with building the in-app private messaging feature. Briefly describe the high-level architecture you would choose to ensure messages are delivered in real-time and that the system is both reliable and secure. Mention any key patterns or technologies you might use.



6) Behind the Scenes. What is a popular trend, library, framework, or 'best practice' in mobile development that you believe is overrated or a poor choice in most situations? Justify your position with a specific example from a past project where you either used it and regretted it, or successfully argued against using it.



7) Preferred Tool Stack: What are your go-to languages, frameworks, libraries, and tools for mobile app development? Please mention why you prefer them.



8) AI in Your Workflow: Although AI-generated code can save time, it may include subtle bugs or security issues that less experienced developers might miss. Explain where and how you use AI to improve your development productivity, and where you deliberately choose not to rely on AI. (We expect you aren't using AI to answer these questions, as they will be discussed in the interview.)



9) Available Hours: Let us know your general availability (e.g., "Approximately 20 hours per week, mostly flexible between 1PM - 8PM on Monday, 3 PM - 10PM on Tuesday, 12PM - 8PM on Wednesday, ...,  in Philippines time").



10) Available Period of Work: Let us know for how long you expect to work with this job. We'd prefer a long-term collaboration.



11) Willingness for Zoo
etings: Confirm that you're willing to participate in occasional Zoo
etings for team alignment and check-ins.
