title: Project Manager
description:
[Caution]

If you are a natural leader who thrives on empowering others and turning a group of individual VAs into a cohesive, motivated team, this role will be a great fit.

This position requires high emotional intelligence, exceptional communication skills, a genuine interest in the well-being of others, and the ability to manage projects not just by delegating, but by inspiring and supporting your team.

If you view project management as simply assigning tasks and tracking deadlines, this role may be a challenge for you.

So, only read further if you’re passionate about cultivating a positive virtual work environment, fostering individual growth, and leading with empathy and care (ideally with a self-assessed ability level of 4.5 out of 5 stars or higher).



[Job Title]

Project Management VA (Team Well-being & Performance)



[Work Type]

Remote | Flexible Hours | Long-term Contract



[Base Payment]

We offer a project-based compensation structure for those who apply as part-time. That said, the expected monthly range is USD $500–$1,000(for full-time workers), depending on factors such as proficiency, workload, task complexity, performance (including bonuses), experience, skill set, and the final scope of responsibilities.



[Bonus]

There's potential for a performance-based bonus tied to team health and project success. Metrics could include team morale, retention rates, and the consistent achievement of project milestones. We'll go over those details once you've demonstrated your skills, but you should be comfortable working with just the base pay initially.



[What You’ll Be Doing]



Your role is to be the supportive and organizational heart of our virtual team. You will be responsible for creating a thriving work environment where every VA can perform at their best. Your main tasks will include:



a) Intelligent & Empathetic Task Delegation: Go beyond simple assignments by understanding each VA's unique skills and current workload. You will align tasks with individual strengths to boost job satisfaction and proactively balance workloads to prevent burnout.



b) Proactive Communication & Culture Building: Establish and maintain clear communication channels, fostering an environment of psychological safety where tea
mbers feel comfortable sharing ideas and concerns. You will actively promote team cohesion through virtual activities and celebrate both individual and team successes.



c) Holistic Well-being & Performance Monitoring: Conduct regular, informal check-ins to gauge team morale and individual well-being, not just project status. You'll be responsible for observing early signs of stress or disengagement and proactively offering support.



d) Constructive Feedback & Development: Provide regular, growth-oriented feedback designed to build skills and confidence. You will identify learning opportunities that align with each VA's career goals, acting as a champion for their professional development.



e) Effective Conflict Resolution: Serve as a neutral and fair mediator in the event of misunderstandings or disagreements. Your emotional intelligence will be key to identifying potential issues before they escalate and guiding the team toward positive resolutions.



f) Resource & Support Management: Ensure all tea
mbers have the tools, information, and resources they need to excel. You will act as their primary advocate and a reliable point of contact for any challenges they may face.



[Goal]

The ultimate goal is to build a high-performing, resilient, and motivated virtual team. By creating a foundation of trust, clear communication, and genuine support, you will ensure our projects are not only completed successfully but that our tea
mbers feel valued, respected, and empowered to do their best work. You will be the engine of our positive and productive team culture.



[What We’re Looking For]

The ideal candidate:



a) Has Proven Team Leadership Experience: You have a strong track record of managing or leading small teams, preferably in a remote setting, with references who can speak to your interpersonal skills.



b) Possesses High Emotional Intelligence: You are empathetic, self-aware, and skilled at navigating interpersonal dynamics. You can motivate, mediate, and communicate with tact and understanding.



c) Is an Organized and Proactive Communicator: You are meticulous in your planning and clear in your communication. You don't wait for problems to arise; you anticipate needs and facilitate smooth workflows.



d) Has a "Player-Coach" Mentality: You see your role as a leader who is invested in the success and well-being of your team, not just a manager who directs. You genuinely enjoy helping others grow.



e) Is Proficient with Modern PM Tools: You are skilled in using project management and communication platforms (e.g., Asana, Trello, Slack, etc.) to foster collaboration and clarity.



f) Communicates with Clarity and Values Respect: You are reliable, accountable, and can articulate your thoughts in a clear, logical manner.



Important Note:

We value respectful communication. What does it mean?

Most importantly, if you need to step away, just let me or your manager know why and when. We understand it, even if you need to leave tomorrow, BUT ghosting is the last thing you'd like to do, since it causes confusion and delays.

In everyday conversations, our team thrives on mutual respect, no matter your role.



[Why Work With Us?]



Flexible hours to suit your lifestyle.



The opportunity to be a foundational leader in a people-first company culture.



Long-term growth opportunities as our company scales.



A supportive environment where your leadership and emotional intelligence are highly valued.



[About Us]

We are a growing team dedicated to achieving our goals through a culture of collaboration and mutual support. We believe that our success is a direct result of our team's well-being and that a positive environment is essential for creating outstanding work. Your role is absolutely critical to making that belief a reality.



[How to Apply]

Subject Line: Start your title with either "Project Manager", or your application can't be considered.



In your application, include:



1) Work History: Share your resume, focusing on your experience leading, managing, or coordinating teams.



2) Subtle Observation & Action: Imagine you notice one of your most reliable VAs has suddenly become very brief in their communications—using one-word answers and no emojis, which is highly unusual for them. Their work quality is still excellent, but they seem disengaged. Describe your internal thought process and the specific, subtle actions you would take over the next 48 hours before escalating to a formal meeting.



3) Leadership Challenge & Dialogue: One of your VAs is a talented writer who is fantastic at executing assigned tasks, but they rarely contribute original ideas in team brainstorming sessions. Your goal is to help them develop the confidence to become a more proactive contributor. What are the first three open-ended questions you would ask them in a private check-in to understand their perspective before you offer any advice?



4) Creative Solution: If you had a 'magic wand' to instantly create one new tool, system, or a specific team ritual that doesn't exist yet, what would you create to solve the single biggest challenge you believe? Give it a name and explain how it would specifically foster both productivity and well-being.



5) Preferred Tool Stack: What are your go-to tools for project management, task tracking, and team communication? Please mention why you prefer them.



6) AI in Your Workflow: Explain where and how you use AI to improve your productivity, and where you deliberately choose not to rely on AI in a team management context. (Wish you aren't using AI for answering these questions, because they will be further discussed in the interview later.)



7) Available Hours: Let us know your general availability (e.g., "Approximately 20 hours per week, mostly flexible between 1PM - 8PM on Monday, 3 PM - 10PM on Tuesday, 12PM - 8PM on Wednesday, ...,  in Philippines time").



8) Available Period of Work: Let us know for how long you expect to work with us. We'd prefer at least 6 months with opportunities for extension.



9) Willingness for Zoo
etings: Confirm that you're willing to participate in occasional Zoo
etings for team alignment and check-ins.



I will respond to your application in 7-15 days all at once.

We look forward to hearing from you.

title: WordPress Developer (Website Admin)
description:
[Caution]

If you are a technical problem-solver at heart who thrives on building robust, secure, and efficient web solutions, this role will be a great fit.

This position requires deep proficiency in the WordPress ecosystem, a high degree of analytical skill for debugging, meticulous attention to detail in your code, and the ability to take ownership of a website's technical health. You will be responsible for the core infrastructure that powers our online presence.

If these values don't align with yours, this job can be a challenge for you.

So, only read further if you’re passionate about writing clean code, optimizing performance, and building the stable, secure foundation that allows a website to scale (ideally with a self-assessed ability level of 4.5 out of 5 stars or higher).



[Job Title]

Back-end WordPress Developer (Website Admin)



[Work Type]

Remote | Flexible Hours | Long-term Contract



[Base Payment]

We offer a project-based compensation structure for those who apply as part-time. That said, the expected monthly range is USD $500–$1,000(for full-time workers), depending on factors such as proficiency, workload, task complexity, performance (including bonuses), experience, skill set, and the final scope of responsibilities.



[Bonus]

There's potential for a performance-based bonus tied to the quality and impact of your work, such as meeting project deadlines and achieving key performance metrics (e.g., uptime, page speed improvements, security). We'll go over those details once you've demonstrated your skills, but you should be comfortable working with just the base pay initially.



[What You’ll Be Doing]



Your role is to be the technical guardian and engine of our WordPress website. You will be responsible for all back-end aspects of the site, ensuring it is secure, fast, and scalable. Your main tasks will include:



a) Custom Plugin & Theme Development: You will extend our website's functionality by developing custom plugins and theme features. This requires writing clean, well-documented code that adheres strictly to WordPress coding standards to ensure long-term maintainability and compatibility.



b) Database Management & Optimization: You will be responsible for the health of our WordPress database. This includes writing efficient database queries to ensure fast page loads and implementing robust security and backup protocols to protect our data.



c) Server-Side Scripting & PHP Logic: You will build and manage the core logic that powers our website's dynamic features. A deep understanding of PHP and WordPress Hooks (Actions and Filters) is essential to customize functionality without compromising the core structure.



d) API Integration & Management: You will connect our website with third-party services and applications. This involves leveraging the WordPress REST API and ensuring all data exchange is handled securely and efficiently.



e) Proactive Security & Maintenance: You will own our website's security posture. This involves implementing proactive security measures against common vulnerabilities (like XSS), performing regular malware scans, and diligently managing all updates for the WordPress core, themes, and plugins.



f) Website Performance Optimization: You will be tasked with making our website as fast as possible. Your responsibilities will include implementing effective caching strategies, optimizing database queries, and minifying code and resources to improve user experience and SEO rankings.



g) Advanced Troubleshooting & Debugging: When technical issues arise, you will be the expert responsible for diagnosing and resolving them. You must have strong problem-solving skills and be proficient with debugging tools to efficiently identify the root cause of any plugin conflict or server error.



[Goal]

The ultimate goal is to provide our business with a rock-solid, secure, and high-performing website. By transforming technical requirements into robust back-end solutions, you will ensure our digital platform is reliable, scalable, and provides a seamless experience for our users. You will be the engine of stability for our entire online operation.



[What We’re Looking For]

The ideal candidate:



a) Has Verifiable WordPress Development Experience: You have a strong portfolio showcasing custom plugins, themes, or complex back-end solutions you have built for WordPress.



b) Is a Master Problem-Solver: You can connect disparate symptoms to identify the root cause of a technical issue and can architect elegant, long-term solutions.



c) Is Meticulous and Security-Focused: You have a passion for writing clean, efficient code and a methodical approach to website security and maintenance.



d) Has a Proactive and Ownership Mindset: You don’t just fix problems as they appear; you anticipate future needs and continuously work to improve the website's performance and security.



e) Is Proficient with the Modern WordPress Stack: You are highly skilled in PHP, MySQL, JavaScript, and the WordPress REST API, and are comfortable using modern development and debugging tools.



f) Communicates with Clarity and Values Respect: You are reliable, accountable, and can explain complex technical issues in a clear, logical manner.



*Important Note:

We value respectful communication. What does it mean?

Most importantly, if you need to step away, just let me or your manager know why and when. We understand it, even if you need to leave tomorrow, BUT ghosting is the last thing you'd like to do, since it causes confusion and delays.

In everyday conversations, our team thrives on mutual respect, no matter your role.



[Why Work With Us?]

-Flexible hours to suit your lifestyle.

-The opportunity to be the foundational technical owner of a growing digital platform.

-Long-term growth opportunities as our company scales.

-A supportive environment where your technical expertise is valued and your impact is visible.



[About Us]

We are a growing team dedicated to providing an exceptional online experience in our industry. Our mission is to build a digital platform our audience can rely on. Your role is absolutely essential in building and maintaining the technical integrity that will make that mission a reality.



[How to Apply]

Subject Line: Start your title with either "Back-End WordPress Pro", or your application can't be considered.



In your application, include:



1) Portfolio & Code Samples: Share your resume, links to just your best 1~2 works(preferably your previous client's websites, stating your specific role). Do not share a link to everything you've done. Time is very limited.



2) Imagine this: It's Monday morning, and you get an urgent message. A client's website is intermittently showing a blank white screen (the WordPress White Screen of Death). They say they haven't changed anything. You have FTP and database access. Tell me the first five steps you would take, in the exact order you would take them, and narrate your reasoning for each action.



3) Troubleshooting Challenge: Your client's WordPress site has suddenly become very slow. Describe your process for diagnosing the issue. What are the first five things you would investigate and why?



4) Security Challenge: You suspect a WordPress site has been compromised. Briefly outline the key steps you would take to identify the breach, clean the site, and harden it against future attacks.



5) Beyond the obvious answers, what is one specific part of the WordPress core API or architecture that you genuinely admire for its design, and why? Conversely, what is one part that you find consistently frustrating or poorly designed, and how do you typically work around its limitations in your projects?



6) Preferred Tool Stack: What is your go-to development environment? Please list any specific debugging tools, IDEs, and version control systems you prefer to use.



7) Explain where and how you use AI to improve your productivity, and where you deliberately choose not to rely on AI. (Wish you aren't using AI for answering these questions, because they will be further discussed in the interview later.)



8) Available Hours: Let us know your general availability (e.g., "Approximately 20 hours per week, mostly flexible between 1PM - 8PM on Monday, 3 PM - 10PM on Tuesday, 12PM - 8PM on Wednesday, ...,  in Philippines time").



9) Available Period of Work: Let us know for how long you expect to work with us. We'd prefer at least 6 months with opportunities for extension.



10) Willingness for Zoo
etings: Confirm that you're willing to participate in occasional Zoo
etings for team alignment and check-ins.



I will respond to your application in 7-15 days all at once.

We look forward to hearing from you

title: Full-Stack Developer
description:
[Caution]

If you are a meticulous developer who is passionate about building robust, scalable web applications and takes pride in writing clean, efficient code for both the front-end and back-end, this role will be a great fit.

This position requires a deep understanding of the entire development lifecycle, from database design and API architecture to creating intuitive and responsive user interfaces.

If you view development as simply connecting pre-built components or relying heavily on AI without a deep consideration for security, performance, and the end-user experience, this role may be a challenge for you.

So, only read further if you’re passionate about building the entire foundation for a thriving online community from the ground up (ideally with a self-assessed programming ability level of 4.5 out of 5 stars or higher).



[Job Title]

Full-Stack Developer (Community Platform)



[Work Type]

Remote | Flexible Hours | Long-term Project



[Base Payment]

We offer a project-based compensation structure for those who apply as part-time. That said, the expected monthly range is USD $700–$1,400(for full-time workers), depending on factors such as proficiency, workload, task complexity, performance (including bonuses), experience, skill set, and the final scope of responsibilities.



[Bonus]

There's potential for a performance-based bonus tied to key project milestones, such as a successful platform launch and achieving performance metrics. We'll go over those details once you've demonstrated your skills.



[What You’ll Be Doing]



Your role is to be the technical architect and builder of our community website. You will be responsible for creating a high-quality, full-featured platform that provides a seamless and engaging experience for our users. 

Your main tasks will include ONE or MULTIPLE of:



a) Full-Stack Platform Architecture & Development: You will design and build the entire community website from the ground up, creating a scalable database schema (e.g., with PostgreSQL/MongoDB) and developing a responsive front-end architecture using a modern framework (e.g., React, Vue).



b) Community Feature Implementation: You will develop the core features that bring our community to life, including dynamic user profiles, personalized content feeds, and the systems for creating, sharing, and commenting on posts.



c) User & Admin Communication Systems: You will build a secure, real-time messaging interface for users to contact our support team and integrate third-party
 services (e.g., SendGrid) for automated notifications and contact form submissions.



d) Security & User Authentication: You will implement a robust user authentication system with secure login/registration flows, password hashing, and session management. You'll apply security best practices throughout the stack to protect against common vulnerabilities (XSS, SQL injection).



e) End-to-End Testing & Quality Assurance: You will be responsible for the entire testing process, from writing unit and integration tests to debugging issues across the full stack to ensure a stable and bug-free user experience.



f) Deployment & Maintenance: You will manage the deployment pipeline (CI/CD) to a cloud environment (e.g., AWS, Vercel), monitor application performance, and perform ongoing maintenance to keep the platform fast and reliable as it grows.



[A Typical Week May Look Like This]



During Development: Architecting database models. Building out REST API endpoints. Writing clean, scalable code for new front-end and back-end features. Debugging and testing functionality across various browsers. Committing code to our Git repository.



Post-Launch: Monitoring server performance and error logs. Planning and developing new features based on community feedback. Optimizing database queries and code to improve speed and efficiency.



[Goal]

The ultimate goal is to create a fast, secure, and intuitive web platform that serves as the central hub for our online community. By building a high-quality website, you will empower our members to connect, share, and engage in a meaningful way, making our community an essential part of their online experience.



[What We’re Looking For]

The ideal candidate:



a) Has a Strong Portfolio: You have verifiable experience building and launching full-stack web applications. You can show us live examples of projects you have built.



b) Is Technically Proficient: You are an expert in your chosen full-stack technologies (e.g., MERN, LAMP, Django/Python, Ruby on Rails) and have deep experience designing and consuming REST APIs. You follow best practices and write clean, maintainable code.



c) Is a Natural Problem-Solver: When faced with a technical challenge like a slow database query or a complex front-end state issue, you have a logical process for diagnosing the root cause and implementing an effective solution.



d) Is a Clear & Proactive Communicator: You can explain complex technical concepts simply to non-technical tea
mbers.



e) Is Product-Minded: You care about the end-user experience. You think critically about features and can offer valuable insights to help make the product better from both a technical and user perspective.



f) Communicates Effectively and Values Respect: You are reliable, accountable, and understand the importance of clear communication within a remote team.



*Important Note:

We value respectful communication. What does it mean? Most importantly, if you need to step away, just let me or your manager know when. We understand it, even if you need to leave tomorrow, BUT ghosting is the last thing you'd like to do, since it causes confusion and delays. In everyday conversations, our team thrives on mutual respect, no matter your role.



[Why Work With Us?]



-Flexible hours to suit your lifestyle.

-The opportunity to own a project and build an exciting product from the ground up.

-Long-term growth opportunities as our community and platform scale.

-A supportive environment where your technical expertise is valued and your impact is visible.



[About Us]

We are building a vibrant online community for content creators. Our mission is to provide a space where members can connect, learn, and grow. Your role in building our web platform is the critical foundation for that mission.



[How to Apply]

Subject Line: Start your title with “Full-Stack Developer”, or your application can't be considered.



In your application, include:



1) Please indicate which items (a–f) from the [What You’ll Be Doing] section above you can handle professionally and confidently.



2) Work History: Based on your response to Question 1, please describe your experience for each item (a–f).



3) Portfolio: Include direct links to your two best live web applications you’ve built. Briefly describe your specific role and the tech stack used in those two projects.



4) Technical Challenge: Imagine our users are reporting that the website's main content feed is slow to load and feels "laggy" when they scroll. What are the first five steps you would take to diagnose and fix this performance issue, considering both the front-end and back-end?



5) Architectural Scenario: You are tasked with building the user-to-admin private messaging feature. Briefly describe the high-level architecture you would choose to ensure messages are delivered in real-time and that the system is both reliable and secure. Mention key front-end, back-end, and database considerations.



6) Describe the most challenging or poorly-documented piece of legacy code you were tasked with modifying. What made it so difficult to understand? Walk me through your methodical process for safely making your required change without breaking anything.



7) Preferred Tool Stack: What are your go-to languages, frameworks, databases, and tools for full-stack web development? Please mention why you prefer them.



8) AI in Your Workflow: Although AI-generated code can save time, it may include subtle bugs or security issues that less experienced developers might miss. Explain where and how you use AI to improve your development productivity, and where you deliberately choose not to rely on AI. (We expect you aren't using AI to answer these questions, as they will be discussed in the interview.)



9) Available Hours: Let us know your general availability (e.g., "Approximately 20 hours per week, mostly flexible between 1PM - 8PM on Monday, 3 PM - 10PM on Tuesday, 12PM - 8PM on Wednesday, ..., in Philippines time").



10) Available Period of Work: Let us know for how long you expect to work with this job. We'd prefer a long-term collaboration.

etings: Confirm that you're willing to participate in occasional Zoo
etings for team alignment and check-ins.

, Instagram, TikTok).

title: Inbound Outbound sales
description:
Whale Done Sprinklers & Irrigation – Home Services (USA)



We are a growing U.S.-based home service company (sprinkler, irrigation, drainage) looking for a reliable, organized, and confident CSR to handle both inbound and outbound calls.



Monday – Friday

7:00 AM – 7:00 PM Texas Central Time

$1000 monthly Salary 



This role is for someone who:

Loves structure and process

Is comfortable on the phone

Is not afraid to make outbound calls

Can schedule appointments, handle follow-ups, and ask for payment confidently

Cares about serving homeowners well while still hitting numbers



If you’ve worked with HVAC, plumbing, cleaning, or any home service business, that’s a huge plus.



????? What You’ll Be Doing

Answering inbound calls from homeowners

Making outbound calls to:

Past customers

Follow-ups and call-backs

Potential referral partners

Scheduling appointments accurately

Explaining our process clearly and calmly

Asking for payment as part of the scheduling process

Handling common objections (price, “I’ll think about it,” “I’ll call around,” etc.)

Logging calls, notes, and follow-ups in our system

Tracking your daily call activity and results

Representing our brand with professional, calm, respectful communication



? This Role Is a Great Fit If You:

Are highly organized and like following systems

Are comfortable talking on the phone all day

Are not afraid of outbound calls

Can stay calm and professional with customers

Can be empathetic but still guide the call to a decision

Are reliable, consistent, and detail-oriented

Care about doing things the right way, not just the fast way

Are comfortable with sales conversations in a helpful, non-pushy way

Like tracking numbers and improving performance



? Big Plus If You Have:

Experience speaking with American customers

Experience in:

HVAC

Plumbing

Cleaning services

Irrigation / home services

Call center scheduling roles

Experience with:

Booking appointments

Handling objections

Follow-ups and call-backs

CRM or call tracking systems



? Schedule & Pay

Monday – Friday

7:00 AM – 7:00 PM Texas Central Time



Bonuses for after-hours and weekend bookings

Long-term, stable position for the right person

Performance and reliability are rewarded



? This Role Is NOT for You If:

You dislike structure, scripts, or processes

You are uncomfortable making outbound calls

You avoid asking for payment or closing the loop

You prefer chat/email only and don’t like phone work

You don’t like tracking your numbers or performance



???? How to Apply



Please share your disc profile and also 

read the following and put them in order based on which Values fit you better?



What I am looking for in no particular order is how would you rank the Blueprint, Action, Nurture, Knowledge in order based on your personality?

title: Remote Medical Scribe (Pain Management) – Real?Time Charting | Full?Time | US Central Hours | eClinicalWorks (Training P
description:
Are you a healthcare professional who prefers clinical documentation over bedside care?



We are a stable, physician-led Interventional Pain Management practice based in Kansas, USA. We are looking for a long-term tea
mber to serve as our Medical Scribe and Clinical Admin.



This is NOT a short-term project. We are looking for a smart, fast, and tech-savvy professional to become the doctor's "right hand" virtually.



ABOUT THE ROLE:

You will work directly with the physician during patient encounters. You are not just typing; you are managing the clinical workflow.



Live Scribing: Documenting History of Present Illness (HPI), Physical Exams (PE), and Treatment Plans in real-time.



eClinicalWorks (eCW) Management: Navigating the EMR, creating templates, and managing orders.



Clinical Admin: Handling Prior Authorizations, referrals, and faxing.



Medical Necessity: ensuring notes are written to support insurance billing requirements.



WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR (The "Hybrid" Profile):

We do not strictly require an RN or PT license. We value speed, logic, and English fluency above all else.



Ideal Professional Backgrounds:



Experienced Healthcare BPO Agents (with clinical accounts).



Licensed Pharmacists (RPh) – Highly encouraged to apply.



Medical Technologists (RMT).



Nurses (RN) or Physical Therapists (PT) if you have strong computer skills.



REQUIRED HARD SKILLS:



Typing Speed: Minimum 55+ WPM (Non-negotiable). You must be able to keep up with dictation.



Tech Savvy: Comfortable using dual monitors, navigating multiple tabs, and learning complex software (eClinicalWorks).



English Mastery: Neutral accent for phone tasks and near-perfect written grammar for charting.



Connectivity: Wired Fiber Internet (25Mbps+) with a Back-up Power Source (Generator/Battery) required within 21 days of hiring.



PREFERRED (But We Will Train the Right Person):



Experience with eClinicalWorks (eCW).



Experience in Pain Management, Orthopedics, or PM&R.



Experience with Prior Authorizations and Insurance Verification.



WHAT WE OFFER:



Competitive Pay: $5.50 - $7.00/hour (depending on experience).



Growth: Performance review and potential raise at 90 days.



Training: We invest in you. We provide paid training on our specific eCW templates and Pain Management protocols.



Stability: Direct hire with the physician (no agency middleman).



Schedule: Fixed Shift. Monday - Friday, 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM US Central Time. (Approx 10:00 PM - 7:00 AM PH Time).



HOW TO APPLY (Read Carefully):

To ensure you are detail-oriented, please follow these steps exactly. Generic applications will be archived.



Send a message with the subject line: "PAIN FREE SCRIBE - [Your Name]"



In the body of the message, include:



Your Medical/Professional Background (e.g., "I am a Pharmacist").



Your Typing Speed (WPM).



Do you have experience with eClinicalWorks? (Yes/No).



Do you have a backup power source? (Yes/No).



Attach your Resume and a link to your OnlineJobs.ph profile.



We are interviewing immediately. We look forward to meeting our new tea
mber!

title: Senior Graphic Designer
description:
Graphic Designer – Social Media & Presentations

Remote | Australian Creative Agency | Philippines Preferred

Full-time for the right person, however we will also consider ongoing freelance arrangements with an ongoing retainer/agreed work per month.



APPLICATION FORM: 



Hey there!



We're a creative agency that helps businesses tell their stories through photography, videography, social media, and Meta advertising. We've been around since 2017 and currently manage growing retainer client base across B2B and service-based industries.



We're looking for a Graphic Designer to join our team and take ownership of our visual design output — both the social media content we create for clients and the internal materials that represent our own brand.



Being able to adapt/enhance a client's existing brand is also important. Some clients come to us with excellent brand playbooks and assets, others have a font and a logo and then it's up to us to get creative with it. So someone who who can develop the brand is important too.



If you're someone who takes real pride in clean, polished design work, can manage multiple brands without mixing them up, and can make a pitch deck look like it belongs in a boardroom — keep reading.



What You'll Actually Be Doing:



Client Social Media Design (the majority of your time):



- Designing carousels, static posts, video thumbnails, and story assets for our retainer clients across Instagram,
, and LinkedIn

- Working within established brand guidelines for each client — you'll manage multiple brand identities simultaneously

- Receiving briefs through ClickUp and delivering designs for internal review before they go to the client

- Maintaining visual consistency across each client's content so their feed looks intentional, not random



Internal & Agency Design:



- Updating and designing our pitch decks and proposals — these are what we use to win new clients, so they need to look sharp

- Creating and formatting strategy presentations and content plans for client delivery

- Designing internal templates, one-pagers, capability statements, and other brand collateral

- Producing social media content for Narrative Hub's own channels

- Refining the visual format of our monthly client reports



The Tools You'll Work With:



- Canva (Pro): Our preferred tool for day-to-day social media designs. Many clients have existing Canva templates that you'll build on and maintain. We're flexible on tools as long as the quality is there and revisions can be turned around quickly.

- Adobe Creative Suite: Illustrator, Photoshop, and InDesign for more complex work — pitch decks, detailed presentations, advanced graphics, and anything that needs precision layout. We need you to be genuinely proficient here, not just familiar.

- ClickUp: Where all briefs, feedback, time tracking, and task management lives. This is our central hub.

- Dropbox: File storage and sharing for all working files and final deliverables.

- PowerPoint / Google Slides: For presentation design and formatting as needed.

- We provide all software subscriptions (Adobe, Canva Pro, etc.), Dropbox storage, and ClickUp access. You provide your own hardware and a reliable internet connection.



What We're Looking For



Must-haves:



- 3+ years of professional graphic design experience, ideally in an agency or managing multiple brand accounts

- Strong portfolio showing social media design work — carousels, static posts, branded content

- Experience designing presentations and pitch decks to a high standard

- Proficient in both Canva and Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign)

- Solid understanding of typography, layout, visual hierarchy, and brand application

- Detail-oriented — you notice when spacing is off, a colour is wrong, or a font doesn't match

- Clear written communication in English

- Comfortable with feedback and revisions — it's part of the process, not a personal critique



Good to have:



- Experience working with Australian businesses or in a similar time zone

- Familiarity with social media platform specs and best practices (image sizes, safe zones, etc.)

- Experience with B2B or service-based brands specifically



What You Won't Be Doing



Just to set expectations:



- No video editing (we have dedicated editors for that)

- No social media scheduling or community management

- No photography or videography

- No website design or development

- No Meta ad campaign management



You won't be expected to write copy, but you may need to take our briefs and alter them to suit the designs. If you are very capable at copywriting, we will be happy for you to assist with writing copy for these posts as well, however it won't be necessary.



How We Work



You'll have a dual reporting structure:



- Social Media Manager/Coordinator: manages your day-to-day client work — they'll brief you, review your designs, and keep you aligned with content calendars

- Managing Director: will brief you directly on all internal work — pitch decks, proposals, strategy presentations, and internal branding.

- The Social Media Coordinator will also work closely with you on content calendar alignment and design briefs.



Our process is straightforward:



- You receive a brief in ClickUp with all the details — client, content type, messaging, brand assets

- You design, tracking your time in ClickUp as you go

- Internal review (1 round) — Social Media Manager or Coordinator for client work, MD for internal work.

- Client approval (1 round) — managed by the Social Media Manager

- Final files exported and saved to Dropbox, ready for scheduling

- If a brief is unclear, we expect you to ask before you start — not after you've completed a draft.



The Details



Location: Remote — Philippines-based candidates preferred

Employment Type: To be confirmed (may be full-time via EOR or contract)

Hours: Minimum 6–8 hours overlap with Brisbane business hours (9am–5pm AEST)

Communication: ClickUp for tasks and feedback, ClickUp Chat for quick questions and check-ins

Start Date: TBC



Interested?



- If this sounds like a good fit, we'd love to hear from you. In your application, please share fill out the below form so we can assess your application:



APPLICATION FORM: 



Please be sure to include in the form:



- A link to your portfolio (or a few examples of your best social media design and presentation work)

- A brief overview of your experience — especially if you've worked in an agency or managed multiple brands

- Which tools you're most comfortable in (Canva, Adobe Suite, or both) and how you typically approach a design brief

- Any other information it asks for



Thank you and we wish you the best with your application!

title: You Tube Thumbnail Designer (Pets) Long Term
description:
Hi!

We run a faceless YouTube channel about pets (mostly dogs, cats, puppies, and kittens), and we’re looking for thumbnail designers who can consistently create scroll-stopping, curiosity-provoking thumbnails that are readable instantly on a phone screen.



This is not a traditional full-time position.



We work with a small roster of designers and assign thumbnails on a per-thumbnail basis. Some designers specialize in compilation thumbnails, and some in info-style thumbnails. If we’re a good fit, this can become steady, long-term work.

________________________________________

The Most Important Skill (Please Read)

Our #1 rule:

If the thumbnail doesn’t read in one second at small mobile size, while people are scrolling on their phones, it doesn’t work.

We design for the phone screen first, not the desktop screen.



That means:

• Clear visual story

• Strong focal point

• Minimal clutter

• Expressions and emotion that are easy to read

• Clean backgrounds or simplified compositions when needed



Many frames from videos are busy or cluttered, so part of the job is knowing how to simplify, isolate, and clarify the story visually.



If this is something you’re already good at, you’ll do very well with us.

________________________________________

How This Role Works



We provide a shared folder with the materials you need to create your video thumbnail. Depending on the type of video/thumbnail it can include things like:

• The video title/video

• Thumbnail direction/brief/concept/idea

• Sample thumbnails that match our channel style and tone



Your role is to design a thumbnail that matches the overall look, feel, and strategy of the channel—while still using your design judgment to make it visually strong and clickable.



Revisions are a normal part of the process as we refine thumbnails for performance.

________________________________________

What We Need From You

• Strong graphic design skills

• Experience designing thumbnails specifically for YouTube

• Ability to simplify and declutter images

• Ability to create a clear visual “story” at small size

• Ability to understand and visually convey emotion (especially animal expressions)

• Ability to follow a design brief and implement feedback

• Reliable communication and turnaround

________________________________________

How Payment Works

• Paid per thumbnail

• Ongoing work available for designers who perform well

• Paid tests required before joining our team

Designers work at their own pace, as long as deadlines are met.

________________________________________

How to Apply (Important)

To apply, include the word fancy at the top of your message.

Please also include:

• Your YouTube thumbnail design experience (channels or niches)

• 2–5 samples of your YouTube thumbnails (links or portfolio)

• Two or more of your thumbnails optimized for mobile

• The graphic design software you use

• Your typical turnaround time for one thumbnail

________________________________________

Paid Test

If your application is selected, the first step in the process is to start with a paid test to determine your skills and capabilities and fit for our needs.



We’re looking for designers who want steady work and enjoy improving thumbnails to make them perform as well as possible.



Thanks — looking forward to seeing your work!

________________________________________

title: Part-Time Personal Assistant & Notion Systems Builder (No-Code / Automation Focus)

Other weeks may involve research, organizing information, light recruiting, coordinating tools, content assistance, or general virtual support. - Build and improve Notion dashboards, databases, and templates

- Maintain and organize task systems and project boards

- Create simple automations using tools like Make or Zapier

- Connect Notion with other SaaS tools

- Research, summarize, and organize information

- Assist with light recruiting and project coordination

- Help document repeatable processes

- Support course creation or basic Canva/marketing tasks as needed



What I’m Looking For:



- Strong Notion experience (required)

- Comfortable with no-code automation tools

- Organized and detail-oriented

- Proactive and able to work independently

- Comfortable with ambiguity and evolving responsibilities

- Willing to do both thinking work and straightforward admin tasks



You don’t need to know everything — but you must be resourceful and able to figure things out.



Top candidates will be selected for a video interview, which will include a live Notion screen share to gauge proficiency.

title: AI Video Creator / AI Visual Artist (Luxury Beauty & Wellness)
description:
About Nora Stockholm



Nora Stockholm is a premium Scandinavian beauty and longevity brand focused on collagen rituals, sleep optimization, and structured self-care for modern women 30+.



We are building a calm, minimal, elevated brand rooted in Scandinavian design principles — natural light, restraint, ritual, softness, and quiet authority.



We are now looking for a highly aesthetic, detail-oriented AI Brand & Content Strategist to help us build and scale our organic social presence using AI influencers and AI-generated content — without losing authenticity.



Your Role



You will be responsible for shaping how Nora Stockholm shows up organically on Instagram, TikTok, and potentially YouTube Shorts — using AI tools to create consistent, high-end brand visuals and storytelling.



This is NOT a generic social media role.



We are looking for someone who:



Understands AI influencers and virtual personalities



Knows how to build emotional brand narratives



Has strong aesthetic judgment (Scandinavian minimalism preferred)



Can translate brand values into visual systems



Thinks long-term brand equity, not short-term trends



Responsibilities

1. AI Influencer Strategy



Research and develop AI influencer concepts aligned with Nora Stockholm



Create personality frameworks (tone, values, rituals, visual language)



Define how AI personas integrate into brand storytelling



Ensure consistency across platforms



2. Organic Social Content System



Develop a structured organic content strategy



Create content pillars (ritual, longevity, identity, transformation, etc.)



Write high-quality captions with emotional depth



Develop hooks and structured storytelling formats



Plan 30–90 day content roadmaps



3. Visual Direction & Aesthetic Control



Work from (and help refine) the brandbook



Define lighting, color palette, textures, mood



Guide AI image generation prompts to match brand standards



Ensure everything looks premium and cohesive



Maintain a calm, Scandinavian visual identity



4. Messaging & Brand Language



Refine tone of voice (confident, minimal, structured)



Translate complex ideas (collagen, sleep, longevity) into aspirational storytelling



Avoid hype marketing — focus on identity and ritual



Requirements



Strong understanding of AI image generation tools (Midjourney, DALL·E, etc.)



Experience working with AI influencers or virtual personas



Excellent written English



Strong visual taste and brand sensitivity



Experience working with beauty, wellness, or lifestyle brands



Understanding of Scandinavian design principles is a major plus



Ability to think strategically — not just execute posts



Bonus (Not Required but Valuable)



Experience with Nordic brands



Background in branding, creative direction, or design



Familiarity with luxury or premium positioning



Understanding of long-term brand building vs performance marketing



What We’re NOT Looking For




 marketers



Trend chasers



Generic social media managers



Canva-only designers without brand thinking



We are building a long-term premium brand. Precision and taste matter.



Working Structure



Remote



Long-term collaboration



Clear KPIs tied to brand growth and organic authority



Direct communication with founder



Opportunity to grow into Head of Brand / Creative Lead



To Apply



Please include:



Portfolio (especially AI-generated work or brand projects)



Examples of captions you’ve written



A short explanation of how you would build an AI influencer for a Scandinavian longevity brand



Your monthly salary expectation (full-time)

title: Multi-Channel Lead Generator VA – Meta Ads Specialist + B2B/B2C Outreach for Central Florida Home Improvement Contractor
description:
Hello!



I’m Carsten, owner of a home improvement business based in Central Florida (near Orlando). We specialize in custom screen enclosures, durable garage floor epoxy coatings, full home renovations, and high-quality paver installations for residential homeowners (B2C) and B2B clients (general contractors, property managers, commercial properties, real estate developers, HOAs, etc.).

I’m hiring a skilled Virtual Assistant to generate qualified leads through multiple channels, with Meta 
 & Instagram) Ads as the primary focus, plus targeted B2B and B2C outreach. I’m open to proven methods including cold
s (for both homeowners and businesses), cold calls, LinkedIn prospecting, and other effective tactics that fit our Central Florida market.



Primary Focus: Meta Ads for Lead Gen

•  Launch/optimize Lead Generation campaigns (instant forms) targeting B2C homeowners and B2B businesses in Central Florida.

•  Build audiences, A/B test creatives (using our after photos/videos), manage budgets, track metrics (CPL/ROAS/CTR), aim for 20-50+ qualified leads/month (mix of residential + commercial).

•  Integrate leads to Zoho CRM (Zoho One/CRM experience or similar is a big plus).

•  Weekly reports + scaling ideas.



Strong Emphasis on B2B & B2C Outreach

•  LinkedIn: Prospect decision-makers (GCs, developers, property managers), personalized messages/connections, value content posting.

•  Cold
: Compliant sequences (CAN-SPAM rules) targeting both B2B businesses (e.g., contractors/HOAs) and B2C homeowners (e.g., personalized tips for local FL home upgrades).

•  Open to: Cold calls (for high-value prospects), Google My Business/Nextdoor engagement, basic SEO, referrals, or other channels that deliver results.

•  Partnership building: Reach out to realtors, landscapers, architects for collaborations.



Requirements:

•  Proven lead gen experience (Meta Ads required; B2B/B2C outreach/LinkedIn/cold
 experience is a big bonus—share examples/results).

•  Comfort with Meta Business Manager, instant forms, Zoho or similar CRM.

•  Strong English, proactive, data-driven, US Eastern Time overlap for calls/approvals.

•  Bonus: Experience with compliance (CAN-SPAM/TCPA) for outreach.



Compensation & Details:

•  Compensation based on experience, skills, and proven results.

•  Start part-time (20–30 hours/week), potential full-time.

•  Performance bonuses possible (e.g., based on lead volume/quality).

To apply, please include:

1.  Your experience across channels (Meta Ads examples/results, any B2B/B2C outreach/cold
/cold call metrics).

2.  CRM experience (Zoho?).

3.  Why multi-channel lead gen for Central Florida home services excites you.

Excited to find someone who can build a powerful, mixed pipeline of homeowner (B2C) and commercial/B2B opportunities!



This job starts as a part-time role (20–30 hours/week) to build and test our lead gen systems. If results are strong and it makes sense for both sides, we’ll scale hours up significantly (potentially full-time) with increased pay opportunities.



Thanks,



Carsten

Central Florida

title: Real Estate Wholesaling VA (BatchLeads List Building + Comps) – Part-Time
description:
JOB TITLE: Real Estate Wholesaling VA (BatchLeads List Building + Comps) – Part-Time



COMPANY: SVK Acquisitions Partners (Massachusetts)



HOURS: 10–15 hours/week to start (opportunity to increase)

TIME ZONE: Prefer applicants who can overlap 1–2 hours with EST (New York time)



Pay (Phase-Based)



We pay based on skill and accuracy:



$3–$4/hr (Phase 1): List building + skip tracing + data cleanup + lead tagging



$4–$5/hr (Phase 1+): Consistently clean work + can follow SOP with minimal errors



$5–$6/hr (Phase 2): After you prove performance, you may take on comps at higher volume and/or calling tasks



We do a paid trial first. Raises are based on performance.



About SVK



SVK Acquisitions Partners is a small wholesaling team in Massachusetts. We find off-market deals, analyze them quickly, and sell contracts to cash buyers. We work fast, follow process, and require clean, accurate work.



What You’ll Do (Phase 1 – Starts Immediately)

A) Lead List Building (BatchLeads)



Build targeted seller lists in BatchLeads (Worcester County + surrounding MA counties)



Use filter recipes we provide (absentee owners, high equity, vacant, older homes, etc.)



Export lists to Google Sheets



Clean lists: remove duplicates, standardize addresses, verify missing fields



Tag leads by list type + distress flags (we provide tag system)



Prepare “Ready-to-Call” lists for our daily calling blocks



B) Skip Tracing + Organization



Skip trace leads when provided access/credits



Format phone numbers and organize contacts for dialing



Keep our Google Sheet/CRM updated and clean



Comparable Research (“Comp Prep”) – After Training (Zillow + BatchLeads)



Once you’ve proven accuracy in Phase 1, you’ll be trained to do comp prep.



Pull 5–10 sold comps for properties we mark as “COMP”



Use Zillow and BatchLeads for comps



Follow our comp rules (distance, recent sales, similar property type/sqft/bed/bath)



Deliver a comp pack with:



comp address + link



sold price + sold date



beds/baths + sqft



short notes and your top 3 comps highlighted



Important: You are not d
 ARV. You are preparing comps so our team can d
 quickly.



Optional (Phase 2 – Only If You Perform Well)



After consistent performance, you may be trained for:



Cold calling (screening + appointment setting only)



Lead follow-up and hot transfers



Other tasks as we grow



Requirements



Excellent attention to detail (no sloppy sheets)



Strong English reading/writing



Comfortable with Google Sheets



Reliable internet + consistent availability



Able to follow SOPs exactly and communicate daily



Bonus (Preferred):



Experience with BatchLeads / PropStream / REI lead lists



Experience with comps (Zillow/Redfin/MLS)



Cold calling experience



How to Apply (Required Questions)



To be considered, answer these questions:



Have you used BatchLeads or similar tools? Which ones?



Have you built real estate lead lists before? What list types?



Are you comfortable doing sold comps using Zillow and learning BatchLeads comping? (Yes/No)



What days/times can you work in EST each week?



What hourly rate do you want to start at ($3–$4/hr) and why?



Confirm you can do a paid trial task (2–3 hours). (Yes/No)

title: Building a Full Swim School Team (Specialists Needed) — Divendash
description:
JOB TITLE:

Building a Full Swim School Team (Specialists Needed) — Divendash



About Divendash

Divendash is a private swim program in the Atlanta metro area (USA). We’re building a real team with clean systems so the business can scale fast.



What we’re hiring

We are hiring specialists. If you have multiple skills, that’s fine — but you must have one primary lane you’re elite at.



Open Specialist Roles



1) Customer Service + Booking Specialist (Texts/Calls)

- Handle inbound messages, answer questions, book clients, confirm, follow up

- Keep everything organized in Sheets + booking system



2) Business Operations Specialist (SOPs + Systems)

- Turn messy notes into clean SOPs/checklists

- Track cancellations/reschedules, enforce rules, keep operations tight



3) Sales Support Specialist

- Build scripts, improve qualification questions, tighten conversion flow

- Help simplify offers + what we say on calls/texts



4) Recruiter / Hiring Assistant

- Screen applicants, shortlist, schedule interviews, organize the hiring pipeline



5) Marketing Support Specialist (Execution + Tracking)

- Local outreach coordination, lead tracking, posting support, simple weekly plan

- Organize content ideas into an execution schedule



6) Social Media Manager (DMs + Posting + Community)

- Manage DMs, follow-ups, post coordination, basic engagement

- Keep leads organized and moving toward booking



7) Video Editor — Short-Form (Reels/TikTok/Shorts)

- Fast edits from lesson clips/testimonials

- Batch delivery weekly, organized file naming



8) Video Editor — Long-Form (YouTube / Story Videos)

- Longer edits, structure, basic storytelling

- Clean pacing + captions when needed



9) Sheets / Dashboard Builder

- Tracking sheets: leads, revenue, attendance, referrals

- Simple weekly KPI report



10) Executive Assistant / Admin

- Notes, task tracking, follow-ups, simple research, protecting my time



How to apply (do this exactly)

Start your application message with:

“I do not want to be your [ROLE] — I want to help with [YOUR SPECIALTY].”



Then answer A–F

A) Your primary role (ONE): (pick from the roles above)

B) Your hourly rate:

C) Timezone + availability:

D) Proof: links/portfolio/screenshots (or describe 2–3 real results you produced)

E) What you would do in your first 7 days for Divendash: (bullets)

F) Tools you’re strong with: (Sheets, CRMs, CapCut, Canva, etc.)



Interview + Trial Process

1) Apply with A–F.

2) If selected, I’ll send you a Calendly link to book a quick interview.

3) If you pass, you enter a trial with other applicants in the same role.

4) Best performer gets hired.

5) Two-week onboarding ? then expanded work if performance is strong.



Important

Look us up first. We’re moving fast and we want people who can keep up.

title: Brand-Focused Video Editor (Beauty / Wellness – Premium Aesthetic)
description:
About Nora Stockholm



Nora Stockholm is a Scandinavian premium beauty and longevity brand built around ritual, structure, and identity.



We are not a trend-based brand.

We are building a calm, minimal, high-trust presence rooted in Scandinavian design principles.



Natural light.

Soft pacing.

Restraint.

Authority without noise.



We are looking for a Video Editor who understands how to communicate a brand through video — not just edit clips.



The Role



You will be responsible for turning brand ideas into emotionally structured short-form videos for Instagram, TikTok, and other platforms.



This is not a fast-cut, viral-trend editing job.



This is about:



Emotional pacing



Visual consistency



Text overlays with purpose



Calm authority



Building identity over time



AI tools will be part of the workflow — but strong editing and brand sensitivity matter more than AI experience.



Responsibilities

1. Video Editing (Core)



Edit short-form videos (15–60 sec)



Work with natural lighting and minimal aesthetics



Create structured pacing (slow, intentional, refined)



Add subtle text overlays aligned with brand tone



Ensure visual consistency across content



2. Brand Communication Through Video



Translate brand values into visual storytelling



Support ritual-based storytelling formats



Maintain Scandinavian minimalism



Avoid over-editing and unnecessary effects



3. AI Integration (Trainable)



Learn AI image/video generation tools



Use AI visuals within defined brand guidelines



Help experiment with AI-based personas (if relevant)



We will support learning AI tools — but brand instinct is mandatory.



Requirements



Strong portfolio in beauty, wellness, or lifestyle editing



Excellent sense of pacing and minimal editing style



Ability to communicate emotion through subtle visual choices



Strong English comprehension



Experience with Premiere Pro, Final Cut, CapCut, or similar



Ability to follow a brandbook strictly



We Are NOT Looking For



Trend-based TikTok editors




 content creators



Heavy transition / effect-focused editors



Engagement-at-all-cost marketers



We are building long-term brand equity.



What Success Looks Like



Our feed feels cohesive and premium



Viewers recognize our identity instantly



Videos feel calm, structured, intentional



Growth comes from trust, not noise



To Apply



Please send:



Portfolio (beauty/wellness work preferred)



2–3 examples of videos that show emotional pacing



A short explanation of how you would edit a “morning ritual collagen” video for a Scandinavian brand



Your monthly salary expectation (full-time)

title: Business Credit & Operations Virtual Assistant
description:
I am seeking a highly organized, detail-oriented Virtual Assistant with experience in business setup, business credit building, and financial operations support. You will execute a structured, time-sensitive plan to establish, optimize, and monitor multiple business entities for credibility, vendor credit, and lender readiness.



This role requires precision, documentation, follow-through, and the ability to work with financial institutions, business directories, and credit bureaus. You must be comfortable following a playbook and tracking progress in a shared workspace.



Required Skills

	•	Business formation/compliance knowledge (LLCs, Registered Agent, SOS status)

	•	Experience setting up business phone systems and securing 411/directory listings

	•	Familiarity with business credit bureaus (Dun & Bradstreet, Experian Business, Equifax Business)

	•	Project/task management experience (ClickUp, Notion, Trello, or Asana)

	•	Comfort working with financial data and bank accounts (view-only access)

title: Shopify Website Designer & Developer (5+ Years Experience Required)
description:
Project Overview



We are looking for a highly experienced Shopify designer and developer to completely redesign and optimize an existing Shopify store for better branding, user experience, and higher conversion rates.



The website is already built. This is NOT a basic setup job.



We need a professional who can elevate the brand visually, improve conversion performance, optimize technical performance, and customize the store beyond template limitations.



This role is for someone who understands premium e-commerce execution, not basic theme editing.

Project Scope (Phase 1 – Redesign & Optimization)



Audit & Strategy

* Full UX/UI audit of the current Shopify store

* Identify conversion bottlenecks

* Competitive analysis (experience in jewelry or premium e-commerce preferred)

* Provide a clear improvement roadmap



Design & Branding

* Modern, high-converting homepage redesign

* Improved layout structure and visual hierarchy

* Premium product page redesign focused on trust-building

* Clean typography and spacing improvements

* Custom banners and section designs

* Strong brand consistency



Technical Optimization

* Website speed optimization (Core Web Vitals)

* Mobile-first optimization

* Fix bugs, broken links, and layout issues

* Improve navigation and overall shopping flow

* Improve checkout experience

* Implement SEO best practices and structured data



Custom Development

* Advanced Shopify Liquid customization

* Custom sections beyond theme defaults

* UX-enhancing micro-interactions

* App integration and optimization

* Code cleanup and performance tuning



Performance Goals

* Improve conversion rate

* Improve mobile usability

* Reduce bounce rate

* Improve page load speed

* Strengthen brand trust perception



Requirements (Strict)

* Minimum 5+ years professional Shopify experience (non-negotiable)

* Strong portfolio of premium Shopify stores

* Advanced Shopify Liquid, HTML, CSS, JavaScript

* Proven experience improving conversion rates

* Strong understanding of CRO principles

* Experience optimizing page speed

* Strong UI/UX design ability (not just coding)

* Ability to create custom layouts, not only theme editing

* Experience with SEO and structured data

* Ability to work independently with minimal supervision

* Strong communication skills



Applications without a strong Shopify portfolio will not be considered.



Bonus (Highly Preferred)

* Experience in jewelry or luxury e-commerce

* Graphic design skills (banners, promotional creatives)

* Experience with multi-channel integration (Shopify + Etsy + eBay + Amazon)

* A/B testing experience

* Analytics setup experience (GA4, Meta Pixel, etc.)



Work Monitoring & Expectations



* Clear milestone-based delivery

* Weekly progress reporting required

* All work will be reviewed and monitored

* Code must be clean, documented, and optimized

* No shortcut or low-quality bulk solutions

* High attention to detail is mandatory



We are looking for a long-term professional partner, not a short-term freelancer.

title: Social Media and Marketing VA
description:
About the Role

Worker Bees LLC is hiring a Social Media & Marketing Virtual Assistant for our client Upstaxx — an AI-powered tax savings platform that helps Americans find every credit, deduction, and strategy they’re missing.



Upstaxx is in beta and growing fast. They need a creative, data-driven marketing VA who can build their social media presence across ALL platforms and generate real leads.



This is NOT a “just post pretty graphics” role. We need someone who understands content strategy, audience growth, engagement, and lead generation. If you can turn social media followers into paying users, this role is for you.



What You’ll Be Doing

Social Media Management (All Platforms)

• Create, schedule, and post content across Instagram, TikTok,
,
/X, LinkedIn, YouTube, and Pinterest

• Develop a consistent brand voice and visual identity for Upstaxx across all channels

• Write compelling captions, hooks, and CTAs that drive engagement and sign-ups

• Create short-form video content (Reels, TikToks, Shorts) around tax tips, financial literacy, and Upstaxx features

• Monitor comments, DMs, and mentions — engage with the community daily

• Track analytics and report on growth, engagement, and conversion metrics weekly



Lead Generation & Growth

• Develop and execute strategies to drive sign-ups and free trial activations for Upstaxx

• Identify and engage target audiences: freelancers, gig workers, small business owners, W-2 employees

• Research and join relevant online communities 
 groups, Reddit, forums) to organically promote Upstaxx

• Collaborate on
 marketing content and landing page copy

• Test different content formats and CTAs to optimize conversion

• Track lead sources and report which channels are producing results



Content Creation

• Design graphics using Canva (or similar tools) that match Upstaxx branding

• Create educational content around tax savings, deductions, and financial tips

• Repurpose content across platforms (turn a blog post into 5 social posts, a Reel, and a carousel)

• Stay current on social media trends and adapt content strategy accordingly



Requirements

• 2+ years of social media management experience (agency or client-side)

• Proven track record of growing social media accounts (show us the numbers!)

• Experience with lead generation and conversion-focused content

• Strong written English — creative, engaging, and error-free

• Proficient with Canva, CapCut, or similar design/video editing tools

• Understanding of social media algorithms and best practices for each platform

• Experience with scheduling tools (Buffer, Later, Hootsuite, or similar)

• Self-starter who can work independently and take initiative

• Reliable internet connection + backup option

• Working laptop/PC with 8GB+ RAM



Bonus Skills (Not Required)

• Experience marketing SaaS or fintech products

•
/Instagram Ads experience

• SEO knowledge and blog writing

• Basic video editing for YouTube

• Familiarity with AI tools for content creation



What We Offer

• Competitive salary (based on experience)

• Flexible schedule within U.S. business hours

• Long-term, stable work with a growing brand

• Performance bonuses tied to growth milestones

• Creative freedom — your ideas matter here

• Supportive U.S. management team

• Paid time off after probation period





HOW TO APPLY — READ CAREFULLY

This is a PHASED application. We receive hundreds of applications. To find the best candidates quickly, we’ve designed a 2-phase process. Only candidates who complete Phase 1 correctly will be considered.



  PHASE 1 — APPLICATION (Complete by Monday, February 16 at 11:59 PM PHT)

Send an
 to: 

Subject Line: “BUZZING — Upstaxx Marketing VA — [Your Full Name]”



Your
 MUST include ALL of the following:

1. Your resume (PDF format)

2. Links to 2–3 social media accounts you have managed or grown (include follower counts and growth metrics)

3. A SpeedTest.net screenshot (minimum 25 Mbps download)

4. Your expected monthly salary range (in PHP)

5. Your OnlineJobs.ph profile link



PHASE 1 SCREENING TASK (Required):

In the SAME
, include the following:



SCREENING TASK:



Visit 
 and review the website thoroughly. Then answer these 3 questions:



1. In 2–3 sentences, describe what Upstaxx does and who their ideal customer is.

2. Write a sample Instagram caption (with hashtags) promoting Upstaxx to freelancers. Make it engaging, under 150 words.

3. Name 3 specific social media strategies you would use in the FIRST 30 DAYS to grow Upstaxx’s audience and generate leads. Be specific — not generic.



IMPORTANT: Applications missing ANY of the above will be automatically rejected. The subject line must start with “BUZZING” — this tells us you read the full post.



  PHASE 2 — VIDEO INTERVIEW (Tuesday, February 17)

Top candidates from Phase 1 will be invited to a 15–20 minute video interview via Google Meet on Tuesday, February 17.

What to expect:

• Discussion of your social media experience and portfolio

• Your approach to marketing Upstaxx specifically

• A quick creative exercise

• Q&A — your chance to ask us anything





About Worker Bees LLC

Worker Bees LLC helps U.S. entrepreneurs and businesses reclaim their time by providing high-quality virtual assistant support from the Philippines. We believe in fair pay, long-term partnerships, and empowering Filipino talent through meaningful career opportunities.

Bee More Productive.

title: Client Support Manager - GOOD PAY
description:
We’re a rapidly expanding lead generation agency looking to scale our client success team. We’re seeking motivated, quick-learning, and reliable Client Success Managers ready to earn up to $1,000/month while ensuring our clients receive excellent support and onboarding.



As a Client Success Manager, you’ll be responsible for inbound client support and short onboarding calls only — this is not a sales role. You’ll be available Monday through Saturday during U.S. business hours (9 AM – 6 PM across U.S. time zones) and play a key role in onboarding new clients and supporting active accounts.



Top performers will have the opportunity to advance into leadership roles as the company grows.



What You’ll Do



- Answer inbound phone calls from existing clients

- Conduct short onboarding phone calls once clients are signed up

- Serve as the primary point of contact for active client communications

- Ensure clients feel supported, informed, and confident



What We Offer



- Competitive Pay: Fixed base pay with performance bonuses

- Comprehensive Training: 1-on-1 coaching, proven scripts, and SOPs

- Warm Client Base: Clients are already signed up — no cold calling

- Growth Opportunities: Advancement for top performers



Requirements



- Fluent in English (VERBAL + WRITTEN)

- Experience speaking with U.S. based customers over the phone

- Comfortable handling onboarding and payment related conversations

- Reliable, proactive, and detail-oriented



Available full-time (8 hours/day) during U.S. business hours



Able to work Monday – Saturday



If you’re ready to join a fast-growing team and make a real impact in a non-sales, inbound-only role, apply now!



We’re hosting group interviews and hiring on a rolling basis.

title: Sales Caller – Book Meetings With Warm Leads (Remote, Part-Time)
description:
About Us

We're a growing marketing agency looking for confident, friendly phone callers to help us book meetings with interested prospects. These are warm leads only — people who have already shown interest in our service. No cold calling.

The Role

You'll receive notifications when a new lead comes in. Your job is to call them quickly, let them know about the interest we've found for their business, and book them into a meeting. We provide the script, the talking points, and even AI-generated notes for each lead so you know exactly what to say. You just make the call and book the meeting.

What You'll Be Doing



Receiving lead notifications via Slack on your phone

Calling warm leads within 5–10 minutes of the notification

Following a simple script to explain the opportunity

Booking meetings using a provided Calendly link

Recording each call for quality and accountability



Time Commitment: Less than 3–5 hours per week. This is not an hours-worked role — it's a speed-to-lead role. When a notification comes in, you call fast. Between notifications, you're free. You'll be set up on Slack with mobile notifications so you can respond quickly wherever you are.

Requirements



Clear Western accent is required (American, British, Australian, or similar) — you will be calling US and UK-based business owners and executives. You must sound natural and professional on the phone. If you do not have a clear Western accent, please do not apply.

Confident and friendly phone manner

Reliable phone and internet connection

Available and responsive during US business hours — speed is everything in this role. If you can't call within 5–10 minutes of a notification, this isn't for you.

Slack on your phone with notifications enabled

Quiet environment for calls



Compensation



$100/month base salary

$100 per confirmed, shown booking (not just scheduled — the prospect must actually show up)

On the low end, expect 10+ bookings per month

Realistic earnings: $1,100+/month for less than 5 hours of actual work per week



Why This Role



No cold calling — every lead has already shown interest

Scripts and talking points provided — we tell you exactly what to say

Minimal time commitment — it's about speed, not hours worked

High pay per hour of actual work — at 10 bookings and 5 hrs/week, that's $50+/hr effective rate

Long-term role — consistent lead flow with growing volume

Flexible remote work



To Apply

Send a voice note (30–60 seconds) introducing yourself in English, along with a short message about any phone or sales experience you have. Include the word "buckets" so we know you've read this post.

????

title: E-commerce Copywriter (Direct Response | Native Ads, VSLs, Landing Pages, Advertorials)
description:
About the Company

Allipse Marketing Management owns and operates multiple direct-to-consumer brands in the US market, specializing in health, beauty, and wellness. We sell products that solve real problems for real customers.

Now we're looking for a Copywriter to craft the words that sell — writing persuasive scripts, ads, and landing pages that connect with our audience and drive conversions.



About the Role

We're looking for a Copywriter who knows how to turn ideas into words that move people. You'll write the copy behind our
 ads, Native ads, VSL scripts, landing pages, and static creatives — crafting messages that grab attention, build desire, and drive action.

If you're equal parts storyteller and strategist, and you love figuring out what makes customers tick, this one's for you.



What You'll Own

Conduct deep market research — understanding customer avatars, core desires, pain points, and the exact language customers use

Write
 ad copy (primary text, headlines, hooks) that stops the scroll and drives clicks

Write VSL scripts that hold attention and convert viewers into buyers

Create punchy headlines for static image ads

Write landing page copy — from headlines to CTAs to full sales pages

Apply awareness stages and market sophistication principles to craft the right message for the right audience

Collaborate with video editors, designers, and media buyers to bring your copy to life

Review performance and tweak your copy to make every word work harder



Who You Are

Experienced copywriter with understanding of direct response principles

Familiar with concepts like awareness stages, market sophistication, and customer avatars

Strong command of English with a natural sense of tone and flow

Passionate about audience psychology and what drives people to act

Curious, analytical, and open to testing, learning, and iterating

Comfortable using AI tools to work smarter and faster



You'll Thrive Here If…

You're driven by results and love seeing your words make an impact

You geek out on customer psychology, research, and optimization

You value persuasion and performance over clever-sounding copy

You can write for US audiences across health, beauty, and wellness



Growth Path

Copywriter ? Senior Copywriter ? Lead Copywriter ? Creative Strategist



To Apply



Please send:



Your resume / CV



A portfolio of copywriting work 
 ads, Native ads hooks, VSL scripts, landing pages, or
 copy)



(If available) examples of ads or pages that actually performed, with brief context



A short note explaining your approach to direct-response copywriting (research, angles, hooks, and structure)

Male
