title: Affiliate Systems & Social Media Specialist (Full Time, Long Term)
description:
We are a family-run wellness brand. We don’t just want someone to "post content"—we want a systems-minded Specialist who loves the logic of affiliate marketing and the beauty of a well-curated social feed.



This is a role for someone who is naturally warm, kind, and loves people, but is also a "power user" when it comes to organization. We lead with love and treat our team like family, and in return, we look for absolute reliability and a desire to master your craft.



Why This Role is Different

Direct Impact: You aren't just a cog in a machine. You will own the affiliate systems and have the freedom to improve our processes.

AI Training: We will actively train you on the latest AI tools to ensure you stay at the forefront of the industry.

Stability & Heart: We offer a "forever home." No agency chaos—just a supportive, pleasant environment where your peace of mind matters.



Your Expertise

Affiliate Operations: You understand the "why" behind the links. You’ll manage onboarding, distribute assets, and ensure our partners feel valued and supported.

The Tech: You should be comfortable with ClickUp (not just for tasks, but for project tracking) and ManyChat (for building engaging automation flows).

Visual Curation: You have a sharp eye for aesthetics. You will manage our content calendar, ensuring Reels covers, carousels, and static posts are visually cohesive and on-brand.

Growth Mindset: You don't just follow a manual; you look for ways to make the system faster, smarter, and better.



Who You Are

A "People Person": You radiate warmth and enjoy professional, pleasant interactions with partners and tea
mbers.

System, Organize: You get excited by a clean ClickUp board and a perfectly organized content library.

Exclusive & Committed: You are looking for one full-time home (no side-gigs) where you can dedicate your best work.



Compensation & Premium Benefits

+ Competitive Salary (Paid in PHP): We pay for quality and reliability.

+ Annual Growth: Yearly raises based on performance and system improvements.

+ 13th Month Pay Guaranteed.

+ Paid Vacation, sick leave, and all National Holidays off.

+ Ongoing Education: We pay for your training in AI and advanced digital marketing tools.



How to Apply:

We only hire people who pay attention to the details. To apply,
 
 with:



Subject Line: [Your Name] | Affiliate & Systems Specialist

Paragraph 2: Briefly explain any ClickUp board or ManyChat flow you have personally built.

title: Google Merchant Center Cleanup, PMax & Shopping Campaign Setup for Supplement Brand
description:
We are a health supplement company selling two SKUs and need a Google Ads specialist to clean up our Google Merchant Center account, ensure full compliance, and set up campaigns for the US and Canadian markets. This is a one-time setup project, not ongoing management.



Google Merchant Center Cleanup & Compliance:

Audit the existing Merchant Center account and resolve all current errors and disapproved products. Remove duplicate product listings (we only have 2 SKUs — there should be no duplicates). Ensure both product listings are accurate with correct titles, descriptions, images, pricing, and availability. Verify product data feed is properly structured and compliant with Google's policies for health supplement advertising. Set up proper targeting for United States and Canada only. Ensure the account is fully compliant with Google's policies so we can advertise without issues or suspensions.



Campaign Setup:

Set up one Performance Max (PMax) campaign targeting US and CA with proper asset groups, audience signals, and product feed integration. Set up one standard Shopping campaign as a secondary campaign. Configure proper bidding strategy, budget allocation, and geo-targeting for both campaigns. Ensure campaigns are ready to launch and structured for a supplement product in the health/wellness category.



Requirements:

Proven experience with Google Merchant Center account management and troubleshooting. Experience setting up PMax and Shopping campaigns for eCommerce / DTC brands. Familiarity with Google's advertising policies for health supplements (understanding of what claims are and aren't allowed). Experience with Google tag implementation and conversion tracking setup. Ability to complete the full scope within 3–5 business days.

To Apply

Please include a brief summary of your experience with Google Merchant Center and PMax campaigns, specifically any work you've done with health or supplement brands. Mention any relevant examples of resolving Merchant Center compliance issues or disapproved products.



Project Type: One-time setup (no ongoing management)

Timeline: 3–5 business days

Target Markets: United States & Canada

title: WordPress Content VA + On-Page SEO (Stencil Site) + Pinterest
description:
I own 
, a free printable stencil website. I am hiring a long-term virtual assistant to publish new stencil content every week, improve SEO (especially thin-content issues), and help grow traffic and revenue. We provide a custom AI tool that can generate stencil images, so you will be using our tool as part of the workflow. The weekly output target is 3 new uploads per week, and each upload should contain 3 to 8 stencil images (a stencil set). The stencil sets must match current trends such as upcoming holidays, seasonal topics, and what people are searching for (Google search trends). You will publish each stencil set in WordPress by uploading the images, ensuring proper file naming and alt text, placing the content in the correct categories/tags, and adding internal links to relevant pages on the site.



Pinterest is also required: you will upload the images to our Pinterest account by creating Pins for each new stencil set (and sometimes individual stencils if appropriate), writing keyword-focused Pin titles and descriptions, linking back to the correct page on our website, and saving Pins to the right boards consistently.



A major focus for this role is improving thin pages. Many pages in this niche can become “thin” if they only contain an image and little text. You must learn how to improve page quality by adding helpful text, usage ideas, simple instructions, FAQs, better formatting, and stronger internal linking so each page provides real value beyond the download. We are looking for Google SEO knowledge and experience to help improve the site performance. Experience with WordPress posting, on-page SEO, image optimization/compression, and Pinterest posting is important. Familiarity with SEO plugins and Google Search Console is a plus.



Bonuses: Bonuses will be provided for improvements in website revenue.



To Apply: Please send your WordPress and SEO experience, any Pinterest work examples, and a short explanation of how you would improve a thin-content stencil page that is mostly images.

title: SEO Content Writer / Research VA
description:
I own 
, a content website focused on battery replacement equivalents and cross-reference information running on Joomla. I am hiring a virtual assistant who can research accurately, write clearly, and publish SEO-optimized content consistently. The weekly output target is 3 to 5 posts per week. Posts will include battery equivalent/replacement pages, comparisons (example: X vs Y), guides, and FAQ-style content. Accuracy matters because battery codes and equivalencies can be easy to confuse, so strong research habits and attention to detail are required. You will write and format content in a user-friendly way, including clean headings, summaries, tables when helpful, and FAQ sections when appropriate. You will also do on-page SEO on every post by choosing correct keywords based on search intent, writing strong titles and headings, creating meta titles/descriptions when needed, and adding internal links to relevant pages on the site. You will also refresh and improve older posts to boost rankings, clarity, and usefulness.



This role requires awareness that Google SEO changes and that some tactics stop working. Experience with SEO content writing, keyword research, and formatting tables/spreadsheets is strongly preferred. Joomla experience is a plus.



Bonuses: Bonuses will be provided for improvements in website revenue.



To Apply: Please send 2 writing samples (preferably informational/technical), describe your process for researching and confirming accuracy, and list any SEO tools you have used.

title: Exceptional Virtual Assistant
description:
Hello! 



Exchange Families International (EFI) is a student exchange company focused on real connection, language immersion, and meaningful host family matches. I’m hiring one exceptional Virtual Assistant to work closely with me long-term. This is for someone who takes pride in doing things properly—organized, reliable, and confident in written English.

If you’re looking for a role where you can grow, be trusted, and become a key part of a mission-driven team, keep reading.



What you’ll do

You’ll support me with a mix of writing, organization, and creative tasks. The workload will evolve, but typical responsibilities include:

- Writing + editing: drafting
s, polishing wording, proofreading, tightening tone, rewriting content so it sounds clear and human

- Admin + organization: managing task lists, tracking deadlines, organizing files, creating checklists, keeping projects moving

- Communication support: follow-ups, internal notes, organizing info so nothing gets missed

- Graphic design (light): clean Canva designs for simple social graphics, flyers, PDFs, and basic layouts

- Research + support tasks: gathering info, summarizing findings, scheduling, and miscellaneous CEO support



You’re a strong fit if you are…

- A master of written English (grammar, tone, clarity, strong sentence structure)

- Highly organized and able to manage multiple priorities without dropping details

- Proactive: you don’t wait to be told every step—you think ahead and suggest improvements

- Comfortable with Google Drive/Docs/Sheets and learning new systems

- Confident in Canva (or similar) and have a clean design eye

- Reliable, responsive, and consistent



Bonus (not required):

- Experience supporting a CEO/founder

- Basic video editing for short-form content (Reels/TikTok style)

- Experience in education, travel, or customer-facing roles



Work setup (read carefully)

- Full-time role (40 hours/week)

- Night shift (Philippines time) to align with my workday in British Columbia, Canada

- Long-term position for the right person

- Remote role working directly with me

- You’ll need reliable internet, a dependable computer, and consistent availability during scheduled hours



How to apply (important — read carefully)

We receive many copy/paste applications, so we use a quick filter to find applicants who are genuinely interested. If you miss any step below, your application won’t be reviewed!



Please send ONE message that includes

1. A short written intro (3–6 sentences) about you and why this role fits you.

2. A personal video (60–90 seconds) (Loom, unlisted YouTube, or Google Drive link). In your video:

    - Tell me why you want to work with Exchange Families International (make it personal so I get to know you!)

    - Use the word “adventure” naturally in a sentence

    - Describe your favorite sandwich and why it’s so good? (Yes, really — I’m checking communication skills, personality, and attention to detail.)

3. Your resume.

4. Answer these questions:

    - What tools do you use to stay organized?

    - What is your weekly availability (days + hours)?

    - What is your expected hourly rate?

    - What are your top 2 strengths as a VA?



Final note

This is not a background role where tasks get done halfway. I’m hiring a real teammate—someone who cares about quality, wants to be proud of their work, and enjoys being part of a company that helps families and students change their lives. Please apply only if you can commit to full-time night shift hours consistently!

If that sounds like you, send your application (and don’t forget the video!).

title: Social Media Growth VA for Collage/Scrapbooking Artist (Instagram + TikTok + Pinterest)
description:
I am hiring a virtual assistant to drive traffic and growth for my wife’s collage/scrapbooking art accounts on Instagram and TikTok, with Pinterest distribution included. Her art style is analog collage made from magazine clippings and paper layering, often filmed as process content. Your main goal is to increase profile visits, followers, and inquiries by running a consistent discovery and distribution system.



Your weekly responsibilities include doing 30–60 minutes per day of targeted engagement and leaving 10–20 meaningful comments per day on niche-relevant accounts (collage, junk journaling, scrapbooking, mixed media, paper craft, vintage ephemera). You will also send 20–40 outreach messages per week to feature pages and collaboration partners, tracking all outreach in a spreadsheet and following up professionally. For Pinterest, you will create 3–5 new pins per finished artwork, aiming for 15–30 pins per week, using strong keyword titles/descriptions and posting to well-organized boards.



You will also deliver a weekly report summarizing what drove profile visits, what hooks and formats worked best, and which posts should be remade or repurposed. You must understand that social algorithms and SEO change; we want someone who tests, learns, and adapts based on data, not outdated tactics. Bonuses will be provided for measurable improvements in traffic, follower growth, and revenue (commissions/print sales). To apply, send examples of accounts you have helped grow and describe how you would promote a collage artist specifically.

title: Senior Residential Appraisal Report Writer/Manager
description:
I run a residential appraisal firm located in the Bay Area, California, and am looking for an experienced residential appraisal writer to join the team. The team includes 3 Bay Area appraisers and 6 employees in the Philippines. We are rapidly growing and are looking for an experienced and senior level residential report writer/manager to join our team.



Your role will be to do the following:

1. Complete the entire residential appraisal report after the appraiser has provided you with the inspection information and comparables. This includes all the commentary, adjustments, and all other parts of the report. We will provide training on how we specifically expect the commentary and adjustments based on our own personal preferences, however you are expected to already have this type of experience working for other appraisers.

2. Review the work of other report writers on our team, provide feedback, and help train newer report writers on our team. You are expected to act as the "last line of defense" of the report before it is sent to the appraiser for their final review before submission. As such, we expect you to be able to review the report, find any issues, correct these issues, and then send to the appraiser a near perfect report.



To be considered for this role, you must meet the following criteria:

1. You have worked for a US residential appraiser

2. You have experience performing data entry for residential properties in the US

3. You have experience creating the 1004MC, selecting comparables, drawing the sketch, labeling photos, making adjustments to the sales grid, and making commentary for the addendum.

4. Ideally, you have experience managing other appraisal report writers.



We are flexible with your work hours and offer Philippine daytime shift hours for your convenience. We would like to start part time but then transition to full time, so ideally you are open to working full time exclusively with us if its a mutual fit.



To be considered for this position, you must do the following in your application message (failure to do all of the following will result in your application being ignored):

1. How many years have you worked for a US residential appraiser? What tasks did you perform for them?

2. How many hours does it take you to complete one report? What parts of the report do you complete?

3. Do you have experience writing commentary for the addendum, drawing the sketch, labeling photos, and creating the 1004MC? Please indicate which ones you have experience with, and how many years for each.

4. Please provide a sample of at least one appraisal report you have fully completed. You can redact any private information from the report. Please let me know what parts exactly you completed on this report(s).

5. Provide a publicly accessible link to your resume.

6. Are you open to starting part time and then transitioning to full time? Once working full time with us, will you be working exclusively with us without any other jobs? When is the earliest you can begin working with us?

7. What are your preferred working hours?

8. Do you have experience managing other residential appraisal report writers? If so, please discuss in detail your job responsibilities.



Thank you, and I look forward to the opportunity to work together.

- Tell me about a time you cleaned up messy books.

- What accounting mistakes do you commonly see small businesses make?

- Write the word “LEDGER” at the top of your application so I know you read everything.



I am looking for someone long-term who values accuracy, discretion, and clear reporting.



If you are detail-driven and enjoy organizing financial systems, I look forward to hearing from you.

title: Instagram Lead Generation + Outreach
description:
Instagram Lead Generation Role + Outreach



Requirements:



Fluent English, Fast Communication, Professional Worker.

Can generate a minimum 200 leads per day.

Can also outreach to the same 200 each day, outreach messages are copy and pasted from a selection of 6 different messages.



Very simple job, systematic.



However I want someone who understands the specific type of leads we are looking for and can also consistently meet the requirements, day in, day out.



Bonuses are given to consistent and reliable workers, I always treat my VA's with respect and generous bonuses.



This is also a starter job, I have many more roles that are a lot better opportunities, this is simply a way to test who I can trust and rely on.



Wage will also be increased later down the line.

title: Full-Stack Developer (Django REST + Nuxt 3)
description:
Thanks for taking a look at my Full-Stack Developer opportunity. This is a full time position - 40 hours weekly.



This contract is expected to last 1-2 months, with potential to work longer if things work out bewteen us. I am also willing to look at part-time applicants.



I run a standalone Pinterest keyword tool as well as a Pinterest Scheduler. I am looking for a developer to maintain the application and help me ship new features on an ongoing roadmap.



I am looking for a developer to assist me with the following key tasks and other smaller jobs:

    • Maintain and improve a Django REST API (bug fixes, refactors, performance tuning).

    • Maintain authentication flows (dj-rest-auth + django-allauth), including
 verification edge cases.

    • Maintain JWT access/refresh token flow used by the Nuxt frontend (Bearer tokens, refresh handling).

    • Maintain ThriveCart payment integration via webhooks (HMAC signature verification, plan mapping, subscription status).

    • Work with a shared PostgreSQL database, including read-only access to an existing keyword/interest table (query efficiency, pagination).

    • Improve logging/observability and troubleshoot production issues.

    • Deploy and maintain the app on 
 (environment variables, service configuration, domain/CORS settings).

    • Build and ship new product features as requested, starting with board analysis and competitor analysis.

    • Add future features such as: competitor/board analysis, saved searches, exports, filters, and general UX improvements.

    • Write lightweight documentation and short test checklists for features you ship.



Required skills:

• 3+ years of professional development experience (preferred).

• Strong Python, Django, and Django REST Framework experience (API design, permissions, serializers).

• Comfortable implementing
 verification using dj-rest-auth and django-allauth.

• Solid understanding of JWT access/refresh flows and client-side token management.

• Experience integrating and securing webhooks (HMAC verification; common failure modes).

• Strong PostgreSQL skills (pagination, query optimization; comfort working with unmanaged/read-only models).

• Strong Nuxt 3 / Vue 3 experience, including Pinia state management and API integration via Axios.

• Well organized and reliable (ability to manage ongoing maintenance plus new feature work).

• Good at written English.

• Attention to detail - when applying for this position, please start with 'Howdy Andy'.

• Quick response.

- The ability to communicate clearly and professionally through
.

- GitHub workflow: comfortable working via PRs with clear commit history.



Looking to hire and start immediately!



Please let me know what your salary expectations are and your availability (full-time or part-time).

Thanks,

Andy



PS. Only customized detailed responses will be considered. I want to know a bit of your background and how you will be a great addition - this way I know you are serious and have read the job description properly.

title: DM Appointment Setter
description:
We run a world-class online fitness coaching company helping busy Asian men lose stubborn belly fat, build lean muscle, and stay in shape without cutting out the cultural foods they love.



Our brand and client base is growing fast. As a result, we are rapidly expanding our team and looking for a high-performance DM setter who knows how to turn conversations into booked calls so we can help even more people!



If you thrive in a results-driven environment and want uncapped earning potential, keep reading.



Compensation:



- Full-time: 40–50 hours per week

- Pay: $650 USD per month

- Commission: 3-5% of cash collected from every client you book who enrolls

- Expected Earnings: $800–$1,200+ per month



**Top performers earn significantly more. This is a performance-based role. Your income scales with your output.



What You’ll Be Responsible For:



- Initiating conversations with new followers, story viewers, and engaged prospects

- Reaching out to warm and targeted outbound leads daily

- Using our scripts + frameworks while making conversations feel natural and human

- Asking intelligent qualifying questions

- Moving qualified prospects into booked sales calls

- Following up consistently with warm leads

- Tracking conversations and outcomes inside our CRM

- Maintaining our brand voice and communication standards

- You will be expected to generate volume while maintaining quality.



What We’re Looking For:



- Strong written English (clear, natural, professional — no grammar mistakes)

- Quick response speed and ability to handle multiple conversations at once

- 1–3+ years of experience as a DM setter (fitness industry preferred)

- Proven history of booking qualified calls that actually show up

- Reliable laptop + fast internet

- Comfortable sending 80–100+ high-quality messages per day

- Willing to work flexible hours, including weekends when needed

- Highly coachable and able to take feedback fast

- Competitive, disciplined, and motivated by performance

- We move quickly. You must be comfortable keeping up.



Why This Is a Big Opportunity:



- Work directly with a rapidly scaling online fitness coaching company with a passion for client results and excellence across the board

- Clear SOPs, scripts, and leadership support

- Real growth path for top performers (raises + leadership opportunities)

- Paid onboarding and training

- Remote position

- Be part of a team with high standards and long-term vision

- We value excellence, accountability, and growth.



How To Apply:



Send a short message replying to this job post explaining why you want to apply



**within 24-72 hours, all eligible applicants will be invited to an interview.



Looking forward to speaking with you!

title: Performance Marketer
description:
We’re hiring a full-time Media Buyer to own our paid advertising performance across platforms, with a primary focus on Meta 
 & Instagram Ads). This role is full-time and in-house (remote), so please only apply if you’re looking for a long-term permanent position. We're not hiring freelance or agency. 



This role is ideal for someone who is data-driven, detail-oriented, and excited to work closely with creatives to improve ad performance through clear insights and testing.



What You’ll Be Responsible For

- Launch, manage, and optimize ad campaigns primarily on Meta Ads. Support campaigns on Google, TikTok, or other platforms where relevant.

- Plan and execute structured tests (angles, creatives, offers, landing page) to improve cost per acquisition and ROAS.

- Manage budgets, audiences, and campaign structures based on performance

- Analyze ad performance to identify winning and underperforming ads

- Communicate clear performance insights to the creative team

- Participate in brainstorming sessions to improve creatives based on data

- Analyze Shopify sales data to identify scaling opportunities, conversion bottlenecks and product-level performance

- Monitor competitors’ ads, offers, and campaigns to identify gaps or opportunities in our market niche.

- Stay up-to-date with DTC industry trends and platform updates to ensure best practices.

- Providing administrative support, as and when needed to the manager.



Requirements

- Full-time, Monday–Friday (9am–5pm PH time)

- Remote position

- Strong comfort working with numbers and data

- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills; able to interpret data to make informed decisions

- Able to explain performance clearly to non-technical teammates

- Highly organized, self-directed, execution-focused, and able to work independently

- Willing to learn quickly and adapt as the business grows

- No prior media buying experience required, but you must be sharp, analytical, and able to learn fast.



Nice To Have (but not required):

- Experience running Meta Ads

- Experience with Shopify analytics

- Familiarity with Google Ads, TikTok Ads

- Experience in DTC or performance marketing



What We Offer

- Competitive salary

- Performance-based bonuses

- Paid annual leave & public holidays

- Fully remote work

- Training, upskilling, and career growth opportunities

- A team that values ownership, clarity, and results



Application

Please send your application via
 to 
 with the subject line: "Performance Marketer – (Your Name)”. Include your OnlineJobsPH profile link and answers to the questions below in numbered format directly in the
 body:

1) Tell us about your most recent job. What did you mainly work on, what were some challenges you faced, and why did you d
 to leave?

2) If you’ve worked in media buying/advertising, tell us about the campaigns you handled, tools you used, your process, and results. If you haven’t, what have you been learning on your own and how would you get competent quickly?

3) Share a time you took initiative or solved a problem in your workplace. It doesn’t have to be a formal leadership role, just something you’re proud of.

4) Please submit as much of your portfolio as possible. Submitting more work will help us make a more informed decision. Work can include anything within DTC e-commerce industry, but ideally aligned to the role you are applying for. If you don’t have DTC experience, submit your best work portfolio. Strong portfolios outside this role may be considered for other roles. 

5) Pick one project from the attached portfolio in question (4) that you are most proud of and answer the questions below. We want to see your ability to clearly explain what you did, your role, your reasoning, and the results of your work. You may optionally pick more than 1 project to highlight additional skills.

- What the project was

- Your specific contribution

- Why you approached it this way

- The results or impact (if any)



Keywords

 ads,
 ads specialist,
 ads manager,
 advertising, meta ads, meta ads specialist, meta ads manager, meta ads buyer, fb ads manager, media buyer,
 media buyer, paid ads buyer, performance marketer, performance ads, digital advertising, digital marketing, online advertising, social media advertising, ecommerce ads, google ads, DTC, DTC ads, pmax ads, pmax campaigns, performance max, youtube, tiktok, pinterest, ads specialist, ads buyer, ads manager, ads strategist, brand strategist, ads manager, growth marketer, CRO specialist, shopify

title: DTC Media Buyer
description:
We’re hiring a full-time Media Buyer to own our paid advertising performance across platforms, with a primary focus on Meta 
 & Instagram Ads). This role is full-time and in-house (remote), so please only apply if you’re looking for a long-term permanent position. We're not hiring freelance or agency. 



This role is ideal for someone who is data-driven, detail-oriented, and excited to work closely with creatives to improve ad performance through clear insights and testing.



What You’ll Be Responsible For

- Launch, manage, and optimize ad campaigns primarily on Meta Ads. Support campaigns on Google, TikTok, or other platforms where relevant.

- Plan and execute structured tests (angles, creatives, offers, landing page) to improve cost per acquisition and ROAS.

- Manage budgets, audiences, and campaign structures based on performance

- Analyze ad performance to identify winning and underperforming ads

- Communicate clear performance insights to the creative team

- Participate in brainstorming sessions to improve creatives based on data

- Analyze Shopify sales data to identify scaling opportunities, conversion bottlenecks and product-level performance

- Monitor competitors’ ads, offers, and campaigns to identify gaps or opportunities in our market niche.

- Stay up-to-date with DTC industry trends and platform updates to ensure best practices.

- Providing administrative support, as and when needed to the manager.



Requirements

- Full-time, Monday–Friday (9am–5pm PH time)

- Remote position

- Strong comfort working with numbers and data

- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills; able to interpret data to make informed decisions

- Able to explain performance clearly to non-technical teammates

- Highly organized, self-directed, execution-focused, and able to work independently

- Willing to learn quickly and adapt as the business grows

- No prior media buying experience required, but you must be sharp, analytical, and able to learn fast.



Nice To Have (but not required):

- Experience running Meta Ads

- Experience with Shopify analytics

- Familiarity with Google Ads, TikTok Ads

- Experience in DTC or performance marketing



What We Offer

- Competitive salary

- Performance-based bonuses

- Paid annual leave & public holidays

- Fully remote work

- Training, upskilling, and career growth opportunities

- A team that values ownership, clarity, and results



Application

Please send your application via
 to 
 with the subject line: "DTC Media Buyer – (Your Name)”. Include your OnlineJobsPH profile link and answers to the questions below in numbered format directly in the
 body:

1) Tell us about your most recent job. What did you mainly work on, what were some challenges you faced, and why did you d
 to leave?

2) If you’ve worked in media buying/advertising, tell us about the campaigns you handled, tools you used, your process, and results. If you haven’t, what have you been learning on your own and how would you get competent quickly?

3) Share a time you took initiative or solved a problem in your workplace. It doesn’t have to be a formal leadership role, just something you’re proud of.

4) Please submit as much of your portfolio as possible. Submitting more work will help us make a more informed decision. Work can include anything within DTC e-commerce industry, but ideally aligned to the role you are applying for. If you don’t have DTC experience, submit your best work portfolio. Strong portfolios outside this role may be considered for other roles. 

5) Pick one project from the attached portfolio in question (4) that you are most proud of and answer the questions below. We want to see your ability to clearly explain what you did, your role, your reasoning, and the results of your work. You may optionally pick more than 1 project to highlight additional skills.

- What the project was

- Your specific contribution

- Why you approached it this way

- The results or impact (if any)



Keywords

title: Operations/Logistics Manager
description:
We are looking for a detail-oriented Operations & Logistics Manager to oversee end-to-end operational execution across inventory, logistics, 3PL, and cross-platform order management.

This role is critical in ensuring operational accuracy, inventory health, and smooth coordination across internal teams and external partners.



* This person needs to work basis on New York Times (EST) so please be aware of this! 



[Key responsibilities]

Inventory & Operations Management

- Manage all inventory operations across warehouses, 3PLs, and sales channels

- Track and maintain accurate inventory levels, inventory value, and inventory projections

- Identify, analyze, and resolve inventory discrepancies and inaccurate order reports

- Monitor inventory flow to prevent stockouts or overstock situations



Logistics & 3PL Management

- Own day-to-day communication and performance management of 3PL partners

- Ensure accurate order fulfillment, shipping timelines, and issue resolution

- Conduct regular third-party system and data sync checks (3PL, Shopify, TikTok Shop, etc.)



Platform & System Management

- Manage and monitor inventory across Shopify & TikTok Shop, ensuring accurate syncing and reporting

- Troubleshoot order, inventory, and system integration issues across platforms



Order Processing & Customer Support

- Receive and process purchase orders (POs), ensuring accuracy and timely execution

- Handle customer service inquiries via
 and social media messages, including order issues, shipping questions, and general support

- Coordinate with 3PL and internal teams to resolve customer-related fulfillment issues efficiently



Invoice, Admin & Cross-Functional Support

- Prepare and send out invoices related to operations and logistics

- Provide personal assistance and operational administrative support as needed

- Assist with product management, including SKU setup, tracking, and operational readiness for launches

- Collaborate closely with finance, marketing, and supply chain teams to ensure operational alignment





Qualifications

- 8+ years of experience in operations, logistics, supply chain, or inventory management

- Hands-on experience with Shopify, 3PL systems, and inventory tools

- Experience managing multiple third-party vendors

- Highly detail-oriented with strong problem-solving skills

- Comfortable working in a fast-paced startup environment

- Strong Excel / Google Sheets skills (inventory tracking & projections)

title: E-Commerce Ad Creative Editor
description:
E-Commerce Ad Creative Editor

Salary: $450/month (With opportunity for raises as we scale!)

Hours: 25-30 hours per week (almost full-time. But could become full-time after a few months with increased pay)

Output: 25-30 ad videos per week (5-10 ads with multiple hooks)



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:



- Create 25-30 high-quality ad videos weekly for e-commerce brands

- Short-form video editing optimized for high retention (Meta Ads, TikTok, Instagram Reels, YouTube Shorts, etc.)

- Design static image ads using Photoshop and AI tools (Nano Banana, ChatGPT, etc.)

- Craft scroll-stopping hooks and creative concepts that drive conversions

- Incorporate basic animation and AI tools to enhance ad creatives

Ensure all captions are error-free and polished



REQUIREMENTS:



- Proven experience editing ad creatives for e-commerce or direct-response campaigns

- Fluent English with exceptional attention to detail (zero tolerance for typos in captions)

- Understanding of marketing fundamentals and conversion-driven creative strategies

- Fast, reliable internet connection for efficient video uploads and collaboration

- Self-motivated with ability to consistently meet weekly deadlines



If you're a creative powerhouse passionate about producing high-converting e-commerce ads, apply now! We have a fun vibe and culture, but also get shit done.

title: Experienced Video Editor with Expert AI Generation Skills
description:
Experienced Video Editor with Expert AI Generation Skills



We are looking for a highly experienced Video Editor who can bring creative visions to life and has expert knowledge of AI-generated content. This role is for someone confident using realistic-style AI tools to generate visuals, integrate them seamlessly into videos, and produce polished, high-quality content.



This will start as a small project. If we work well together, the role can grow into part-time and eventually full-time.



What You’ll Do



• Edit short-form and experimental videos for social media

• Combine live footage, stock footage, voiceovers, and AI-generated visuals into compelling stories

• Generate realistic-style AI visuals to enhance content

• Write and execute AI prompts for video, image, or voice generation

• Add clean, professional subtitles and light motion graphics

• Follow brand style and collaborate with the creative team

• Organize assets and revisions efficiently



AI Expertise (Required)



• Hands-on experience generating AI visuals for video content



Requirements



• Proven experience as a professional video editor

• Expert in Premiere Pro, Final Cut, CapCut, or similar editing software

• Strong understanding of pacing, hooks, and storytelling

• Strong English comprehension and communication

• Reliable, organized, and deadline-driven



Bonus Skills



• Motion graphics or sound design

• Marketing or social media content experience

• Storytelling or ad-creative experience



Work Setup



• Start project-based (trial project)

• Opportunity to move to part-time, then full-time as workload grows

• Remote / Work from home

• Flexible hours



How to Apply



In your application, include:

Your resume/CV

Your portfolio link

2–5 video samples that specifically show your editing AND AI-generated visuals



Applications without resume and sample work will not be reviewed.



We are looking for someone experienced, proactive, and creative who can collaborate with our team as the role grows.

title: Junior Automations Specialist (N8n/Click Up/GHL)
description:
Sojourney is a STR (short-term rental) company looking for a fast-learning, long-term tea
mber to grow into our go-to Automations Specialist. This is not an internship—but it is an entry/junior role where we’ll provide significant training upfront for the right person.



If you love systems, learn quickly, and want to build a career in automations + AI inside a growing company, this role is for you.



What you’ll become responsible for (with training)



Building and improving automations using n8n, Click Up and GoHighLevel (GHL)



Supporting multiple departments with automations (operations, support, sales/marketing, onboarding, etc.)



Troubleshooting, debugging, and fixing automation errors independently (broken steps, API/webhook issues, data problems)



Creating workflows/templates for our clients and students (implementation + support)



Managing automation projects and documentation in ClickUp (tasks, updates, SOPs, handoffs)



Continuously learning new automation platforms and AI tools (different LLMs, agents, integrations) and helping our team apply them



This role is a fit if you are…



Looking to commit multiple years with one company and grow into a key role



A fast learner who takes initiative and adapts quickly



Comfortable taking feedback and improving fast (coachable)



Able to work quickly without sacrificing quality



Someone who enjoys problem-solving and can debug issues without needing constant help



Minimum requirements



Basic/intro understanding of automations (you’ve used or explored tools like n8n, Zapier, Make, GHL, or similar—even if not advanced yet)



Familiarity with APIs, webhooks, CRMs, Google Sheets, Slack, etc.



Can build basic workflows using n8n, Click Up and Go High Level



Strong troubleshooting mindset (you test, isolate problems, and verify fixes)



Clear communication and willingness to document your work



Interest or experience in STR / hospitality / property management (context matters)





What success looks like



Month 1: Understand our systems, start building simple workflows, and assist with troubleshooting



Month 2–3: Own automations end-to-end with minimal supervision, document consistently, improve reliability



Ongoing: Become the person responsible for automation quality across the company and help us stay current with new tools/LLMs



To apply



Please use 4 AP points when applying and include:



Weekly availability



Your automation exposure (what tools you’ve used and what you built—even small projects count)



A short note on your interest/experience in STR/hospitality/property management



One example of how you troubleshoot when something breaks (steps you take)



Please note: a test task workflow will be needed in order to be considered for the role if we contact you

title: Graphic Design Virtual Assistant (POD / Long-Term Role)
description:
JOB OVERVIEW

We are building a premium POD brand, AXIOMSTEEL, and are looking for a reliable, detail-oriented Graphic Design Virtual Assistant to help us scale production.

This is a long-term role for someone who wants stable work and consistent hours.

You will be helping produce structured, repeatable product designs.

We are building a serious brand — not a hobby.





RESPONSIBILITIES

You will:

• Create design variations from existing templates

• Replace names, dates, and personalized text

• Maintain correct spacing and alignment

• Follow brand font and hierarchy rules

• Organize design folders properly

• Mockup image preparation

• Follow clear SOPs and naming conventions

This role is production-focused and detail-oriented.



REQUIRED SKILLS

You MUST:

• Be highly skilled in Adobe Illustrator

• Understand vector design and SVG file export

• Have strong typography skills

• Be very detail-oriented

• Follow instructions precisely

• Work independently once trained

• Have stable internet

• Communicate clearly in English



Bonus if you have experience with:

• Print-on-demand

• Etsy product image preparation

 



IMPORTANT

This job requires consistency and precision.

If you are creative but do not like structured systems, this role is not for you.

If you enjoy organized workflows and improving speed/efficiency, this role is perfect.





APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS

To apply, please:

1. Include the word STEEL at the top of your application.

2. Send 3 examples of vector-based design work.

3. Tell me how long it takes you (realistically) to create 3 simple design variations from a template.

4. Confirm your internet speed.

Applications that do not follow instructions will not be reviewed.





LONG-TERM OPPORTUNITY

We are scaling toward ongoing production work. The right candidate will grow with us.

title: Virtual HubSpot Marketing & Sales Creator
description:

This role owns campaign execution, automation, CRM hygiene, and performance reporting to support lead generation, nurturing, and revenue growth.



This is a doer role—not strategy only. The assistant will actively build, publish, automate, track, and optimize HubSpot assets that directly impact marketing ROI and sales pipeline performance.



Core Platforms Managed

HubSpot Marketing Hub Professional

HubSpot Content Hub Professional

HubSpot Sales Hub Professional



Key Responsibilities



1. Marketing Hub Professional (Campaigns & Automation)

Build and manage marketing campaigns inside HubSpot

Connect and manage social media accounts (posting, scheduling, campaign tagging)

Create and maintain automated workflows for:

 -Lead follow-ups

 -Lead nurturing sequences

 -Re-engagement campaigns

Configure and monitor lead scoring models

Track and report on marketing ROI, attribution, and conversion metrics

Ensure proper UTM tracking and campaign organization

Create and update:

 
 templates

s

- Forms and landing pages

Use HubSpot AI tools to assist with copy, subject lines, and content optimization

Ensure brand consistency across all templates and assets

Organize content libraries and naming conventions for scalability

Maintain compliance with CAN-SPAM, unsubscribe rules, and
 best practices



3. Sales Hub Professional (CRM & Sales Operations)

 -Contact, company, deal, and pipeline cleanliness

Organize and optimize:

 -Sales pipelines

Build and maintain sales dashboards showing:

 -Pipeline health

 -Close rates

Support sales reps with sequences, templates, and workflow automation



4. Reporting & Performance Tracking

 -Marketing performance

Deliver weekly and monthly performance summaries

Identify bottlenecks in lead flow and sales pipeline

5. Process & Systems Ownership

Own HubSpot day-to-day operations

Document workflows and automation logic

Maintain SOPs for campaigns, pipelines, and reporting

Ensure smooth handoffs between marketing and sales teams

Coordinate with leadership on priorities and execution timelines



Required Skills & Experience



Technical Requirements

 -Proven hands-on experience with HubSpot (Marketing, Content, and/or Sales Hubs)



Experience building:

 -Workflows and automations

 
 campaigns and templates

 -Dashboards and reports

 -Strong understanding of CRM lifecycle stages and pipeline management

 -Familiarity with social media scheduling inside HubSpot



Professional Skills



-Highly organized and detail-oriented

-Strong written English (for
s, forms, and content)

-Ability to follow brand guidelines and SOPs

-Self-starter who can manage tasks independently

-Comfortable working with KPIs, metrics, and deadlines

title: Figma Web / Graphic Designer
description:
Hi there!



Matthews Design is seeking a Figma web and graphic designer for an upcoming project and ideally, a long-term relationship.



We’re a web design and development company based in Louisville, Kentucky, serving local service businesses and e-commerce clients.



We design in Figma and are looking for someone with deep Figma experience and several strong work examples. Canva familiarity is a bonus.



You should be able to start immediately, with an estimated 10 to 20 hours per month, with potential for growth.



We communicate with our team via Slack, so experience working in Slack is important. 



After reviewing applications and portfolios, we will invite top candidates to a short Zoom interview, so conversational English is a must.



If interested, please send 2–3 of your best Figma web designs, a brief introduction about you, and your portfolio link, if you have one.



We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Director of E-Commerce

[Role Overview]

This is a hands-on leadership role requiring deep Shopify expertise, strong analytical capability, and prior beauty brand experience. You will own digital revenue performance across Shopify and marketplaces, with full responsibility for site optimization, reporting, and growth execution.

/SMS revenue contribution

[Qualifications]

title: Supply Chain & Inventory Planning Manager
description:
[Summary]

- Location: Remote

- Employment Type: Full-Time (40 hours/week)

- Work Schedule: 4 hours (8am-12pm) with EST, 4 hours aligned with Philippines Time

- Hourly pay : $8~10 



[Role Overview] 

- We are seeking a highly analytical Supply Chain & Inventory Planning Manager to lead inventory strategy, demand forecasting, working capital management, and 3PL coordination across multiple warehouse locations and sales channels. This role requires both operational execution and structured strategic planning. You will be responsible for organizing existing processes, improving forecast accuracy, preventing stockouts and overstock, reducing aging inventory, and protecting cash flow. This is a critical role within a scaling beauty brand operating across DTC, wholesale, and marketplace channels.



[Key responsibilities] 



1. Inventory & Replenishment Planning

- Oversee inventory across multiple warehouse locations

- Establish safety stock levels and reorder points

- Prevent stockouts and overstock situations

- Monitor lot tracking and expiration risk

- Build structured replenishment models



2. Demand Forecasting & Sales Alignment

- Develop SKU-level demand forecasts

- Integrate promotional calendar into forecast planning

- Forecast seasonal spikes and campaign-driven volume

- Lead monthly Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP) process

- Continuously improve forecast accuracy



3. Inventory Valuation & Working Capital Management

- Conduct inventory valuation reporting

- Monitor inventory turnover and days on hand

- Manage inventory impact on cash flow

- Align production timing with working capital strategy

- Reduce excess inventory exposure



4. Inventory Aging & Liquidation Strategy

- Build structured 6M / 9M / 12M aging reports

- Identify slow-moving SKUs early

- Develop liquidation plans (bundles, promotional allocation, wholesale offload)

- Minimize write-offs due to expiration



5. Financial & Cost Analysis

- Calculate landed cost per SKU (production, freight, duty, 3PL)

- Analyze margin impact from promotions and shipping subsidies

- Monitor fulfillment cost efficiency

- Support channel-level profitability analysis



6. 3PL & Fulfillment Management

- Primary point of contact for 3PL partners

- Monitor pick & pack accuracy and SLA performance

- Optimize shipping cost strategy

- Improve fulfillment efficiency



7. Purchase Order & Production Coordination

- Execute and track Purchase Orders

- Coordinate with manufacturers on lead times

- Manage MOQ planning and production scheduling

- Identify and mitigate supply chain risks



8. Process & System Development

- Build structured inventory dashboards

- Develop SOPs for replenishment and reporting

- Identify operational inefficiencies

- Recommend automation or system improvements



Qualifications

- 5+ years in supply chain, inventory planning, or operations

- Experience in beauty, skincare, or consumer goods preferred

- Strong multi-channel inventory management experience

- Advanced Excel / Google Sheets modeling skills

- Experience working with 3PL partners

- Strong analytical and financial planning capability

- Ability to work independently in a remote, cross-timezone environment



[Application Requirements]



Please submit:

- Resume

- Example of forecasting model created

- Brief explanation of how you improved inventory efficiency

- Confirmation of availability across EST and Philippines time zones

title: Local SEO & GoHighLevel Website Optimization Specialist (Home Services)
description:
We are a Santa Clarita based exterior cleaning company currently ranked #1 for window cleaning locally. We are expanding into solar panel cleaning and pressure washing and need a skilled SEO specialist to restructure and optimize our GoHighLevel website for stronger local rankings and service expansion.



This is not blog writing.

This is structured service page architecture and local SEO optimization.



Responsibilities



You will:



Restructure service pages inside GoHighLevel for:



Proper H1 / H2 hierarchy



Location + service optimization



Strong conversion layout



Clear CTA placement



Rewrite and improve pages such as:



Solar Panel Cleaning Santa Clarita



Pressure Washing Santa Clarita



Future geo pages (Valencia, Stevenson Ranch, etc.)



Add and structure:



High-intent FAQ sections



Process breakdown sections



Service area content blocks



Trust and authority signals



Implement schema markup inside GHL using:



Custom code blocks



Header/footer script injection



JSON-LD structured data



Build geo-targeted landing pages properly (not copy-paste duplicates).



Optimize internal linking between service pages.



Required Skills



• Experience with GoHighLevel website builder

• Strong understanding of local SEO

• Ability to implement schema manually

• Strong English writing

• Experience ranking city-specific service pages



Preferred



• Experience with home service businesses

• Familiarity with Google Search Console

• Familiarity with GBP optimization

• Understanding of AI / structured content best practices



What We Are NOT Looking For



• Generic content writers

• Keyword stuffing

• Someone who only runs AI and pastes output

• Someone unfamiliar with GHL



Deliverables (First 60 to 90 Days)



• Solar panel page fully restructured

• FAQ schema implemented

• LocalBusiness schema implemented sitewide

• 3 new geo pages built properly

• Clear on-page improvements measurable in GSC



To Apply



Answer the following:



Have you worked inside GoHighLevel websites before?



How would you implement schema inside GHL?



What elements must a local solar panel cleaning page include to rank?



Show an example of a local service page you optimized.

title: Strategic FP&A Manager (Part-Time)
description:
[Summary] 

- Employment Type: Part-Time

- Hours: approx. 15–25 hrs/week

- Compensation: $15/ hour

- Available to do weekly/bi-weekly zoom call with Founder in EST (New York time zone)



[Role Overview]

- We are seeking a highly analytical Strategic FP&A Manager to lead financial planning, profitability analysis, and scenario modeling for a growing beauty brand operating across DTC, wholesale, and marketplace channels. This is not a bookkeeping role. You will be responsible for building structured financial visibility and translating data into strategic decision-making that protects margin, improves cash flow, and supports scalable growth.



[Key Responsibilities]



1. Financial Forecasting & Planning

- Build and maintain 12-month rolling financial forecasts

- Develop revenue and expense projections

- Model growth scenarios and sensitivity analysis

- Support annual budgeting process



2. SKU-Level Margin & Profitability Analysis

- Conduct detailed gross margin and contribution margin analysis

- Evaluate DTC vs Wholesale vs Marketplace profitability

- Identify margin leakage from promotions and shipping subsidies

- Provide pricing and promotion recommendations



3. Promotional & Scenario Modeling

- Build financial models to evaluate discount strategies

- Analyze bundle economics and campaign profitability

- Assess CAC impact on contribution margin

- Provide pre-launch financial feasibility analysis



4. Cash Flow & Working Capital Planning

- Build cash flow projections

- Align financial forecasts with inventory and production planning

- Monitor working capital exposure

- Improve cash predictability



5. Executive Reporting & Strategic Insights

- Develop structured monthly financial dashboard

- Provide clear executive-level summaries

- Identify financial risks early

- Present actionable recommendations to leadership



Qualifications

- 7+ years experience in FP&A, strategic finance, or financial modeling

- Experience in consumer goods, beauty, or DTC & Wholesale preferred

- Advanced Excel / Google Sheets modeling skills (required)

- Strong understanding of contribution margin and unit economics

- Ability to build scenario models from scratch

- Experience supporting founder-led or growth-stage companies preferred



Application Requirements



Please submit:

- Resume

- Example of a financial model you built (template acceptable)

- Brief explanation of how you improved profitability in a prior role

- Shortlisted candidates may be asked to complete a modeling exercise.

title: Content VA / Video Content Mining Specialist — Wrestling & Combat Sports Media (Full-Time)
description:
Do you have an eye for what makes people stop scrolling?



We run two media brands in the combat sports space. We have over 10 years of video content — thousands of hours of training footage, match clips, coaching sessions, and behind-the-scenes 
nts — sitting in a vault waiting to be turned into viral Shorts, Reels, and TikToks.



We need someone obsessive about content to come in and systematically mine that library, find the gold, organize everything, and keep our social media engines running across multiple platforms and multiple brands every single day.



This isn't a "post once a day and call it done" gig. You'll be the backbone of our entire content operation — the person who makes sure our video editor always has clips to cut, our content calendar is always full, and our audience is always being fed.



The Two Brands You'll Be Working Across:



Brand 1 — Championship-level amateur wrestling instruction with 10+ years of training footage. Think intense, high-energy, coach-to-athlete content.



Brand 2 — Combat sports education and analysis. Deep library of instructional and analytical content.



What You'll Be Doing:



Content Mining & Organization (This Is the Big One — ~40% of Your Time)

- Systematically watch through our entire video libraries for both brands

- Log every video in a master spreadsheet: title, duration, topic, key 
nts with timestamps, "gold rating" (1–5), and suggested clip ideas

- Identify the 
nts that would make great Shorts — high energy technique demos, dramatic reactions, clean takedowns, quotable coaching 
nts, training montages, rivalry clips

- Tag and categorize content: technique tutorials, match footage, training sessions, coaching/motivational, behind-the-scenes, product-specific

- Organize raw files into a clean, labeled folder structure so our editor can find and grab what they need instantly

- Maintain and update the content log as new footage comes in



Content Scheduling & Posting (~30% of Your Time)

- Manage content calendars across both brands and all platforms (YouTube Shorts, Instagram Reels, TikTok,
)

- Upload, write captions, add hashtags, and publish all finished content on schedule

- Write captions from templates and brand voice guides we provide (you'll get trained on each brand's tone)

- Schedule content in advance using tools like Metricool, Later, or native platform schedulers

- Ensure we never miss a posting day — consistency is everything



Community Engagement & Performance Tracking (~20% of Your Time)

- Monitor and reply to comments across all platforms (we'll give you response guidelines)

- Flag DMs and comments that need the founders' attention

- Track basic performance metrics weekly: views, engagement rate, follower growth, saves, shares

- Maintain a simple weekly report — what posted, what performed, what flopped, and why you think so

- Identify trending content in our niches and flag opportunities to jump on trends



Research & Support (~10% of Your Time)

- Research trending audio, formats, hashtags, and content styles in the wrestling and combat sports niche

- Scout competitor accounts and flag content ideas worth adapting or responding to

- Maintain asset libraries: thumbnails, brand templates, music/audio files, b-roll folders

- Assist with miscellaneous tasks as needed — we're a small team and flexibility matters



You MUST Have:



- Strong English skills (written — we communicate via chat, Loom, and shared docs)

- Experience managing social media accounts and posting content consistently (show us the accounts you've managed)

- Familiarity with at least one scheduling tool (Later, Buffer, Metricool, Hootsuite, or native platform schedulers)

- Attention to detail — you'll be logging hundreds of videos and we need accuracy, not sloppiness

- Ability to work independently with minimal supervision after training

- A genuine eye for engaging content — you can tell the difference between a clip that will get 500 views and one that will get 50,000

- Reliable internet and a quiet workspace with headphones (you'll be watching hours of video daily)

- Willingness to overlap with US Central Time (CST) for at least 3–4 hours daily

- Proficiency with Google Drive, Google Sheets, and basic file management



Bonus Points (Not Required But We'll Love You For It):



- Interest in wrestling, combat sports, or martial arts (understanding the content makes you faster)

- Experience with short-form video platforms as a creator or avid consumer (if your own TikTok For You page is full of combat sports content, tell us)

- Basic photo/video editing skills (even just CapCut-level trimming and captioning)

- Experience with Canva for creating thumbnails or simple graphics

- Familiarity with YouTube analytics, Instagram Insights, or TikTok analytics dashboards

- Experience working with content creators or media brands (not just corporate social accounts)



What It's Like Working With Us:



- Small team, fast-moving, zero bureaucracy

- You'll work directly with the founders — not middle managers

- We communicate async (Loom, Slack/chat) with a weekly sync call

- We'll train you on exactly what "gold" content looks like — you don't need to figure it out alone

- Clear expectations, direct feedback, and real growth opportunity

- If you're great at this, there's room to grow into a content manager role as we scale



To Apply — READ THIS CAREFULLY:



We get a lot of applications. To make sure you actually read this post, do the following:



1. Start your application with the word **"TAKEDOWN"** so we know you read the full posting.



2. Watch this video: 
 



3. In your application, timestamp 3 specific 
nts from that video that you think would make great Shorts or Reels. For each 
nt, write 1-2 sentences explaining WHY you picked it — what makes it engaging, scroll-stopping, or shareable.



4. Send links to 2-3 social media accounts you've managed or contributed to. If you don't have professional examples, send your own personal accounts and tell us what content strategy you follow.



5. Tell us your available hours, timezone, and current workload (are you working other jobs?).



**Do NOT send a generic application.** If your application doesn't start with "TAKEDOWN" and include timestamps, we won't read it.

title: Remote Junk Removal Sales Representative
description:
PrimeHaul Junk Removal – Phoenix, AZ



Company Overview



PrimeHaul Junk Removal is a professional, modern junk removal company serving Phoenix, Arizona and the surrounding area. We specialize in high-quality single-item and multi-item junk removal, including furniture, appliances, TVs, shelving, and similar household items.



Our business is built around speed, transparency, and customer satisfaction. We operate a fully remote sales and dispatch model, partnering with independent subcontractors and established junk removal companies to deliver reliable service at scale. This is a long-term operation with plans to expand into additional cities.



?



Job Summary



We are hiring our first full-time Remote Sales Representative / Dispatcher to manage inbound leads, book junk removal jobs, dispatch subcontractors, and oversee jobs from start to finish.



This role combines sales, customer service, and operations. You will be responsible for converting inbound leads into booked jobs, managing fulfillment through Zenbooker, and handling customer issues with professionalism and accountability.



This position is ideal for someone with prior experience in remote sales or dispatching for a blue-collar or home-service business who wants a stable, long-term role with growth opportunity.



?



Key Responsibilities



Sales & Booking

 • Answer inbound phone calls via OpenPhone

 • Respond quickly to inbound leads from booking platforms and online inquiries

 • Book and close junk removal jobs using Zenbooker

 • Clearly explain flat-rate pricing and volume discounts

 • Focus on fast response times, quality bookings, and closing jobs

 • Apply discounts, waive fees, or issue credits when appropriate to close deals or resolve issues



Dispatch & Job Management

 • Manage all jobs inside Zenbooker

 • Dispatch subcontractors using Zenbooker’s auto-assignment and prioritization system

 • Ensure subcontractors receive accurate job details and accept assignments

 • Monitor job progress from booking through completion

 • Communicate with contractors and customers as needed on job day



Customer Service & Issue Resolution

 • Handle cancellations, reschedules, refunds, complaints, and price changes

 • Manage customer concerns professionally and empathetically

 • Follow SOPs to resolve most issues independently

 • Take ownership when mistakes happen and make it right for the customer

 • Escalate only extreme or unsolvable situations



Admin & Systems

 • Maintain accurate records in Google Sheets, Docs, and Drive

 • Follow SOPs, scripts, and workflows consistently

 • Track activity, bookings, and performance metrics

 • Work within Zenbooker as the primary operating system



?



How Our Process Works

 • Customers either book and pay online or call in to book

 • Payment is authorized at booking but not charged until the job is completed

 • Jobs appear in Zenbooker and are offered to subcontractors by location

 • Contractors accept, complete the job, and mark it complete

 • Admin charges the card and an automatic review request
 is sent



You will manage this process end-to-end.



?



Qualifications

 • Prior experience in remote sales, dispatching, or customer service for a home-service or blue-collar business (junk removal, cleaning, moving, etc.)

 • Strong phone communication and sales ability

 • Fast learner who follows SOPs closely

 • Organized, reliable, and detail-oriented

 • Comfortable handling customer issues independently

 • Experience with Zenbooker, Jobber, BookingKoala, Workiz, or similar platforms preferred

 • Comfortable using Google Docs, Sheets, and Drive

 • Able to work consistently during Arizona business hours



?



Training & Ramp-Up

 • Structured onboarding with shadowing

 • Recorded SOPs and walkthroughs

 • Live training and support

 • Expected ramp-up time: 1 week



?



Growth Opportunity



This is a long-term role with significant upside.



As we expand into additional cities:

 • You will help train new hires

 • You can move into a lead dispatcher or operations role

 • Compensation and responsibility will increase with performance



If you help us book more jobs and run operations smoothly, you will be rewarded.



?



How to Apply



Please include:

 • Start it with "JUNK!" To Show You Read This All

 • A short introduction

 • Your experience in remote sales or dispatching

 • Any experience with junk removal or home-service businesses

 • Your Resume

title: Intake Coordinator
description:
The Client Intake Specialist is the critical "first impression" for prospective clients and plays a vital role in the firm's growth by managing and tracking all potential new clients (PNCs). This role is responsible for ensuring a seamless, compassionate, and efficient process from the initial contact through client retention and scheduling the first consultation. This position requires exceptional organizational skills, attention to detail, and a high level of empathy and professionalism.



Key Responsibilities



Lead Management & Tracking:



Serve as the primary point of contact for all incoming leads (phone,
, web forms, walk-ins).

Rigorously track every lead in the firm’s CRM/case management software (e.g., Clio, MyCase) from inquiry to final disposition.

Ensure all data fields related to the lead source, contact information, and case details are accurate and up-to-date.



Client Screening & Vetting:



Conduct initial screening interviews with PNCs to gather necessary factual information about their legal matter.

Determine if the prospective matter aligns with the firm’s practice areas and current capacity.

Perform conflict checks immediately upon intake and document the results.



Communication & Nurturing:



Manage follow-up campaigns 
, phone calls, text messages) to nurture warm leads that have not yet scheduled a consultation.

Clearly and professionally communicate the firm’s scope of services, consultation fees, and required next steps.

Maintain documentation of all communications in the client file.



Scheduling & Conversion:



Efficiently schedule consultations and appointments for attorneys and paralegals.

Prepare and send intake packets, necessary forms, and engagement agreements to prospective clients.

Achieve firm conversion rate goals by consistently following up and moving qualified leads through the pipeline.



Reporting & Analysis:



Generate regular reports on lead volume, lead sources, conversion rates, and pipeline status for firm management.

Identify trends and bottlenecks in the intake process and recommend improvements.



Qualifications

Experience: 2+ years of experience in client intake, sales, customer service, or administrative support, preferably within a law firm or professional services environment.

Technical Skills: Proficiency with CRM or case management software (e.g., Salesforce, Clio, MyCase) and Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel). Experience working with data management spreadsheets is a strong plus.



Soft Skills:



Exceptional phone etiquette and professional communication skills (written and verbal).

High degree of empathy and the ability to handle sensitive and confidential information with discretion.

Highly organized and detail-oriented, with the ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously.

Strong self-starter who can work independently and as part of a team.

title: Outbound Enrollment Closer – Career Certification Programs (Remote, EST)
description:
Outbound Enrollment Closer – Career Certification Programs (Remote, EST)



This is not customer service.

This is not inbound order-taking.



This is a phone-driven, outbound enrollment closer role for professionals who know how to control a consult, qualify fast, overcome objections, and close.



We are a U.S.-based online career school enrolling students into IT and Project Management certification programs (CompTIA, PMP, and related tracks). We provide warm leads. You bring the discipline, urgency, and closing skill.



What You’ll Be Doing (Daily Reality)



Make high-volume outbound calls to prospective students



Run structured, consultative enrollment calls (needs analysis ? recommendation ? close)



Control the call, set next steps, and ask for the enrollment



Handle objections around price, time, confidence, and urgency



Follow up relentlessly until the prospect converts or disqualifies



Log activity and outcomes accurately in CRM



Hit daily activity targets and monthly enrollment goals



Improve close rates through coaching, scripts, and call reviews



If you don’t like calling, this role will break you.



Who This Role Is For



Proven outbound / inside sales closers



Comfortable dialing daily and living on the phone



Strong command of English with clear U.S. cultural fluency



Confident asking direct questions and pushing for decisions



Competitive, coachable, metrics-driven



Organized and accountable without supervision



Experience selling education, training, coaching, or professional services is a major plus



Familiarity with certifications (CompTIA, PMP) helps—but closing ability matters more



Bachelor’s degree required



Who Should NOT Apply



Anyone who needs inbound-only leads



Anyone uncomfortable asking for money



Anyone who avoids objection handling



Anyone who wants a “soft” admissions role



Anyone who disappears when targets tighten



Schedule



Monday–Friday



10:00 AM – 6:30 PM EST



Compensation



Base pay: $1,200–$1,600 USD per month



Performance-based advancement and leadership path



Long-term role with stability and growth for performers



(Top performers move fast. Average performers don’t last.)



What You Get



Warm leads with real intent



Clear scripts, frameworks, and coaching



No gimmicks, no fake promises—just real programs that work



A sales culture that rewards results



Bottom Line



If you can:



Control a sales conversation



Build urgency without lying



Close consistently



Take coaching and improve



You will win here.



If not—this role will expose you quickly.

title: Google Ads Specialist
description:

Work-from-Home | U.S.-Based Google Advertising Agency

- Webcam for Zoo
etings

Compensation & Schedule:

How to Apply:

Apply Today, We  Hire Fast!

title: Amazon Online Arbitrage Assistant for Germany
description:
Hello,

We’re looking for a reliable, detail-oriented Virtual Assistant to help us source profitable products for Amazon Online Arbitrage on the German marketplace (
).

If you already have experience sourcing for the German market, that’s great — but it’s not mandatory. We can train the right person.

Our goal is to build a long-term team, so we’re looking for someone who works carefully, thinks independently, and consistently delivers high-quality leads.

Your responsibilities

• Source profitable products for Online Arbitrage (manual research)

• Document leads accurately in Google Sheets

Preferred experience

• Keepa

• BuyBotPro / Profitgo

Requirements

• We are looking for someone with proven experience in Amazon Online Arbitrage, specifically in sourcing and analyzing products/deals

• A stable, reliable internet connection

Benefits

• Flexible schedule — work anytime, as long as tasks are completed on time

• Bi-weekly payment

• Flexible time off upon request

• Long-term collaboration 

• You will be trained and supported by our current VA (team lead), who will guide you through our sourcing process and answer questions.



Hiring process

________________________________________

title: Travel Blog Post Writer
description:
JOB OVERVIEW



We are looking for a creative, detail-oriented Content Writer & Virtual Assistant to help grow Berlin Bound, a travel website dedicated to exploring the best of Berlin, Germany. 



You will be responsible for researching local gems, writing engaging blog posts, and assisting with SEO-focused content updates.



This is a part-time remote position. 



We are looking for someone who doesn’t just "write for AI" or "for algorithms." Instead, we want someone who can craft stories that make readers feel like they are walking through the streets of Kreuzberg or Mitte.





KEY RESPONSIBILITIES



Content Writing: Draft 2–5 high-quality blog posts per week (varying between 500 and 2,000 words, depending on the post) ranging from "Best Vegan Brunch in Berlin" to "A Guide to the Berlin Wall Memorial."



Deep Research: Use Google Maps, local blogs, and German tourism sites (translated) to find up-to-date prices, opening hours, and "hidden" spots.



SEO Optimization: Use tools like RankMath to ensure articles rank for target keywords. But we won't be over-optimizing. Instead, we're focusing on creating quality content for human readers.



Formatting: Upload and format posts in WordPress (adding headers, alt-text for images, and internal links).



Content Repurposing: Occasionally turn blog posts into short social media captions or newsletter snippets.





SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS



Exceptional English: Must have near-native written English with a conversational, engaging tone.



Research Pro: Ability to find specific details (e.g., "Which U-Bahn station is closest to this gallery?") quickly and accurately.



WordPress Experience: Comfortable working with WordPress. Bonus points if you're comfortable with Kadence!



SEO Knowledge: Familiarity with H1/H2 structures, keyword density, and meta descriptions.



Self-Starter: You can take a topic like "3 Days in Berlin" and run with it without constant hand-holding.



Interest in Travel: (Bonus) If you’ve traveled or have a passion for European history/culture, that’s a huge plus!





PAY & BENEFITS



Pay: $7 USD hourly



Schedule: Flexible schedule with minimal meetings. Most communication will be done via
 & Slack. At first, you can expect to work between 3 and 5 hours per week. More hours will become available over time.



Thirteenth Month Pay: Included!



Birthday Bonus: Get a bonus equal to 8 hours of work, times your hourly rate, for your birthday. Must be on the team for at least 90 days to qualify.



Health Insurance Reimbursement: $50 USD per month to contribute towards a monthly healthcare plan from companies like Maxicare or PhilHealth. Must be on the team for at least 90 days to qualify.



Launch Revenue Share Bonuses: Each tea
mber receives a bonus equal in proportion to how our launches go. We believe it's important to share the successes with our virtual assistants!



Holidays Off: Our offices are closed during major holidays in the United States and in the Phillipines. Please note that these are not paid days, but that we won't ask you to work on them. If you'd like to have more hours and work on these days, please let us know during the interview process. You can learn more here: 





HOW TO APPLY



To ensure you have high attention to detail, please follow these steps:



• Change the subject line to: "Berlin is Calling – [Your Name]"



• Tell me about one place in Berlin you think sounds interesting and why (a 2-sentence Google search is fine!). Please don't use A.I. for this part; I want to see how you actually write.



• Attach your portfolio or links to 2–3 travel-related articles you have written.



• If you have your own travel blog, or if you've worked with a travel website before, share that as well.



• Tell me your favorite SEO tool and why you like it.
