title: Motion Designer / Animator - Meta ADS
description:
We’re looking for a high-performing motion designer / animator to join our creative team full-time. Your mission: take our best-performing static ads and bring them to life through short, scroll-stopping animations (5–10 seconds).



You’ll work closely with our creative leads but are expected to ideate, execute, and deliver finished assets daily with minimal direction. You should thrive in a fast-paced, performance-driven environment where every piece of creative is designed to convert.



What You’ll Do

 • Animate static ads into short, dynamic motion pieces (5–10 sec) optimized for Meta.

 • Concept and design original ad ideas from scratch when needed, not just animate existing assets.

 • Collaborate with our creative strategists to test variations and iterate quickly based on performance.

 • Maintain brand consistency across all animations and formats.

 • Turn around polished deliverables daily (we move fast).

 • Stay on top of creative trends, motion design techniques, and what’s working in the CPG and DTC space.



You’re a Great Fit If You:

 • Have 2–4+ years of experience animating for CPG / DTC brands (ads, launches, etc.).

 • Are fluent in After Effects, Premiere, or equivalent motion tools.

 • Can look at a static ad and instantly see how to make it move, pop, and convert.

 • Understand paid social performance creative (what hooks, what loops, what stops the scroll).

 • Are self-driven, disciplined, and can deliver without hand-holding.

 • Have a strong eye for typography, pacing, and visual rhythm.



Requirements

 • Strong portfolio or reel showing animations you’ve done for CPG or DTC brands.

 • Must understand the difference between beautiful motion and performance motion.

 • Reliable internet connection.

 • Speak perfect English.

 • Full-time availability (40 hrs/week).

If you’re interested, please apply — Shopify experience is required.

title: Credit Repair Dispute Specialist
description:
Swipes Enterprises



A little bit about us,



We have been in the industry for more than 2 years now and have seen a lot of changes going on with the disputing strategies and methods to fix our clients credit score the best way and as safety as possible. And I mean ALL of it. For someone coming to work with Swipes Enterprises they are entering an already existing framework that they can get started with. No need to help business owners or staff to get them up to speed. Continuing on 2026 we are looking to strength our dispute process and coach some A++ players on our team to create an amazing environment that will change lives this year. We are highly motivated to give our clients the #1 investment for this year, which is a health credit score. So if you see yourself as someone who can take on a leadership role and work well with others, this will be a great opportunity for you. 



(1 Stop available only)



Position Overview

We are seeking a highly detail-oriented and compliance-driven Credit Repair Dispute Specialist to manage client credit file audits, dispute processing, and regulatory-compliant communications.



This role requires advanced knowledge of consumer credit laws, regulatory bodies, and structured dispute strategy. The ideal candidate is organized, fast, accurate, and capable of handling sensitive financial information with absolute precision.



This is not entry-level. We are looking for professionals who understand the seriousness of consumer credit compliance and documentation accuracy.



Core Responsibilities



Able to read full credit reports from (Experian, Equifax, TransUnion)



Identify reporting inaccuracies



Draft and process dispute letters aligned with FCRA standards



Track dispute timelines and bureau responses (A BIG ONE HERE AT SWIPES)



Maintain organized client files



Ensure 100?curacy of personal identifiers and sensitive information



Monitor escalations and regulatory complaint workflows



Manage multiple client cases simultaneously without errors



Regulatory & Industry Knowledge Required



Candidates must demonstrate some knowledge of:



Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA)



Fair Debt Collection Practices Act (FDCPA)



Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB)



Federal Trade Commission (FTC)



Better Business Bureau (BBB)



State Attorney General complaint processes



Credit bureau reinvestigation procedures



Compliance-based dispute strategies (not template)



MORE SO GOOD TACTICAL SKILLS 



Required Skills & Traits



Extremely detail-oriented (double-checks all work before submission)

-Organized with structured workflow systems

-Ability to multitask across multiple active files

-Fast turnaround time without sacrificing accuracy

-Strong written communication skills



High level of discretion with sensitive client information



Comfortable working within SOPs and compliance guidelines



Self-managed and deadline-driven



Performance Expectations



Zero tolerance for data errors



Timely dispute cycle management



Proper documentation of every action taken



Clean, audit-ready file organization



Professional communication internally and externally



Ideal Candidate Profile



Prior experience in credit repair or financial services



Strong understanding of bureau dispute cycles



Experience handling CFPB or regulatory complaints



Familiar with CRM systems and digital file organization



Operates with precision under pressure. Looking forward to speaking with you.

 • Study top LinkedIn creators and bring strategic ideas

title: SDR (COSMETIC INJECTABLES TRAINING PROGRAM) USA/CANADA
description:
****NOTE PLEASE READ*******

 If you do not have experience working with a Medical Clinic or working directly with Nurses, this may not be the role for you. There is a SIGNIFICANT amount of knowledge to retain in regards to Cosmetic Injectables and having experience in the space will set you apart aggressively from any other candidates! 

***************************



Sales Development Representative (Healthcare / Aesthetic Medicine)



DM Setting + Outbound Calls | Growth to Discovery Closer | Long-Term Role



We are the International Institute of Aesthetic Medicine (IIAM) — a leading North American training institute that certifies medical professionals in cosmetic injectables (Botox, dermal fillers, PRP, advanced aesthetic treatments).



We train physicians, nurse practitioners, physician assistants, and nurses who want to enter or grow in aesthetic medicine.



We are looking for a high-level SDR who can:



• Set appointments via Instagram &
 

• Make outbound calls to warm leads

• Pre-qualify healthcare professionals

• Eventually grow into running discovery calls



This is a long-term opportunity with serious growth potential.



Who This Role Is For



You are:



• Extremely fluent in English (neutral accent — must sound North American)

• Confident speaking to doctors and nurses

• Familiar with aesthetic medicine / cosmetic injectables

• Comfortable with outbound dials (not afraid of the phone)

• Highly organized and coachable

• Interested in long-term growth into a closing role



HUGE Bonus If You:



• Have worked in cosmetic injectables, dermatology, or med spa space

• Are a Registered Nurse (RN), medical professional, or have injector experience

• Have experience booking high-ticket appointments

• Have worked in HubSpot, Salesmsg, or CRM systems

• Understand Botox, dermal fillers, PRP, cannula techniques, etc.



We do not want someone who has to Google what Botox is.



Your Responsibilities



• Respond to inbound leads via DM and text

• Call new leads within 24 hours

• Pre-qualify medical professionals

• Book discovery calls for our Program Advisor

• Handle light objections (price, travel, timing)

• Follow structured SOP + scripts

• Log all activity inside HubSpot



After 3–6 months (based on performance), you may begin taking discovery calls and earning commission on closed sales.



Who We Train (Important Context)



We only accept licensed healthcare professionals:



• MD / DO

• NP / PA

• RN / RPN / LPN (varies by state/province)

• Dentists

• IMG physicians



You will be speaking to educated, career-driven medical professionals.



What Makes IIAM Different (So You Understand What You’re Selling)



• Hybrid training (online + hands-on on real patients)

• 3–4 students per instructor (very hands-on)

• Accredited in USA & Canada

• Connected to MedSpa Partners (40+ clinics in North America)

• Medical Director Matching Program

• Business & clinic launch support

• 0% financing options available



Our flagship program is the 2-Day Foundations of Aesthetic Medicine (Botox + Filler training). Most leads inquire about this.



Programs range from $3,000–$10,000+.



Compensation



Base salary + performance bonuses



Performance incentives for:

• Calls booked

• Show rate

• Enrollment rate (if you grow into closer role)



This is not a short-term VA position. We are building a serious sales team.



Work Schedule



Must overlap with:

• Eastern Time (USA/Canada)

• Some evenings possible



Full-time preferred.



How to Apply (IMPORTANT)



Send us:



A short Loom video (2–3 minutes) explaining:



Your experience in sales



Your experience in healthcare/aesthetics (if any)



Why you would be a good fit for this role



A voice recording sample (so we can hear your accent)



Your resume



In your application, include the word “Injector” so we know you read this fully.



Final Note



This role is for someone confident, intelligent, and hungry to grow.



If you want a long-term career in high-ticket healthcare sales and possibly move into a closer role — this is for you.



If you’re looking for a basic VA job, this is not it.

title: Full-Time Remote ACCOUNTANT/BOOKKEEPER (APPFOLIO Experience Required)

About the Role:

We’re seeking a detail-oriented and dependable Bookkeeper to join our team in a fully remote capacity. title: YouTube Operations Manager (Remote) — High Standards, High Output
description:
YouTube Operations Manager (Remote) — Systems, KPIs, SOPs, Team Management



Overview

We run multiple YouTube channels (faceless content). We’re looking for an Operational Manager who treats this like their own business (intrapreneur mindset), moves fast, and holds extremely high standards for anything he or she does.



This is not a “do what you’re told” role. You will be responsible for turning chaos into a machine: planning, execution, tracking, quality control, and team accountability.



What you’ll own

 • Manage the full production pipeline (topic ? script ? edit ? thumbnail ? upload ? QA)

 • Create and enforce SOPs (standard operating procedures) for every recurring process

 • Build and manage KPIs and reporting (weekly performance + production metrics)

 • Ensure deadlines are hit; chase deliverables; remove blockers fast

 • Quality control on outputs (scripts, edits, thumbnails, uploads)

 • Manage freelancers (editors, writers, thumbnail designers): feedback, performance, consistency

 • Keep everything organized in trackers (Notion/Sheets/Trello/ClickUp—your choice, if it works)



What we’re looking for

You are:

 • An intrapreneur: you think in systems, not tasks

 • A workaholic / high-output person (you enjoy building and grinding)

 • Someone who sets the highest standards and refuses to ship “average”

 • Extremely organized and proactive (you don’t wait to be told)

 • Comfortable confronting people on performance (respectful but direct)



Required skills

 • Experience managing workflows or teams (agency, content production, operations, project mgmt)

 • Strong understanding of:

 • SOPs and documentation

 • KPIs (production + performance)

 • Project management tools (Drive/Trello/Sheets)

 • Strong English communication (written + voice)

 • Reliable internet + availability for daily check-ins



Nice to have

 • YouTube automation / faceless channel experience

 • Experience with editors/writers/thumbnail teams

 • Understanding of CTR/AVD/Retention basics



Hours / Availability

 • Remote, long-term

 • Must be highly available and responsive

 • Daily updates required



Compensation

Compensation is determined on the value you bring. When starting off, we'll make sure you can make your ends meet. When (you make) the company grows, you'll salary will grow accordingly, or exponentially.



How to apply (important)

Start your application with: “OPS MACHINE” so we know you read this.



Then include:

 1. Your relevant experience + tools you’ve used (Notion, Sheets, Trello, etc.)

 2. A short example of a SOP you’ve made (or how you’d structure one)

 3. Your availability (hours/day + timezone)

 4. A brief description of how you manage underperformers on a team



Screening process

Shortlisted candidates will do:

 • Personality profile form

 • IQ test

 • Speed test

 • A short live interview + a practical operations scenario

 • Design mobile-first layouts optimized for speed and conversions

 • Create landing pages tailored to Google Ads traffic

 • Write or improve conversion-focused headlines and page copy

 • Implement form tracking and conversion tracking

 • Proven experience improving landing page conversion rates

 • Strong understanding of Google Ads traffic and search intent

 • Basic knowledge of HTML/CSS (preferred)

 • Experience with call tracking, form integrations, and CRM connections

 • Strong eye for layout, spacing, and mobile responsiveness

This is not a beginner design role. We are looking for someone who understands performance marketing.

 • Webcam for Zoo
etings

 • Unbounce

title: Video Editor / Designer for Fast-Growing Jewelry eCommerce Brand
description:
Video Editor / Designer for Fast-Growing Jewelry eCommerce Brand

Company Info + Mission We're a fast-growing D2C jewelry eCommerce brand currently generating $250k/month in revenue, with the goal of scaling to $600k/month in 2026. We sell high-quality lifestyle and jewelry products to customers in the US, Canada, and Europe.



Our mission is simple: deliver great products and create even better customer experiences. We value positive energy, reliability, and treating both our customers and our team like family.



Specific Tasks We are looking for a creative Video Editor / Designer to handle our ad creatives. You will be responsible for editing high-performing eCommerce ads from raw footage, clear ad briefs, and existing B-roll.



Your responsibilities will include:

Video Editing & Production: Edit 2-3 video concepts every week. You must be able to turn existing B-roll footage into creative, cool, and converting ads.



AI Design & Editing: Utilize AI tools to enhance designs, streamline editing, and create unique visual assets.



Ad Optimization: Produce platform-native creatives that follow brand guidelines. You will review ad performance data and iterate on edits to improve results (retention, click-through rate, etc.).



Collaboration: Hop on calls with the team to discuss ad creatives, implement feedback, and proactively suggest improvements.



Requirements & Skills

Experience: 1+ years of experience editing direct-response eCommerce ads.

Visual Skills: Strong understanding of retention and pacing in short-form video ads, with a good eye for high-performing visuals, hooks, and structure. Experience designing in Figma is a plus.



AI Proficiency: Experience with AI design and editing tools is required.

Communication: Fluent written and spoken English.



Work Ethic: Ability to work independently, meet deadlines, and interpret performance metrics to drive creative decisions.

Tech: Reliable and stable internet connection.



What You Can Expect

Full-time position with a supportive international team.

Long-term position with growth opportunities.

Opportunity for pay increases as the business grows.

Regular feedback and a clear workflow structure.



Application Instructions

Please include the word "Apple" in the first sentence of your application so we know you read everything.

Portfolio: Send your portfolio along with your top 3 best-performing ads (video / static). [IMPORTANT - Google drive folder please]

Experience: Include a short summary of your experience (years editing ads, brands worked with, platforms).

AI Tools: Explicitly state which AI tools you have experience with for both editing and designing.



Applications without the keyword will not be considered.

We're excited to meet someone who genuinely cares about quality and wants to grow with us for the long term!

title: Social Media Strategist & Community Growth Manager (Organic Growth | E-commerce Marketing Brand)
description:
About In Flow Marketing

In Flow Marketing is a results-driven
 marketing agency helping Australian product-based e-commerce brands scale from $10K months to $100K+ months using retention and customer lifetime value strategies.



In 2025 alone, we generated:

• $2.5M in client revenue through Klaviyo

• 43% average open rates

• Supported 41 brands

• Grew our team to 3 Klaviyo design specialists



We are strategic, clear, no-fluff, and focused on real revenue growth.

Now, we are ready to expand our organic visibility and personal brand presence across
, Instagram, and Threads.



This is not a content scheduling role.

This is a growth role.



The Role

We are looking for a highly strategic, independent Social Media Strategist & Community Growth Manager to fully own our organic social presence.



You will:

• Develop and execute a growth strategy for
, Instagram, and Threads

• Plan and create weekly content calendars aligned with brand strategy

• Create posts, carousels, reels, captions, and story sequences

• Design graphics in line with brand guidelines

• Drive community engagement and outbound engagement

• Generate qualified followers and inbound leads organically

• Identify trends and strategically apply them

• Track metrics and deliver weekly performance reports

• Continuously test and optimise for engagement and lead generation



This role requires ownership. We do not want to manage you. We want you to manage this channel.



What Success Looks Like

• Consistent, on-brand presence across all platforms

• Measurable follower growth

• Increased engagement rate

• Increased inbound enquiries

• Strong community engagement

• Weekly reporting without being chased



You Are a Good Fit If:

• You have proven experience growing brands organically

• You understand strategy beyond aesthetics

• You can articulate why something works, not just what to post

• You are proactive and self-managed

• You understand e-commerce marketing psychology

• You are comfortable working independently

• You think in terms of business growth, not just content



Bonus (but not required):

• Experience in agency or marketing environments

• Familiarity with Klaviyo and retention marketing

• Understanding of Australian market tone



Deliverables

• Weekly content calendar

• Minimum agreed number of posts per week

• Stories and engagement strategy

• Daily or structured community engagement

• Weekly performance report (growth, engagement, insights, strategy adjustments)



Compensation will be structured as:

• Monthly deliverables fee

• Hourly rate for engagement / outreach



Applicants must quote their hourly rate in AUD.



How to Apply

To be considered, you must complete the application form below.

We will not review CV-only applications.





Thank you so much!

Jess

etings

Google Maps Specialist Application – Your Name



Incomplete applications will not be reviewed.



Apply Today — We Hire Fast!

Bev

title: WordPress Technical SEO Specialist Needed (Rank Math + Schema + Core Web Vitals Fixes)
description:
Fix Structured Data, Canonicals, H1 Issues + Improve CWV Performance



Hi! My name is Rhett and I'm the Marketing Manager at The Equine Practice Company 
/ (If you see a recent post on this, I have cancelled that task and made this project clearer to ensure there is no confusion on what we need you to do)



I’m looking for an experienced Technical SEO Specialist to help fix several technical issues identified that we have with our website.



The Equine Practice Company - a continuing education platform for equine veterinarians worldwide.



Let me make this very clear before you apply.



- This is not a content role or keyword research role.

- This is a hands-on technical implementation project focused on:



- Structured data (Schema / JSON-LD)

- Entity linking (Organization ? Speakers)

- Canonical + redirect consistency

- Core Web Vitals performance improvements



This is a one-time technical SEO implementation project. I'd prefer a fixed-price structure with clear milestones. If the work is done well, I may offer ongoing technical SEO support for future schema + performance needs to this website and our second website.



I want someone who can fix this properly and document the work clearly.



A. Current Website Setup



To save time, here is our technical environment:



Website platform: WordPress

Theme: Kadence

SEO plugin: Rank Math

Hosting: WPX (Cloudflare available)

Canonical preference: I don’t mind www vs non-www - I just want one version enforced consistently



Key Tasks



1. Schema & Structured Data Implementation (High Priority) We currently have gaps in structured data, and we need a clean schema setup using best practices.



You will implement:



- Organization schema site-wide

- AboutPage schema

- ContactPage schema + ContactPoint

- Person schema for our “Meet the Speaker” pages

- Proper entity linking (Organization ? Website ? Speakers)



I want a hybrid approach:



- Rank Math for baseline schema

- Custom JSON-LD where needed (especially for Speaker Person schema)



Important: Avoid duplicate/conflicting schema output.



All schema must be validated using:



- Google Rich Results Test

- 
 Validator



2. Homepage SEO Fix (H1 Hierarchy) - Our homepage currently has two H1 tags, which causes structural confusion for Google.



You will:



- Fix the heading hierarchy (single clean H1)

- Keep design intact (Kadence blocks)



Suggested H1:



“The Equine Practice Company – Continuing Education for Equine Veterinarians”



3. Canonical + Domain Consistency (WWW vs Non-WWW) - We may have canonical duplication issues.



You will:



- Audit canonical tags across templates

- Enforce one preferred domain version via proper 301 redirects

- Ensure Rank Math canonicals match server/CDN redirects

- Confirm consistent indexing in Google Search Console



4. Core Web Vitals + Performance Improvements (CWV) - Because this is a membership-based site, performance matters.



I need help improving:



- LCP (Largest Contentful Paint)

- TTFB (Time to First Byte)

- INP / CLS issues if present



You will:



- Identify the top causes of poor CWV (mobile-first)

- Optimize heavy scripts/plugins where possible

- Recommend hosting/CDN improvements if needed



Retest using:



- PageSpeed Insights

- Lighthouse

- CrUX data



It is important that you document before/after results.



Most Importantly, The Final Deliverables (What You Must Provide)



At completion of this project for our website, I expect:



- Working JSON-LD schema for Organization, AboutPage, ContactPage, Person

- Clean entity graph 

- Validation proof (screenshots or links)

- Canonical + redirect mapping summary

- Before/after homepage H1 structure proof

- Core Web Vitals improvement report

- Clear documentation of everything changed



Who Is My Ideal Candidate For This Project - I'm looking for someone with:



- Strong WordPress technical SEO experience

- Deep schema + JSON-LD knowledge (not just plugins)

- Experience with Rank Math + Kadence themes

- Understanding of Core Web Vitals (TTFB/LCP)

- Ability to work independently and document clearly



If you are a real technical implementer (not just an SEO auditor), I’d love to work with you.



 Please answer the following questions when submitting a proposal:



1.What schema does Rank Math output by default, and how do you avoid duplication when adding custom Person schema?

2. Where would you enforce the canonical domain version (WordPress vs Cloudflare vs server)?

3. Share one example of Organization + Person JSON-LD you have implemented before (client details can be hidden).



I'd prefer a fixed-price structure with clear milestones. What is your fixed price to complete this project and break it down in milestones.



Please estimate how long this will take to fully complete the project.

title: Persuasive Copywriter
description:
We’re hiring a full-time Content Marketer to own our content strategy across platforms, with a primary focus on
 marketing (Klaviyo) and website (Shopify). This role is full-time and in-house (remote), so please only apply if you’re looking for a long-term permanent position. We're not hiring freelancer or agency.



This role is ideal for someone who is creative, strategic, and detail-oriented, and excited to work closely with designers to improve content performance through clear insights, testing, and audience-focused messaging.



What You’ll Be Responsible For

- Plan, write, and execute
 campaigns and automated flows in Klaviyo.

- Create and optimize website copy, landing pages, product descriptions, and other on-site content.

- Collaborate with graphic designers to produce visuals aligned with campaigns.

- Analyze
 and website performance metrics to identify what’s working, underperforming content, and opportunities for improvement.

- Participate in brainstorming sessions to improve content and campaign performance.

- Provide insights and recommendations to improve messaging, tone, and overall content effectiveness.

- Analyze website behavior and implement content-driven CRO strategies to improve conversions on landing pages, product pages, and key funnels.

- Monitor competitors’
s, websites, offers, and campaigns to identify gaps or opportunities in our market niche.

- Stay up-to-date with DTC content marketing trends and
 best practices.

- Providing administrative support, as and when needed to the manager.



Requirements

- Full-time, Monday–Friday (9am–5pm PH time)

- Remote position

- Strong writing, editing, and storytelling skills

- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills; able to interpret content performance data to make informed decisions

- Able to explain insights clearly to non-technical teammates

- Highly organized, self-directed, execution-focused, and able to work independently

- Willing to learn quickly and adapt as the business grows

- No prior content marketing experience required, but you must be sharp, creative, analytical, and able to learn fast



Nice To Have (but not required)

- Experience with Klaviyo or other
 marketing platforms

- Experience with Shopify or website analytics

- Experience in content marketing or CRO for DTC brands

- Familiarity with user behavior analytics, heatmaps, or funnel optimization

- Basic understanding of SEO and social media content strategy



What We Offer

- Competitive salary

- Performance-based bonuses

- Paid annual leave & public holidays

- Fully remote work

- Training, upskilling, and career growth opportunities

- A team that values ownership, clarity, and results



Application

Please send your application via
 to 
 with the subject line: "Persuasive Copywriter – (Your Name)". Include your OnlineJobsPH profile link and answers to the questions below in numbered format directly in the
 body:

1) Tell us about your most recent job. What did you mainly work on, what were some challenges you faced, and why did you d
 to leave?

2) If you’ve worked in
 marketing/copywriting, tell us about the campaigns you handled, tools you used, your process, and results. If you haven’t, what have you been learning on your own and how would you get competent quickly?

3) Share a time you took initiative or solved a problem in your workplace. It doesn’t have to be a formal leadership role, just something you’re proud of.

4) Please submit as much of your portfolio as possible. Submitting more work will help us make a more informed decision. Work can include anything within DTC e-commerce industry, but ideally aligned to the role you are applying for. If you don’t have DTC experience, submit your best work portfolio. Strong portfolios outside this role may be considered for other roles. 

5) Pick one project from the attached portfolio in question (4) that you are most proud of and answer the questions below. We want to see your ability to clearly explain what you did, your role, your reasoning, and the results of your work. You may optionally pick more than 1 project to highlight additional skills.

- What the project was

- Your specific contribution

- Why you approached it this way

- The results or impact (if any)



Keywords

creative copywriter, creative copywriting, DTC, CRM, SEO, copywriter, e-commerce copywriter, sales conversion, content writing, direct response copywriting, persuasive copywriting, performance ads, lifecycle marketing, retention marketing,
 copywriter, copy strategy, sales funnel, marketing strategist, copy strategist,
 strategist,
 specialist, copy specialist, sales copywriter, website copywriting, klaviyo, mailchimp, omnisend, performance marketing, postscript, SMS marketing, brand strategist, CRO, landing page, web copy,
 copywriting,
 marketing,
 lifecycle management,
 lifecycle strategy

title: Senior Meta Ads Specialist / Performance Marketing Engineer (Remote / Full Time)
description:
Job Title: Senior Meta Ads Specialist / Performance Marketing Engineer (Remote / Full Time)



Company: 



Who We Are

At GMU.online, we build scalable, managed SaaS solutions that engineer profitable and predictable growth for e-commerce entrepreneurs. We don't just run ads; we automate the entire performance marketing loop, from product data feeds and catalog management to cross-channel campaign optimization, through our own proprietary platform. We enable high volume web shops to focus on their product while our technology stack systematically maximizes their return on ad spend.



Your Role: Architect of Meta Performance

We are looking for a Senior Meta Ads Specialist (8+ years experience) who functions as a Performance Marketing Engineer. This is not a "launch and monitor" role. You are a hands on performance architect who will own, dissect, and scale our clients' Meta and other social advertising results. You combine deep technical execution in the Meta ecosystem with a datadriven mindset for automation, relentlessly building smarter configurations that outperform standard campaigns.



You will work at the intersection of paid social and data science, leveraging our proprietary Data Engine and Feed Automation Systems to turn complex ecommerce data into a competitive advantage on
, Instagram, Tiktok and other social ads platforms.



Your Technical Arena: What You'll Build & Optimize

1. Meta Ads Engineering & Structure



Full Funnel Architecture: Design and manage complex, high-volume campaign structures beyond basic CBO’s. You'll architect multi-layered prospecting, retargeting, and dynamic product ad (DPA) strategies that align with the customer journey.



Advanced Bidding & Automation: Mastery of Meta's bidding algorithms (Value Optimization, Cost Cap, Bid Cap) to hit strict ROAS/POAS targets. You will use automated rules and external scripts to manage bid adjustments, budget pacing, and alerting at scale.



2. E-commerce Data & Catalog Mastery



 Catalog & Feed Management: You don't just upload a feed; you optimize it. Deep experience with tools like Channable, Feedonomics, or DataFeedWatch to improve product data specifically for Meta. You leverage custom labels to create granular product segmentation (e.g., by margin, sell-through rate, seasonality) directly within the catalog.



Dynamic Product Ads (DPA) Strategy: You build sophisticated DPA sets that dynamically show the right product to the right user based on their browsing behavior, purchase history, and real-time inventory levels. You understand how to structure product sets for maximum relevance and conversion.



3. Conversion Tracking & Measurement Infrastructure



Server-Side Tracking & CAPI: You have deep knowledge of implementing and troubleshooting Meta's Conversions API (CAPI) . You understand how to set up deduplication between the browser pixel and server-side events to ensure data integrity in a cookieless world.



Tag Management (GTM): You are highly proficient in Google Tag Manager, configuring complex dataLayer variables, custom triggers, and advanced e-commerce tracking to feed clean, granular conversion data back to Meta for optimization.



Attribution & Incrementality: You move beyond last-click. You analyze attribution windows, understand the impact of view-through vs. click-through conversions, and can design holdout tests to measure the true incrementality of Meta campaigns.



4. Automation & Workflow Efficiency



Scripts & Integrations: You are comfortable using scripts and APIs to automate reporting and consolidate data fro
ta, Webshops and Google Analytics 4 into a single source of truth.



AI-Driven Optimization: You leverage AI co-pilots for ad copy generation, creative testing concepts, and predictive forecasting. You are curious about how LLMs can automate audience analysis and campaign brief generation.



We’re looking for:

Experience: 8-10+ years of hands-on experience specifically in Meta Ads 
/Instagram) + other paid social performance marketing for e-commerce.



ROAS/POAS Optimization: A proven track record of optimizing not just for ROAS, but for Profit on Ad Spend (POAS) , managing bids based on product-level margin data.



Data Fluency: You are comfortable querying data in Google Analytics 4 (GA4) to build audiences, analyze user behavior, and validate tracking. You can translate raw e-commerce data (SQL knowledge is a plus) into actionable audience and bidding strategies. You know how to connect datalayers to Google Tag Manager.



Ownership & Strategy: You don't just execute tasks; you own the growth trajectory. You proactively identify scaling opportunities, diagnose performance anomalies, and present data-backed strategies to internal teams and international clients.



Innovation Culture: You dedicate time to R&D, testing new Meta betas, AI creative tools, and audience modeling techniques and share your findings to elevate the entire team's knowledge.



Your Technical Toolkit

Core Platforms: Meta Business Suite (Ads Manager, Business Manager, Events Manager), Google Analytics 4 (GA4), Google Tag Manager (GTM).



Feed & Catalog: Channable, Feedonomics, DataFeedWatch, or native
 Catalog setup with custom labels.



Tracking & Measurement: Conversions API (CAPI) , Server-Side Tagging, Google Sheets (for data analysis), Looker Studio (for dashboards).



Automation: Google Ads Scripts, Supermetrics/Power My Analytics, API integrations for data flow.



AI & Innovation: Practical application of generative AI (e.g., Midjourney for creative inspiration, ChatGPT for copy at scale) and machine learning concepts for audience forecasting.



What Sets You Apart (Bonus Points)

Multi-Platform Synergy: Experience integrating Meta strategies with other channels (e.g., TikTok, Pinterest, Google PMax) for a holistic view.



Machine Learning Knowledge: Understanding of how ML models power bidding and how to structure campaigns to feed them optimal data.



International Scale: Proven success scaling Meta ads across multiple currencies, languages, and time zones for global e-commerce brands.



Why Join GMU.online?

Work with the Best: Collaborate with senior developers, data scientists, and marketers in a flat, high-performance culture.



Cutting-Edge Tech: Access and help build proprietary martech that delivers an average client ROI of 900%.



Ultimate Ownership: Full responsibility and freedom to design creative, data-driven solutions without bureaucratic red tape.



R&D Time: Dedicated time for innovation 20% of your focus can be on experimenting with new tech and strategies.



Global Collaboration: Work remotely in an async-first environment with international entrepreneurs. We value clear communication and structured ownership over micromanagement.



Ready to engineer the future of e-commerce performance? Apply now.

title: EXECUTIVE OPERATIONS & TEAM MANAGER
description:
Home Care + Credit Consulting – Scaling Company



We are a fast-growing non-medical home care agency and credit/business funding consulting firm. We are seeking a highly organized, tech-savy, proactive Executive Operations Assistant to help scale operations, manage team performance, and build systems.



This role is for someone who can:



• Build systems

• Manage people

• Improve efficiency

• Support recruiting

• Track KPIs

• Enroll company into growth programs

• Create SOPs

• Hold team accountable





Core Responsibilities



Operations & SOP Development



• Create and maintain SOPs for payroll, billing, onboarding, and recurring tasks

• Document every repeatable process

• Improve workflow efficiency

• Identify bottlenecks and propose solutions



 Team Management & Accountability



• Monitor current staff performance

• Track KPIs (response times, task completion, billing accuracy, etc.)

• Conduct weekly check-ins with team

• Ensure deadlines are met

• Report inefficiencies directly to CEO

• Assist with performance improvement plans if needed



THIS is critical — this ensures recruiting is proactive, not reactive.





Recruiting & Staffing



• Post job listings

• Screen candidates

• Conduct first-round interviews

• Maintain recruiting tracker

• Maintain backup candidate list

• Assist with onboarding caregivers and internal team





Program Enrollment & Compliance



• Research and enroll company in:

 • Veteran-owned certifications

 • Government or VA programs

 • Industry partnerships

 • Referral networks

• Track renewal deadlines

• Maintain compliance documentation





 Marketing & Growth Support



• SEO coordination

• LinkedIn buildout

• CRM buildout

• Website clean-up

• Landing page updates

•
 organization

• AI automation support



What We’re REALLY Hiring For



We want someone who:



• Thinks like an Operations Manager

• Enforces systems

• Makes the team better

• Builds structure

• Doesn’t wait for instructions

• Can say “Here’s what I recommend.”



Ideal Candidate



• Strong English (written & verbal)

• Experience supporting US-based businesses

• Experience in healthcare, recruiting, legal, or accounting preferred

• Extremely organized and detail-oriented

• Tech-savvy (Google Workspace, CRM, project tools)

• Comfortable using AI tools

• Proactive problem-solver

• Can create SOPs independently

• Handles confidential information professionally



–––––––––––––––



Application Requirements

    1.    Resume

    2.     Background introduction 

    3.    Create a sample SOP outline for “New Client Onboarding”

    4.    What CRM tools have you used?

    5.    Describe a time you built a system from scratch“Describe how you would improve staff efficiency in a remote team.”

title: Part-Time Website QA Specialist (10–15 Hours per Week, Long-Term Potential)
description:
We are looking for a detail-oriented Website QA Specialist to support our growing web team.



This role is ideal for someone who enjoys reviewing websites, spotting inconsistencies, testing functionality, and ensuring high-quality standards before pages go live. You will act as the quality gate between development and publishing.



This is a part-time freelance position for the first three months, starting at approximately 10 hours per week (with flexibility up to 15 hours max). If the collaboration works well, there is potential to grow into a more stable part-time role.



What You’ll Be Responsible For



• QA testing completed website builds before they are shared with stakeholders or published

• Reviewing pages across multiple websites to ensure consistency with our design system and style guide

• Checking that translations are correctly implemented and displayed in the proper language

• Identifying layout issues, spacing inconsistencies, broken elements, and visual bugs

• Testing forms, links, buttons, and interactive components

• Verifying responsive behavior across desktop, tablet, and mobile

• Documenting issues clearly and communicating them to the developer

• Performing ongoing health checks to prevent recurring bugs



What We’re Looking For



• Strong attention to detail. You notice small inconsistencies others miss.

• Experience with website QA, testing, or web project support

• Ability to test across different browsers and devices

• Organized and structured in documenting findings

• Comfortable working independently with clear expectations

• Strong written English (Other languages a plus) 



Nice to Have



• Experience working with Webflow or modern CMS platforms

• Experience with multilingual websites

• Basic understanding of UX and conversion-focused design

• Familiarity with tools like Notion, Google Docs, or bug-tracking tools



What This Role Is Not



This is not a developer role and not a design role. The focus is quality control, testing, and consistency.



Why This Role Is Important



As we scale our web production, maintaining quality is critical. We want someone who takes pride in being the final checkpoint before pages go live and who enjoys making sure everything is polished and functioning perfectly.



If you apply, please include:



- A short introduction about your QA or website testing experience

- An example of how you typically document bugs or QA findings

- The word “Quality First” at the top of your application so we know you’ve read the full description



We are looking for someone reliable and long-term oriented. If you enjoy structured work, high standards, and being the person who protects quality, we’d love to hear from you.

title: Instagram + TikTok Content Editor & Social Media VA (Collage Art / Reels)
description:
We’re hiring a reliable, creative, detail-oriented VA to help grow my wife’s collage art accounts on Instagram and TikTok. She creates collage-style artwork and will record the raw footage. Your job is to turn that footage into engaging short-form videos, create multiple versions from the same recording, schedule posts, write captions, and track performance so we can repeat what works and improve what doesn’t. Instagram: 



This role is primarily video editing for Reels and TikTok (potentially YouTube shorts as well) . You’ll take raw clips and produce clean, engaging edits with strong hooks, good pacing, and clear on-screen text. We want you to make different versions from the same footage (for example, different openings, text overlays, or endings) so we can test what performs best. You should be comfortable adding subtitles or captions, light sound design, and exporting in the right formats for both platforms.



You will also help with planning and consistency. Each week you’ll build a simple posting schedule, prepare content ahead of time, and schedule uploads with captions. We want someone who can contribute ideas for a practical posting strategy to drive followers and engagement, and who understands how short-form content works (hooks, retention, testing variations, and learning from analytics). The goal is steady growth and a repeatable content system that fits an art account.



Organization matters. You will create and maintain a Google Sheet to track what we post and how it performs. This should include the post date/time, video type, hook style, length, caption approach, hashtags, and performance results. Once per week, you’ll share a short summary of what performed best and your best guess as to why, plus what you recommend we test next.



This is a part-time role to start (around 10–20 hours per week) with flexible hours, as long as weekly deliverables and deadlines are met. We want to form this into a full-time role long term. Please include your rate (hourly or weekly/monthly). We are open to hourly at the beginning and moving to a fixed deliverables structure once the workflow is consistent. If we work hourly, we may use OnlineJobs.ph TimeProof during working time only, and we’re happy to reduce or remove tracking once we establish trust and consistent results.



To apply, please send a short intro and your relevant experience editing Reels/TikToks, plus 2–4 examples of short-form edits you’ve done (portfolio links are fine). Tell us what editing tools you use, your typical turnaround time, and what weekly posting cadence you would suggest for an art/collage account like ours. Include your rate and your availability to start.



Finalists may be asked to do a small paid test using a short raw clip we provide. You would create two 10–20 second edit variations with different hooks/text/endings, and provide a caption and hashtags.

title: Bookkeeper and Financial Operations Specialist
description:
Job Title: Bookkeeper / Accountant (Real Estate Investment)

Location: Remote | Type: Full-Time

Industry: Real Estate (Long-Term Rentals, Short-Term Rentals, Flips)



About Us:

We are a startup real estate investment company specializing in long-term and short-term rentals (Airbnb/VRBO) and property flips. Our mission is to provide high-quality living spaces and maximize returns for our investors. This is a startup company with no formal training materials. We are looking for someone with past experience in property management and bookkeeping who is proactive, able to ask questions, and update us on their progress regularly.



Role Overview:

We are seeking a detail-oriented Bookkeeper/Accountant to manage the financial operations of our real estate portfolio. This role involves handling daily transactions, budgeting, financial reporting, and tax preparation across multiple property types.



Key Responsibilities:

- Maintain financial records and manage accounts payable/receivable, reconciliations, and the general ledger

- Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements

- Track income and expenses for each property, including renovations and repairs

- Monitor cash flow, assist in budgeting, and help with forecasting

- Prepare documentation for tax filings and coordinate with external accountants

- Handle mortgage, insurance, and property tax payments

- Manage rent payments and security deposit refunds

- Use Buildium Property Management Software for financial tracking and reporting



Qualifications:

- 2+ years of experience in property management or real estate accounting

- Proven experience managing rental property accounting, including handling income, expenses, and taxes

- Strong knowledge of accounting software (QuickBooks, Xero, etc.) and Microsoft Excel

- Must have experience in real estate or property management bookkeeping

- Highly organized with a strong attention to detail

- Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal

- Available to respond during Colorado business hours and attend weekly meetings



Compensation:

- We offer $500 for the first month as a probation period to assess your skills and commitment. If you pass, we’ll proceed with the agreed-upon rate, which will be finalized before the probation starts. 



How to Apply:

Please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your experience with rental accounting, including how you've managed the accounting side of rentals in your previous roles. We also welcome any references or relevant work samples.



Please apply using this link: 



We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Virtual Assistant (UGC Breifs)
description:
Role: UGC Brief Manager

Core Responsibility

Own the creation, distribution, and tracking of UGC briefs to ensure creators clearly understand what to film and deliver high-quality, on-brand content.

Key Responsibilities

UGC Brief Creation

Write clear, concise UGC briefs for creators based on campaign goals.

Translate angles, hooks, and concepts into simple creator-friendly instructions.

Create and update scripts, talking points, shot lists, and B-roll requirements.

Adapt briefs for different creator types eg mums, sons, couples, girlfriends, professionals.

Brief Distribution & Tracking

Send the correct brief and assets to each creator.

Ensure creators fully understand expectations, tone, and deliverables.

Track who has received briefs, confirmed, needs clarification, or requires follow-up.

Manage shoot timelines and delivery deadlines.

Organisation & Systems

Log all briefs, creator assignments, and statuses in Notion.

Update progress clearly eg brief sent, confirmed, filming, delivered.

Ensure no creator films without the correct and latest brief.

Flag gaps in coverage eg missing angles, demographics, or formats.

Quality Control

Review creator submissions against the brief before approval.

Identify missing shots, weak delivery, or off-brief content early.

Request revisions or additional footage when required.

Maintain consistency in tone, structure, and message across all UGC.

Communication & Coordination

Respond to creator questions quickly and clearly.

Provide direction without overcomplicating or overwhelming creators.

Coordinate with the content team when briefs need refinement or updates.

Requirements

Strong written English with an understanding of Australian tone and phrasing.

Extremely organised and detail-oriented.

Able to manage multiple briefs and creators simultaneously.

Fast response times and consistent daily output.

Comfortable using:

Notion

Google Drive

Slack

Experience with UGC, influencer content, creator briefs, or content operations is a plus.

Ideal Qualities

Clear communicator who can simplify complex ideas.

Reliable and consistent with strong follow-through.

Good judgement for brand tone and audience fit.

Enjoys structured, fast-paced, high-volume work.

Understands what makes UGC feel natural, not scripted.

title: Online Installations Technician
description:
As an Online Installation Technician, you will play a critical role in remotely supporting the installation of AI systems in the U.S. This is a fully remote contractor position where you will guide on-the-ground technicians through various installation steps, ensuring successful implementation and troubleshooting of any issues that arise. Your expertise in hardware, software, and troubleshooting will be essential in maintaining smooth operations and delivering high-quality support to our partners and customers. Payment for this role is on an hourly basis.



You would bring:

- Excellent Communication Skills: Proficient in English with an easy-to-understand accent, confidence in speaking, and smooth communication skills.

- Technical Equipment: Dedicated work PC with a fast and stable internet connection, sufficient RAM, and adequate memory.

- Experience: Proven experience in handling communication in English, including calls and interactions with various business partners.

- Technical Expertise: Familiarity with hardware, software, and troubleshooting. This role requires candidates who can handle technical tasks beyond basic help, such as adjusting laptop brightness or taking screenshots.

- Stress Management: Ability to remain calm and take control of situations under stress.

- Self-Learning Ability: A fast learner with the capability to research and troubleshoot issues independently before seeking assistance.

- Organizational Skills: Well-organized and detail-oriented approach to work.

- Full-Time Commitment: Willingness to dedicate full time to the role, with the opportunity for growth and development within the company.

- Flexibility: Ability to work long shifts when needed, with the understanding that Field Engineers (FEs) may need to stay late until the job is done.



About the role:

- Remote Position: This is a fully remote job where you will work from your location, managing installations and support virtually.

- Collaboration: Work closely with on-site technicians to complete AI system installations, including troubleshooting issues during the process. You will guide the on-the-ground technician through various installation steps.

- Communication: Effectively communicate with external personnel from our partners and customers as needed.

- Task Management: Handle installation-related tasks assigned by the company.



Please fill out the form so we can get started!

title: (Non-voice Job)Client & Campaign Manager
description:
Client & Campaign Manager



Starlight Marketing | Remote



Imagine leading a campaign that actually moves the needle. That’s what this role is all about. As the Client & Campaign Manager at Starlight Marketing, you won’t just be checking boxes—you’ll be crafting experiences, guiding teams, and delivering results that clients notice.



You’ll take campaigns from concept to reality. From brainstorming ideas with our creatives, coordinating social media execution, to ensuring every deliverable hits the mark—you’ll own it all. Clients will rely on you, and your team will look to you for direction and clarity.



Success in this role isn’t measured by hours logged—it’s measured by impact, creativity, and execution. You’ll identify where processes can improve, spot gaps before they become problems, and make sure every campaign runs smoother than the last.



We’re looking for someone who thrives when given autonomy and responsibility, who loves turning strategy into action, and who’s energized by mentoring a team while delivering excellence for clients.



This is fully remote and long-term, with opportunities to grow into leadership roles as Starlight Marketing expands. If you want to own campaigns, lead a team, and be the driving force behind client success, this is the role for you.

title: Customer Support Manager (Ecommerce)
description:
FULL-TIME, LONG-TERM, EXCLUSIVE ROLE ONLY

No part-time work, agency setups, or side commitments.



We are a fast-growing supplement brand looking for a Customer Support Manager who is genuinely obsessed with efficiency and continuous improvement. This is not a role for someone who just wants to maintain the status quo or follow a manual. We need a leader who looks at a process and immediately thinks of three ways to make it faster, smarter, and better.

You will be responsible for building and scaling our support operations. We want someone who takes deep pride in ownership, turns chaos into systems, and ensures our customer experience is a competitive advantage. If you are a builder who thrives on fixing broken workflows and implementing high-level strategy, we want to talk to you.

 

What You Will Do



* Optimize & Implement: You will be the architect of our CS roadmap, constantly auditing and improving systems to ensure we stay ahead of our growth.

* System Ownership: Beyond just managing tickets, you will create, improve, and maintain our entire library of SOPs, macros, and internal documentation.

* Problem Identification: You will proactively identify patterns in customer friction and work across departments to solve issues at the root.

* Tech Stack Management: Take full ownership of our tools (Gorgias, Shopify, etc.), ensuring all automations, rules, and integrations are running at peak performance.

* Accountability: Own the department KPIs (CSAT, Resolution Time, Efficiency) and use data to drive every decision you make.

* Hiring: Hire, promote, and remove underperformers to maintain a high-output, accountable team culture

* Lead by Example: Set the standard for communication and problem-solving, eventually leading the hiring and training as the team scales.

 

Qualifications



* 5+ years leading customer service teams of 15+ in a fast-paced eCommerce environment

* Obsession with Improvement: You must be able to demonstrate how you have personally improved a system, workflow, or department in a previous role.

* Shopify Expert: Strong hands-on experience with Shopify and its ecosystem of apps.

* Tool Mastery: Advanced proficiency in Gorgias, Zendesk, or similar platforms, specifically in building out automations and complex workflows.

* Strategic Thinker: Ability to translate raw data into actionable process changes.

* Communication: Exceptional written and verbal English with the ability to lead with authority and clarity.

* Commitment: Willingness to commit full-time and exclusively to our brand for the long term.

 

This Role is Not for You If:



* You view this as "just a job" rather than something you take personal pride in building

* You need step-by-step direction and shy away from strategic decisions

* You're uncomfortable holding people accountable or addressing underperformance

* You present problems instead of solving them

* You want a comfortable, predictable 9-to-5 job



Click here to apply :

title: Executive Virtual Assistant – Operations & AI-Enabled Support
description:
Full Time | Remote | Supporting Australian Businesses



We are a fast-growing Australian technology company operating across digital health, AI systems and venture innovation. We are seeking a highly capable, detail-oriented Executive Virtual Assistant to work directly with the Founder and support day-to-day operations across the business.



This is not a basic admin role. This is a high-trust, high-responsibility position requiring strong dilligence, excellent communication, and comfort working alongside AI systems.



About the Role



You will be responsible for operational coordination, customer communications, and executive support. You will work closely with AI tools that handle the majority of first-line responses, and you will manage escalations, exceptions and higher-level interactions, as well as assisting with basic finance administration and logistics. Training will be provided.

You will act as a key point of coordination across systems, teams and clients.



This is a full-time position working Australia hours with flexibility required for outside hour engagement.



Key Responsibilities:



Zoho & Support Management

Manage Zoho CRM, Zoho Desk and other related systems

Monitor and respond to support tickets (AI drafts and can answer ~90% of standard responses)

Escalate complex matters appropriately

Maintain clean records and structured data

AI-Escalated Calls & Customer Support

Respond to calls escalated by AI systems

Handle customer queries professionally and confidently

Ensure issues are documented and resolved, maintaining and ongoing training of AI systems.

Provide strong, empathetic customer service



Executive Support



Manage
s across multiple accounts.

Coordinate calendars, meetings and priorities

Attend sales meetings and track action items and be able to liaise with customers on activities.

Ensure follow-through and accountability on tasks



Operations & Administration



Confirm payments and track invoicing processes

Support logistics and coordination tasks

Maintain structured documentation and records

Assist with internal reporting and process management



Essential Requirements



Excellent written and spoken English 

Strong attention to detail

High level of confidentiality and discretion

Strong internet and technical literacy

Confident using AI tools and digital systems

Confident skills in Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook

Ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously

Strong customer service capability

Comfortable using Microsoft Teams and video conferencing

Stable, high-speed internet connection and laptop/head phones.



Highly Regarded



Experience with Zoho (CRM, Desk, Books, Flow etc.)

Experience working with Australian businesses

Experience supporting founders

Background experience in technology, SaaS or health sectors



Personal Attributes



Calm under pressure

Highly organised and structured

Proactive and solution-oriented

Comfortable learning new tools and systems

Professional and personable

Flexible with occasional availability outside standard hours (when required)

title: APEX Futures Nasdaq Trading Mentor & Manager – Monitor 2 Traders (Makati Preferred)
description:
FUTURES Trading Mentor & Manager (NOT Forex) – Must Have Prior Payout (Apex)



Organization: Nonprofit NGO Trading Group

Location: Makati/Manila Preferred (Philippines Only)

Schedule: Hybrid (In-person + Virtual)

	•	In-person: 3x/week in Makati, 4–5 hours/day

	•	Other days: Virtual monitoring/coaching

	•	Mostly evenings (PH time) | Mon–Fri

Compensation: PHP 6,500/month





About Us



We are a nonprofit NGO group using disciplined FUTURES trading to support charitable programs. This is mission-driven work focused on structure, accountability, and developing traders the right way.





Role Summary



We are hiring a FUTURES Trading Mentor & Manager to teach, guide, and DAILY monitor two scholar traders (primarily NASDAQ futures / NQ).



This role is NOT for signal sellers or general traders. Many people can place trades, but very few can consistently follow prop firm rules and actually secure payouts—especially under trailing drawdown.



We need someone who has already received at least one payout (Apex or similar futures prop firm) and can teach students how to refine strategy, improve risk management, and become profitable AND compliant under funded account rules.



You will actively monitor performance, P&L, rule compliance, and account progress, and report daily to the nonprofit.





Key Responsibilities



You will manage and mentor two FUTURES traders, including:

	•	Daily monitoring of trades (entries/exits, discipline, execution quality)

	•	Monitoring Profit & Loss (P&L) and account progression

	•	Ensuring safe, consistent execution (no gambling / no high-risk behavior)

	•	Teaching and enforcing futures prop firm rules, especially:

	•	Apex Trader Funding (PRIORITY) — FUTURES ONLY

	•	Trailing drawdown rules

	•	Daily loss limits, risk limits, and consistency requirements

	•	Payout readiness and account management

	•	Providing structured feedback, corrections, and improvement plans

	•	Holding traders accountable and consistent

	•	Daily progress reporting to the nonprofit





STRICT Requirements (Apply Only If You Qualify)

	•	Minimum 2 years professional FUTURES trading experience

	•	Must have Apex funded account experience and understand the rules clearly

	•	Must have received at least one payout (Apex or similar futures prop firm)

	•	Proof required (screenshot acceptable)

	•	Able to teach and enforce:

	•	Trailing drawdown

	•	Risk management and consistency rules

	•	Futures prop firm compliance and payout readiness

	•	Able to do in-person mentoring 3x/week in Makati (4–5 hrs/day)

	•	Makati/Manila preferred





IMPORTANT: FUTURES ONLY (NOT Forex)



Do NOT apply if you only trade Forex.

This role is strictly for FUTURES traders, especially those who understand funded account rules and have proven they can reach payout—not just place trades.







How to Apply (WhatsApp Only)



Contact Michelle on WhatsApp:


Send:

	1.	Short resume or trading background

	2.	Proof of futures trading experience

	3.	Proof of at least one payout (screenshot OK)

	4.	Prop firm history (Apex required)

	5.	Availability confirmation (in-person Makati 3x/week + evenings)

title: Power BI practitioner
description:
Looking for a Power BI Practitioner (Performance Management Platform)

I’m developing a performance management platform focused on KPIs, dashboards, and management reporting — starting in agribusiness and designed to scale into other sectors.

Importantly, this is not a greenfield idea.

I already have a working performance system in use within real operations (data capture/import currently Excel- and Power BI-based, not web-based).

The system is actively used for weekly and monthly management reviews and operational decision-making, but the Excel and Power BI models and dashboards now require expert review, refinement, and strengthening.________________________________________

MVP-Lite Objective

The initial trial phase (MVP-Lite) is to:

• Refine and professionalise the existing Excel and Power BI models

• Improve KPI structure and data modelling

• Prepare the data layer for eventual transition into a lightweight web application

Power BI will remain the primary reporting layer.

The web application (Phase 1) will be simple — its role is to:

• Structure and validate data

• Expose clean data (database / data warehouse / API) to Power BI

________________________________________

What I’m Looking For

A Power BI expert with strong data modelling capability who can assist with:

• Reviewing and refining existing data models

• Improving DAX logic and KPI calculations

• Ensuring scalability for future web-based integration

• Supporting clean data imports (Excel / CSV)

This is an intentionally small, focused engagement.

________________________________________

Scope – Phase 1

• ~5–10 hours per week

• 2–4 weeks

• Proof of concept, not a full platform build

________________________________________

Future Phases

If successful, subsequent phases would aim to:

• Expand features and strengthen model architecture

• Scale to other sectors and countries within the region

• Increase time commitment significantly

• Potentially evolve the role into a technical lead, including building a small team

________________________________________

This is not an ERP or e-commerce project — it is a practical performance system used by managers to make decisions.

If this sounds interesting, I’d welcome a short call.

Please let me know:

1. Your experience with complex Power BI modelling and DAX

2. Examples of dashboards built for operational or management reporting

3. Your availability over the next few weeks

Best regards,

Giancarlo
